ingredients: TJ's Fire Roasted Diced Green Chiles, for garnish (optional)
title: Biscuits & Spicy Soy Chorizo Gravy
directions:
Cook biscuits according to package directions. Remove soy chorizo from casing. In a large skillet over medium heat, add soy chorizo, breaking it up into pieces as it cooks, about 8-10 minutes. When soy chorizo reaches 165ºF, reduce heat to medium. Add salsa and stir to combine. Add almond milk to pan and cook for 5-7 minutes as gravy thickens, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat.
To serve, break open 2 biscuits in a shallow serving dish and top with 1/4 of gravy and green chiles, if using. Repeat with remaining biscuits and gravy and serve immediately.Cook biscuits according to package directions. Remove soy chorizo from casing. Add almond milk to pan and cook for 5-7 minutes as gravy thickens, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat.To serve, break open 2 biscuits in a shallow serving dish and top with 1/4 of gravy and green chiles, if using. Repeat with remaining biscuits and gravy and serve immediately.

ingredients: 1 pkg TJ's Red & White Belgian Endives
1 log TJ's Cranberry Chevre (seasonal), softened to room temperature
directions: Separate whole endive leaves from the base, rinse and pat dry. Spread cheese evenly on the individual endive leaves, then sprinkle with sliced almonds for garnish and a little crunch.
title: Cranberry Endives
Strawberry Icebox Cake
ingredients: 1 bag TJ's Organic Vanilla Wafer Cookies
1 pound TJ's Strawberries, rinsed and dried
1 teaspoon TJ's Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract
3/4 cup TJ's Organic Powdered Sugar, divided
Zest of 1 TJ's Lemon, for garnish (optional)
directions:
Set aside a handful of cookies and 3-4 large strawberries for garnish. Hull and chop remaining strawberries and place in a medium bowl.  Gently fold in 1/4 cup powdered sugar. Set aside and let berries macerate in their juices. 
In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment (or, using a hand mixer), whip the heavy cream at medium-high speed until peaks form. Add mascarpone, vanilla and 1/2 cup of powdered sugar and whip until the mascarpone cheese is evenly blended into cream, stopping to scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed.
 Arrange a single layer of cookies on the bottom of an 8-inch square baking pan. Break a few more cookies and fill the open spots in the pan so it is mostly covered. 
Spread 1/3 of the whipped cream mixture evenly atop the wafers. Top whipped cream with 1/2 of the strawberries. Create one more layer of cookies, followed by 1/3 of the whipped cream and the remaining strawberries. Top with the remaining whipped cream. Cover and refrigerate for several hours, or up to a day before serving.
Just before serving, halve the remaining cookies, and hull and chop the remaining strawberries. Garnish cake with cookies and strawberries, followed by a shower of lemon zest, if using. Serve immediately.Set aside a handful of cookies and 3-4 large strawberries for garnish. Hull and chop remaining strawberries and place in a medium bowl.  Gently fold in 1/4 cup powdered sugar. Serve immediately.

title: Egg JoeMuffin
ingredients: 1 package TJ's Egg Frittata, microwaved according to package instructions
4 slices TJ's Fully Cooked Bacon, microwaved according to package instructions
directions: Split muffins and toast to desired doneness. Layer arugula, 1 frittata, a couple of tomato slices, and 2 slices of bacon on bottom half of toasted muffin. Drizzle with sriracha sauce and cover with top half of muffin. Repeat steps with remaining ingredients. Serve immediately.Split muffins and toast to desired doneness. Layer arugula, 1 frittata, a couple of tomato slices, and 2 slices of bacon on bottom half of toasted muffin. Drizzle with sriracha sauce and cover with top half of muffin. Repeat steps with remaining ingredients. Serve immediately.

ingredients: 1 cup TJ's Organic Unsweetened Flake Coconut, divided
2 tablespoons TJ's Gluten Free All-Purpose Flour
1 teaspoon TJ's Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract
1 TJ's Gluten Free Pie Crust, baked according to package directions (seasonal)
directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F. Spread flake coconut on a medium sized baking sheet. Bake on center rack of oven for 3-5 minutes, until lightly browned. Remove from oven and set aside to cool.
In a medium bowl, beat eggs with a fork, set aside. In a medium saucepan, combine sugar, flour and salt. Stir in coconut cream. Cook over medium-high heat, stirring constantly, until thickened and bubbly. Remove from heat.
Slowly pour half of the hot coconut cream mixture into the beaten eggs, stirring to combine. Return egg mixture to cream mixture in saucepan and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until almost boiling (do not boil!). Reduce heat to low and cook 2 minutes more. Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla and half of the toasted coconut.
Pour coconut mixture into the prepared pie crust and sprinkle with remaining toasted coconut. Cover pie with cling wrap and chill 3-4 hours before serving.Preheat oven to 350°F. Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla and half of the toasted coconut.Pour coconut mixture into the prepared pie crust and sprinkle with remaining toasted coconut. Cover pie with cling wrap and chill 3-4 hours before serving.
title: Coconut Cream Pie

directions:
Add soup to a medium saucepan. Heat over medium-low, stirring occasionally.
While soup heats, microwave channa masala according to package directions; stir.
Divide soup among 4 shallow serving bowls. Divide channa masala and gently spoon atop center of soup. Garnish with a dollop of yogurt and a sprinkle of chopped parsley. Enjoy!Add soup to a medium saucepan. Heat over medium-low, stirring occasionally.While soup heats, microwave channa masala according to package directions; stir.Divide soup among 4 shallow serving bowls. Divide channa masala and gently spoon atop center of soup. Garnish with a dollop of yogurt and a sprinkle of chopped parsley. Enjoy!
title: Channa Masala Tomato Soup
ingredients: 1 package TJ's Organic Low Sodium Tomato & Roasted Red Pepper Soup
TJ's Greek Yogurt or Sour Cream and chopped parsley (optional), for garnish
TJ's Malabari Paratha (optional), cooked according to package directions, for dipping
1 can TJ's Yellowfin Tuna in Olive Oil, drained
1 Tbsp diced TJ's Red Bell Pepper
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste
1 TJ's Avocado, sliced in half and pit removed
title: Stuffed Avocado
directions: In a medium bowl, combine tuna, mayo, onion, celery, bell pepper, parsley, salt and pepper. For a creamier texture, scrape a spoonful of avocado from each side and add to the bowl. Mash the tuna salad with a fork until well incorporated. Spoon the tuna salad back into each avocado half. Serve and enjoy!In a medium bowl, combine tuna, mayo, onion, celery, bell pepper, parsley, salt and pepper. For a creamier texture, scrape a spoonful of avocado from each side and add to the bowl. Mash the tuna salad with a fork until well incorporated. Spoon the tuna salad back into each avocado half. Serve and enjoy!

title: Iced Chai Latte
ingredients: 6 tablespoons TJ's Spicy Chai Tea Latte Mix
1 cup TJ's Cold Brew Coffee Concentrate
2 teaspoons TJ's Spicy Chai Tea Latte Mix
1 teaspoon TJ's Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract
directions:
To make whipped cream: in a large bowl, with a hand mixer or stand mixer combine: 1/2 cup heavy cream, 2 teaspoons Chai Mix and 1 teaspoon Bourbon Vanilla Extract. Whip until stiff peaks form, about 4 minutes. Set aside.
To make chai iced latte: In a medium-sized pitcher, whisk together 6 tablespoons chai mix and 1/2 cup hot water until mix completely dissolves. Add 1 cup cold brew to pitcher and stir until combined. Serve chilled or pour over ice (we recommend making your own cold brew ice cubes), then top with reserved whipped cream.To make whipped cream: in a large bowl, with a hand mixer or stand mixer combine: 1/2 cup heavy cream, 2 teaspoons Chai Mix and 1 teaspoon Bourbon Vanilla Extract. Whip until stiff peaks form, about 4 minutes. Set aside.To make chai iced latte: In a medium-sized pitcher, whisk together 6 tablespoons chai mix and 1/2 cup hot water until mix completely dissolves. Add 1 cup cold brew to pitcher and stir until combined. Serve chilled or pour over ice (we recommend making your own cold brew ice cubes), then top with reserved whipped cream.

title: Sausage & Kale Stuffing
directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a 13x9-inch casserole dish with canola oil spray and set aside.
In a large saucepan, mix butter, water and seasoning pouch from stuffing mix and bring to a low boil for 3-5 minutes. Remove from heat and gently fold in croutons until thoroughly moistened. Transfer to a large bowl, cover and let sit 10 minutes.
While stuffing sits, heat a large sauté pan or skillet over medium. Add sausage to pan and sauté, stirring occasionally, until cooked through, about 8 minutes. Add kale to pan and sauté a few minutes more to wilt. Remove from heat and stir in chestnuts.
Gently fold sausage mixture into stuffing until evenly distributed. Transfer to casserole dish in an even layer. Top with a generous handful of cheese.
Place dish on center rack of oven and bake until center is heated through and top is golden brown, 30-45 minutes. Remove stuffing from oven and let cool slightly. Serve with gravy and cranberry sauce on the side.Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a 13x9-inch casserole dish with canola oil spray and set aside.In a large saucepan, mix butter, water and seasoning pouch from stuffing mix and bring to a low boil for 3-5 minutes. Top with a generous handful of cheese.Place dish on center rack of oven and bake until center is heated through and top is golden brown, 30-45 minutes. Remove stuffing from oven and let cool slightly. Serve with gravy and cranberry sauce on the side.
ingredients: 1 lb. TJ's Sweet Italian Pork Sausage or Hot Italian Pork Sausage, casing removed
½ bag TJ's Organic Tuscan Kale
1 package TJ's Organic Cooked & Peeled Chestnuts, halved
TJ's Shaved Parmesan, Romano & Asiago Cheese
TJ's Cranberry Sauce & Turkey Gravy (optional), for serving

title: Balsamic Lentil Sauté
ingredients: 1 pouch TJ's Frozen Organic Brown Rice, heated
2 large handfuls of TJ's Baby Spinach
2 tablespoon TJ's Sundried Tomatoes in Olive Oil
2 medium TJ's Garlic Cloves, peeled and diced
1 tablespoons TJ's Extra Virgin Olive Oil
directions: Add onions to a large skillet on medium heat then stir in olive oil and garlic. Add spinach and bell pepper and cook until spinach begins to wilt. Empty half the package of lentils into the mix and then add sundried tomatoes. Heat and stir another two minutes and then mix in the parsley and balsamic glaze. Divide brown rice onto individual plates and ladle sauté over each serving.

ingredients: 1 slice TJ's Uncured Apple Smoked Bacon, diced
1 TJ's Wheat or Whole Grain Bagel, sliced in half and toasted
directions: In a small pan over medium heat, add bacon and cook until browned, about two minutes. Toss in kale and stir until wilted about two more minutes. Remove from pan and set aside. Give the pan a spray with canola oil then fry your egg as desired. Arrange kale, bacon and fried egg over the toasted bagel and enjoy! Serve with fresh fruit.
title: Kale & Bacon Breakfast Bagel

½ bag TJ's Organic Tuscan Kale

Mini Tropical Ice Cream Sandwiches
directions: Place a spoonful of mango sorbet on one cookie and flatten with the back of the spoon, taking care not to press too hard – these cookies are fragile! Repeat with the vanilla ice cream. Combine each side of your sandwich and place on a baking sheet in the freezer. Keep sandwiches in freezer until ready to serve. Enjoy!Place a spoonful of mango sorbet on one cookie and flatten with the back of the spoon, taking care not to press too hard – these cookies are fragile! Repeat with the vanilla ice cream. Combine each side of your sandwich and place on a baking sheet in the freezer. Keep sandwiches in freezer until ready to serve. Enjoy!
ingredients: 1 package TJ's Toasted Meyer Lemon Thins
1 container TJ's French Vanilla Ice Cream

title: Garlic Potato Pizza
directions:
Place a pizza stone or baking sheet on the center rack of oven and preheat to 450°F. Peel away the loose skin of the garlic, leaving the heads intact. Trim 1/4 inch off the top of the garlic heads and place in small squares of aluminum foil. Drizzle exposed garlic cloves with olive oil and wrap tightly with foil. Bake about 30 minutes, remove from oven and set aside.
While garlic cooks, gently remove dough from bag, halve and place on a lightly floured work surface; let sit at room temperature for 30 minutes. Add 1 tablespoon olive oil and onions to a skillet over medium-low heat. Sauté about 20 minutes until golden brown. Remove from heat and set aside. Slice potatoes very thinly with a sharp knife or on a mandoline and set aside. Unwrap garlic heads and squeeze roasted cloves into a small bowl. Mash with a fork and set aside.
Stretch one piece of dough by hand or rolling pin to 8 inches in diameter. Place on a lightly floured pizza peel or cutting board. Brush dough with olive oil cover with half of the roasted garlic. Top with half of the potatoes and onions. Strip rosemary from stems and sprinkle half atop pizza.
Gently slide pizza onto preheated stone or baking sheet and bake 5-10 minutes, or until crust is blistered and potatoes are golden around the edges. Remove from oven with pizza peel, transfer to a cutting board and drizzle lightly with olive oil. Repeat pizza prep with remaining dough and ingredients. Slice and enjoy!Place a pizza stone or baking sheet on the center rack of oven and preheat to 450°F. Peel away the loose skin of the garlic, leaving the heads intact. ingredients: 1 package TJ's Garlic & Herb Pizza Dough
TJ's Spanish Extra Virgin Olive Oil

title: Pumpkin Madeleine Cookie Sandwiches
ingredients: 2 packages TJ's Spiced Pumpkin Madeleine Cookies (seasonal)
directions:
Add cream cheese, powdered sugar, and cinnamon to a medium sized bowl. Use a hand mixer or spoon and mix thoroughly until combined.
Hold a madeleine cookie shell side-down and frost generously with cream cheese frosting. Top with another cookie. Repeat process with remaining ingredients. Enjoy sandwiches immediately, or refrigerate up to four hours before serving.Add cream cheese, powdered sugar, and cinnamon to a medium sized bowl. Use a hand mixer or spoon and mix thoroughly until combined.Hold a madeleine cookie shell side-down and frost generously with cream cheese frosting. Top with another cookie. Place corn and sauce pellets into a microwave safe dish, cover and cook on HIGH for 3 minutes. Remove cover, stir gently, and cook 1 minute longer.
Transfer potato salad to a large serving bowl. Gently fold corn and bell pepper into potato salad. Garnish with cheese and cilantro and serve.Place corn and sauce pellets into a microwave safe dish, cover and cook on HIGH for 3 minutes. Remove cover, stir gently, and cook 1 minute longer.Transfer potato salad to a large serving bowl. Gently fold corn and bell pepper into potato salad. Garnish with cheese and cilantro and serve.
title: Elote Potato Salad
ingredients: 1 package TJ's Mexican Style Roasted Corn & Cotija Cheese, reserve included cheese packet for garnish
1 TJ's Red Bell Pepper, cored, de-seeded and diced
1 container TJ's Old Fashioned Potato Salad

title: Smoky Sriracha Baked Beans
ingredients: 1/2 package TJ's Uncured Bacon Ends & Pieces (optional), chopped
1/2 cup TJ's Organic Sriracha & Roasted Garlic BBQ Sauce
TJ's Cilantro or Chives or Parsley (optional), chopped for garnish
directions:
Preheat oven to 400º F. Heat a large skillet over medium flame, add bacon and brown 5-7 minutes. Remove bacon and set on a paper towel lined plate to drain. Pour off bacon fat from pan; add onion to pan and sauté until translucent, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat.
Pour beans into a 9x13 baking dish. Add bacon, onion, and bbq sauce and stir to combine. Place dish on center rack of oven and bake for 45-50 minutes, or until beans are bubbly, caramelized around the edges and slightly browned on top. Remove dish from oven and let cool 5 minutes. Garnish with cilantro, chives or parsley and enjoy!Preheat oven to 400º F. Heat a large skillet over medium flame, add bacon and brown 5-7 minutes. Remove bacon and set on a paper towel lined plate to drain. Pour off bacon fat from pan; add onion to pan and sauté until translucent, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat.Pour beans into a 9x13 baking dish. Add bacon, onion, and bbq sauce and stir to combine. Place dish on center rack of oven and bake for 45-50 minutes, or until beans are bubbly, caramelized around the edges and slightly browned on top. Remove dish from oven and let cool 5 minutes. Garnish with cilantro, chives or parsley and enjoy!

title: Fall Sparkler
directions: Mix cranberry juice, ginger beer and apple cider in a large pitcher with ice. Pour into glasses, garnish with orange slices and serve.Mix cranberry juice, ginger beer and apple cider in a large pitcher with ice. Pour into glasses, garnish with orange slices and serve.

ingredients: ¾ cup TJ's Organic Brown Sugar
1/3 cup TJ's Gluten Free Rolled Oats
1/3 cup TJ's Unsalted Dry Toasted Pecan Pieces
1 teaspoon TJ's Pumpkin Pie Spice (seasonal) or TJ's Ground Cinnamon
directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F. Core apples using an apple corer or sharp paring knife, making sure all of the hard core and seeds are scooped out. Set aside.
In a medium-sized mixing bowl, combine dates, pecans, brown sugar, oats, pumpkin pie spice, and softened butter. Stuff cored apples with the date mixture, making sure to completely fill the hole left from the core.
Place stuffed apples in a 9 x 13-inch baking dish and pour spiced cider into the bottom of the dish. Cover with aluminum foil and bake on center rack of oven for 30 minutes. Remove foil and continue to bake for an additional 10-20 minutes, or until apples are easily pierced with a fork.
Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Serve warm as-is, or alongside a scoop of Trader Joe's Super Premium French Vanilla Ice Cream.Preheat oven to 350°F. title: Baked Apples
Veggie Burger with Almond Butter Turmeric Slaw
directions:
Preheat oven to 425°F. Place burgers on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake 20 minutes on center rack of oven, flipping burgers halfway through cooking; remove from heat.
While burgers bake, in a small bowl, toss sweet potato rounds with olive oil. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Heat a grill pan to medium-high. Grill sweet potatoes 3-4 minutes per side; remove from heat.
In a medium bowl, toss shredded cabbage with salad dressing; set aside.
To assemble: place a veggie burger on the bottom half of a hamburger bun. Top with sweet potato rounds, slaw, sliced avocado, and top half of bun. Repeat with remaining ingredients and serve immdiately.Preheat oven to 425°F. Place burgers on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. ingredients: 2 TJ's Sweet Potatoes, peeled and sliced into 1/4" rounds
1 bag TJ's Organic Shredded Cabbage & Carrots
1-2 tablespoons TJ's Almond Butter Turmeric Salad Dressing
2 TJ's Cage Free Fresh Hard-Cooked Eggs, halved

title: Spicy Avocado Hummus Toast
directions: Toast roll halves in toaster or oven for 5 minutes, until crisp and golden. Remove from oven. Slather each toast with hummus, and top with two egg halves and a few tomato slices. Season with salt & pepper and enjoy!Toast roll halves in toaster or oven for 5 minutes, until crisp and golden. Remove from oven. Slather each toast with hummus, and top with two egg halves and a few tomato slices. Season with salt & pepper and enjoy!

title: G.O.A.T. (Greatest Of All Toast)
directions: Toast multigrain bread to desired level of doneness. Top each piece of toast with a goat cheese disk and spread to cover evenly. Top with peach slices and basil. Drizzle with oil & herbs from cheese container, if desired. Enjoy!Toast multigrain bread to desired level of doneness. Top each piece of toast with a goat cheese disk and spread to cover evenly. Top with peach slices and basil. Drizzle with oil & herbs from cheese container, if desired. Enjoy!
ingredients: 1 container TJ's Goat's Milk Cheese Marinated With Herbs, softened to room temperature
4 TJ's Cling Peach Halves, thinly sliced
TJ's Fresh Basil, chopped for garnish

directions: Generously slather a crispbread with cream cheese. Sprinkle liberally with seasoning blend and top with fresh dill. Enjoy!Generously slather a crispbread with cream cheese. Sprinkle liberally with seasoning blend and top with fresh dill. Enjoy!
title: Everything Cream Cheese Crispbreads
ingredients: TJ's Everything But The Bagel Sesame Seasoning Blend

title: Cocoa Crunch Milkshake
directions:
Coat the inside of two tall glasses with a few drizzles of chocolate syrup. Place in the freezer to chill.
Place cereal and milk in a bowl; refrigerate for 15 minutes to infuse. Add cereal and milk to a blender pitcher, along with 4 heaping scoops of ice cream. Blend until ingredients are fully incorporated.
Remove glasses from freezer and divide milkshake evenly among glasses. Garnish with chipped cream, chocolate syrup and cereal. Enjoy immediately.Coat the inside of two tall glasses with a few drizzles of chocolate syrup. Place in the freezer to chill.Place cereal and milk in a bowl; refrigerate for 15 minutes to infuse. Add cereal and milk to a blender pitcher, along with 4 heaping scoops of ice cream. Blend until ingredients are fully incorporated.Remove glasses from freezer and divide milkshake evenly among glasses. Garnish with chipped cream, chocolate syrup and cereal. Enjoy immediately.
ingredients: TJ's Midnight Moo Chocolate Flavored Syrup
1 cup TJ's Gluten Free Cocoa Crunch Cereal, plus more for garnish
1 cup TJ's Whole Milk or TJ's Chocolate Whole Milk made with Fair Trade Cocoa

title: Chocolate Mint Star Brownies
ingredients: 1 package TJ's Mini Dark Chocolate Mint Stars (seasonal), divided in half
1 package TJ's Brownie Truffle Baking Mix
directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8 x 8 x 2 baking pan with butter or cooking spray and set aside.
Chop roughly ½ package of the cookies into pieces and set aside.
Melt butter until creamy-looking (approx. 1 minute in microwave or 5 minutes in saucepan over medium heat).
Whisk eggs into melted butter until blended.
Add brownie mix and stir until moistened. Mix in chopped cookies.
Spread batter in pan, filling corners and leveling top.
Bake for 25 – 30 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean. Allow to cool for 30 minutes before removing from pan.
Once cooled, cut brownies into squares. Using a butter knife, spread an even layer of fudge sauce on top of each brownie. Place remaining cookies on top of each brownie to decorate.
Enjoy!Preheat oven to 350°F. Mix in chopped cookies.Spread batter in pan, filling corners and leveling top.Bake for 25 – 30 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean. Allow to cool for 30 minutes before removing from pan.Once cooled, cut brownies into squares. Using a butter knife, spread an even layer of fudge sauce on top of each brownie. Place remaining cookies on top of each brownie to decorate.Enjoy!

title: Pineapple Upside Down Cake
directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F. Add 1/4 cup butter to an 8-inch square baking pan and place in oven to melt, 3-5 minutes. Remove pan from oven and sprinkle brown sugar over butter. Layer pineapple fans over butter and sugar mixture to cover base of pan; set aside.
In a large bowl, add cake mix, eggs, melted butter and milk. Stir to combine. Pour cake batter evenly atop pineapple fans. Place pan in oven on center rack and bake 45 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove pan from oven and immediately run a knife around edges to loosen cake. Carefully flip pan onto a heatproof serving plate. Leave pan over plate for 5 minutes.
Remove baking pan and rearrange any pineapple slices that did not transfer to the cake. Serve warm, with TJ's Vanilla Ice Cream, if desired.Preheat oven to 350°F. Add 1/4 cup butter to an 8-inch square baking pan and place in oven to melt, 3-5 minutes. Remove pan from oven and sprinkle brown sugar over butter. Layer pineapple fans over butter and sugar mixture to cover base of pan; set aside.In a large bowl, add cake mix, eggs, melted butter and milk. Stir to combine. Pour cake batter evenly atop pineapple fans. Place pan in oven on center rack and bake 45 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove pan from oven and immediately run a knife around edges to loosen cake. Carefully flip pan onto a heatproof serving plate. Leave pan over plate for 5 minutes.Remove baking pan and rearrange any pineapple slices that did not transfer to the cake. Serve warm, with TJ's Vanilla Ice Cream, if desired.
ingredients: 5 TJ's Fresh Pineapple Spears, sliced into small fans
1 box TJ's Vanilla Cake & Baking Mix

directions:
In a small bowl, combine diced red onion, vinegar and sugar; set aside to "quick-pickle" the onions for a few minutes.
Drain the onions, reserving vinegar solution for the dressing. In a medium bowl, combine the shredded cabbage, raisins, and onions; set aside.
Add mayonnaise, salt and pepper to the "quick-pickle" vinegar solution and stir until well incorporated. Gently toss the dressing with the cabbage mixture, then cover and chill. Fold in diced peaches just before serving.In a small bowl, combine diced red onion, vinegar and sugar; set aside to "quick-pickle" the onions for a few minutes.Drain the onions, reserving vinegar solution for the dressing. In a medium bowl, combine the shredded cabbage, raisins, and onions; set aside.Add mayonnaise, salt and pepper to the "quick-pickle" vinegar solution and stir until well incorporated. Gently toss the dressing with the cabbage mixture, then cover and chill. Fold in diced peaches just before serving.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons TJ's Unfiltered Apple Cider Vinegar
1 cup TJ's Jumbo Raisin Medley OR TJ's Organic Thompson Raisins
TJ's Sea Salt & Ground Black Pepper, or to taste
title: Peach Coleslaw

ingredients: 1 ¾ Cups TJ's Buttermilk Pancake Mix
¾ teaspoon TJ's Pumpkin Pie Spice
1 jar (12 oz) TJ's Apple Cider Jam (seasonal)
6 oz your favorite TJ's Maple Syrup
TJ's Cultured Salted Butter (optional), for serving
title: Spiced Cider Pancakes
directions:
Prepare syrup: Add jam and syrup to a microwave-safe bowl. Heat on half-power for 30 second intervals, stirring occasionally, until warm. Set aside.
Prepare pancakes: In a medium bowl, whisk pancake mix and pumpkin pie spice. In a small bowl, whisk egg and cider. Add cider mixture to dry mixture and whisk gently, just until combined. Let batter stand 10 minutes.
Preheat a large nonstick pan or griddle over medium heat. Working in batches and using a ¼ cup measure per pancake, drop batter into preheated pan. Cook 1-2 minutes, flip pancake and continue cooking 1 minute more. Serve immediately with butter and apple cider syrup. 
For a real treat, try griddling these pancakes in a cast iron skillet, with plenty of Trader Joe's Organic Coconut Oil.Prepare syrup: Add jam and syrup to a microwave-safe bowl. Lay a piece of prosciutto on a clean, dry work surface. Set a melon cube at one end, and wrap prosciutto around melon. Top with a fresh basil leaf or two, and push a toothpick through the center to secure. Enjoy!Lay a piece of prosciutto on a clean, dry work surface. 1 package TJ's Sliced Prosciutto, gently sliced in half lengthwise

ingredients: 1 package TJ's Mini Pearl Grape Tomatoes
1 package TJ's Organic Basil, cut into strips

directions: Rinse tomatoes and basil. Layer tomato, basil and mozzarella on a toothpick. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with balsamic vinaigrette for dipping.

ingredients: 1 bag TJ's Frozen Shrimp (Jumbo, Peeled, Deveined, Tail On), Defrosted
directions:
Remove polenta from casing and slice lengthwise down the center, then slice each half into half-moon shapes about 1/2" thick. Remove
sausage from packaging and slice each link on the diagonal at same thickness. Remove thawed shrimp from packaging and season with Trader Joe's South African seasoning blend on each side.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat, and spray liberally with canola oil. Saute polenta slices until golden brown, turning as necessary, and remove polenta from pan. Re-spray if necessary, and add sausage slices. When sausage is just starting to brown, add shrimp to the pan, and cook until opaque. Remove sausage and shrimp from pan.
Thread polenta slices, cooked shrimp, and sausage slices onto skewers, alternating between each ingredient. Serve with sriracha sauce for dipping.
Recipe Credit: Trader Joe's Stick It! 2013 HiiP Recipe Contest Featuring Food On A Stick 3rd Place Winner - Laura Wehrmeyer.Remove polenta from casing and slice lengthwise down the center, then slice each half into half-moon shapes about 1/2" thick. Remove
sausage from packaging and slice each link on the diagonal at same thickness. title: Shrimp & Grits On A Stick

directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Prepare three 8-inch square cake pans: use bottom of a cake pan to measure/trace 3 circles on parchment paper; cut out the circles and set aside. Spray the inside of the pans with canola oil. Place parchment circles in the pan bottoms and spray over top with canola oil. Set aside.
Prepare & Bake Cakes: in a large mixing bowl, combine eggs, melted butter, and milk. Add cake mix. Whisk together until batter is smooth; fold in orange zest. Divide batter evenly among the 3 cake pans. Place on center oven rack and bake; at 40 minutes, test cake centers with a toothpick; when toothpicks come out clean, remove cakes and let cool (in pans) for 10 minutes. After 10 minutes, run a knife around the inside of each cake pan, flip pans upside down and ease cakes out onto a cooling rack to cool completely, about 40-50 minutes.
Prepare Frosting: while cakes are cooling, make buttercream frosting. Add butter to a stand mixer (a hand mixer will work too) fitted with a paddle; beat at medium speed until creamy, about 2 minutes. Add sugar, cream, and vanilla; mix at low speed until just combined. Increase the speed to high and mix until smooth and fluffy, about 3 to 5 minutes. If it becomes too thick, add a little more cream. If it's too thin, add more powdered sugar.
Measure about 1 cup of plain buttercream frosting, set aside. Fold in diced strawberries into remaining frosting.
Assemble Cake: place dollop of frosting in center of cake stand or platter to anchor. Place first cake, top side down, over the frosting and center on the plate. Carefully apply strawberry buttercream along the edges, leaving bare a medium-sized circle in the center of the cake. Spoon 2 to 3 tablespoons of strawberry preserves into the frosting-less center; top preserves with fresh sliced strawberries. Place the next layer on top of the first and repeat strawberry buttercream, preserves and sliced strawberries steps.
Place the last cake layer on top and frost with strawberry buttercream; as lightly as you'd like, frost sides of the entire cake with plain buttercream. Decorate the top of the cake with whole strawberries and slices of orange.Preheat oven to 350°F.Prepare three 8-inch square cake pans: use bottom of a cake pan to measure/trace 3 circles on parchment paper; cut out the circles and set aside. Spray the inside of the pans with canola oil. Place parchment circles in the pan bottoms and spray over top with canola oil. Set aside.Prepare & Bake Cakes: in a large mixing bowl, combine eggs, melted butter, and milk. Add cake mix. Whisk together until batter is smooth; fold in orange zest. If it's too thin, add more powdered sugar.Measure about 1 cup of plain buttercream frosting, set aside. Fold in diced strawberries into remaining frosting.Assemble Cake: place dollop of frosting in center of cake stand or platter to anchor. Place first cake, top side down, over the frosting and center on the plate. Carefully apply strawberry buttercream along the edges, leaving bare a medium-sized circle in the center of the cake. Spoon 2 to 3 tablespoons of strawberry preserves into the frosting-less center; top preserves with fresh sliced strawberries. Place the next layer on top of the first and repeat strawberry buttercream, preserves and sliced strawberries steps.Place the last cake layer on top and frost with strawberry buttercream; as lightly as you'd like, frost sides of the entire cake with plain buttercream. Decorate the top of the cake with whole strawberries and slices of orange.
title: In the Garden of…Cake
ingredients: 2 boxes TJ's Vanilla Cake & Baking Mix
6 Fresh TJ's Strawberries, whole & beautiful with green tops
2 cans TJ's Green Jackfruit in Brine
1 1/2 cups TJ's Organic Kansas City Style BBQ Sauce
1 package TJ's Honey Wheat Hamburger Buns
1 TJ's Yellow Onion, diced for garnish
1 bag TJ's Organic Shredded Green & Red Cabbage with Orange Carrots
1/4 cup TJ's Mayonnaise (or TJ's Greek Yogurt)
title: Pulled Jackfruit Sandwich
directions:
Prepare Pulled Jackfruit: Drain jackfruit and pat dry. Partially shred jackfruit chunks into smaller pieces. In a sauté pan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add jackfruit and sauté for five minutes. Add BBQ sauce and water to pan and stir to evenly coat jackfruit. Cover pan and simmer on medium-low heat, 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally and pulling jackfruit apart as it becomes tender.
Prepare Tangy Cole Slaw: While jackfruit cooks, in a large bowl, toss cabbage blend with mayonnaise and apple cider vinegar to coat. Season with salt and pepper to taste and set aside.
Prepare Sandwiches: Place a scoop of pulled jackfruit on the bottom of a bun. Top with diced onions, coleslaw, and bun top. Eat and repeat until satisfied!Prepare Pulled Jackfruit: Drain jackfruit and pat dry. Partially shred jackfruit chunks into smaller pieces. In a sauté pan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add jackfruit and sauté for five minutes. Add BBQ sauce and water to pan and stir to evenly coat jackfruit. Cover pan and simmer on medium-low heat, 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally and pulling jackfruit apart as it becomes tender.Prepare Tangy Cole Slaw: While jackfruit cooks, in a large bowl, toss cabbage blend with mayonnaise and apple cider vinegar to coat. Season with salt and pepper to taste and set aside.Prepare Sandwiches: Place a scoop of pulled jackfruit on the bottom of a bun. Top with diced onions, coleslaw, and bun top. Eat and repeat until satisfied!

title: Poppin' Pumpkin Seeds
directions: Mix salt, paprika, cinnamon, cumin and cayenne together in a small bowl. Set aside. Warm butter (or oil) and sugar together in a large skillet over medium heat; add pumpkin seeds and spice mixture to pan and stir until sugar is melted and the seeds are fragrant, 5 to 6 minutes (add a lid when seeds start to pop). Remove from heat, add fresh rosemary and sprinkle on additional salt (if desired) and toss. Immediately spread seeds out on a parchment-lined baking sheet and cool completely before serving.Mix salt, paprika, cinnamon, cumin and cayenne together in a small bowl. Set aside. Warm butter (or oil) and sugar together in a large skillet over medium heat; add pumpkin seeds and spice mixture to pan and stir until sugar is melted and the seeds are fragrant, 5 to 6 minutes (add a lid when seeds start to pop). Remove from heat, add fresh rosemary and sprinkle on additional salt (if desired) and toss. Immediately spread seeds out on a parchment-lined baking sheet and cool completely before serving.
ingredients: 1/2 tsp TJ's Sea Salt, more to taste
2 Tbsp TJ's Clarified Butter or TJ's 100% Canola Oil
2 cups TJ's Raw Shelled Pumpkin Seeds
1 1/2 Tbsp fresh TJ's Rosemary Leaves, roughly chopped

title: Baked Banana Pudding
directions:
In a medium saucepan over medium-low heat, whisk brown sugar, half of cane sugar, flour, salt, egg yolks and milk. Cook the mixture, whisking continually to keep from scorching, 10 to 15 minutes or until thickened. Remove pan from heat, add butter and vanilla, and stir until butter is completely melted. Allow custard to cool completely.
Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a 2 1/2 quart baking dish with a pat of butter. Arrange vanilla wafers in a single layer on bottom and sides of the baking dish. Arrange banana slices in a single layer atop wafers. Repeat alternating layers with remaining wafers and bananas. Drop spoonfuls of caramel sauce over bananas. Pour the cooled custard atop the caramel sauce; set aside.
Add room temperature egg whites and lemon juice to a glass or nonreactive metal bowl of a stand mixer and whip with the whisk attachment until frothy. Add remaining cane sugar 1 tablespoon at a time, beating well after each addition, until peaks form. (Rub a bit of the beaten meringue between your thumb and forefinger to make sure sugar has dissolved; it should not feel gritty.) Use a spatula to quickly spread meringue evenly over the banana pudding.
Place banana pudding on a large rimmed baking sheet. Bake on center rack of oven about 20 minutes, or until the top of the meringue is toasted. Remove from oven and let cool 10-15 minutes before serving.In a medium saucepan over medium-low heat, whisk brown sugar, half of cane sugar, flour, salt, egg yolks and milk. Cook the mixture, whisking continually to keep from scorching, 10 to 15 minutes or until thickened. Remove pan from heat, add butter and vanilla, and stir until butter is completely melted. ingredients: 1 cup TJ's Organic Cane Sugar, divided
1/2 stick (4 tablespoons) TJ's Salted Butter, plus an extra pat
2 teaspoons TJ's Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract
1 bag TJ's Organic Vanilla Wafer Cookies
6 large TJ's Bananas, peeled and sliced
TJ's Fleur de Sel Caramel Sauce
1/4 teaspoon juice from a TJ's Lemon

title: Vegetable and Soba Noodle Shrimp Stir Fry
ingredients: 1 package TJ's Vegetable and Soba Noodle Stir Fry
1 package TJ's Fully Cooked Medium Shrimp (70-110 count)
directions:
Remove noodles from package and soak in a bowl of hot water for two minutes to soften (or microwave in a microwave safe bowl filled with water for 30 seconds). Drain and use your fingers to gently separate noodles; set aside.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high. Add vegetables and sauté 3 to 4 minutes, stirring frequently. Add noodles to skillet and sauté an additional 1 to 2 minutes, or until heated through. Add sauce and toss to coat the vegetables and noodles. Turn off heat. Add shrimp to pan and toss once more to coat. Divide among shallow serving bowls and enjoy immediately.Remove noodles from package and soak in a bowl of hot water for two minutes to soften (or microwave in a microwave safe bowl filled with water for 30 seconds). Drain and use your fingers to gently separate noodles; set aside.Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high. Add vegetables and sauté 3 to 4 minutes, stirring frequently. Add noodles to skillet and sauté an additional 1 to 2 minutes, or until heated through. Add sauce and toss to coat the vegetables and noodles. Turn off heat. Add shrimp to pan and toss once more to coat. Divide among shallow serving bowls and enjoy immediately.

ingredients: 1 Tbsp TJ's 100% Greek Kalamata Olive Oil
1/2 cup TJ's Roasted and Salted Pecans, chopped
directions:
Preheat oven to 425°F. Wash potatoes and pat dry. Rub olive oil over the skins then place potatoes directly on center rack of oven.
Bake potatoes for 45 minutes or until a fork easily pierces the skin. Remove from oven and slice down the center, halfway through, making sure not cut all the way through to the bottom.
In a medium bowl, combine arugula, sliced beets, blue cheese and salted pecans. Toss the salad gently with tongs, then divide evenly among sweet potatoes. Garnish with balsamic glaze. Enjoy!Preheat oven to 425°F. Wash potatoes and pat dry. Rub olive oil over the skins then place potatoes directly on center rack of oven.Bake potatoes for 45 minutes or until a fork easily pierces the skin. Remove from oven and slice down the center, halfway through, making sure not cut all the way through to the bottom.In a medium bowl, combine arugula, sliced beets, blue cheese and salted pecans. Toss the salad gently with tongs, then divide evenly among sweet potatoes. Garnish with balsamic glaze. Enjoy!
title: Salad Stuffed Sweet Potatoes

ingredients: 2 slices of your favorite TJ's Bread
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract
title: Cinnamon Bear Toast
directions:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place two slices of bread on a cookie sheet and begin baking for 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a small bowl, add 1 1/2 tablespoons of clarified butter, 1 tablespoon of sugar, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, a couple dashes of nutmeg and 1/4 teaspoon of vanilla extract. Stir until combined.
 
Remove bread slices from oven, flip the slices over, then spread the cinnamon-sugar mix atop each slice, smoothing the mixture all the way to the edges.
 
Place bread slices back into the oven for 7 more minutes, until the cinnamon-sugar topping bubbles slightly.
 
Remove the cinnamon toast from the oven and rest on the cookie sheet to finish toasting and cool slightly, about 2 minutes.
Slice the banana into medallions, place two "ears" and a "nose" atop each slice. Slice the bottom tips off of the strawberries, then slice the tips in half from top to bottom. Arrange the strawberry slices along the bottom edge of the toast to form a red "bow-tie". Finally, place the raisins atop the toast to form the "eyes" the tip of the "nose". Enjoy!Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place two slices of bread on a cookie sheet and begin baking for 5 minutes.Meanwhile, in a small bowl, add 1 1/2 tablespoons of clarified butter, 1 tablespoon of sugar, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, a couple dashes of nutmeg and 1/4 teaspoon of vanilla extract. Stir until combined.Remove bread slices from oven, flip the slices over, then spread the cinnamon-sugar mix atop each slice, smoothing the mixture all the way to the edges.Place bread slices back into the oven for 7 more minutes, until the cinnamon-sugar topping bubbles slightly.Remove the cinnamon toast from the oven and rest on the cookie sheet to finish toasting and cool slightly, about 2 minutes.Slice the banana into medallions, place two "ears" and a "nose" atop each slice. Slice the bottom tips off of the strawberries, then slice the tips in half from top to bottom. Arrange the strawberry slices along the bottom edge of the toast to form a red "bow-tie". Finally, place the raisins atop the toast to form the "eyes" the tip of the "nose". Enjoy!

ingredients: 1 TJ's Pound Plus 72% Dark Chocolate Bar
directions:
Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper, set aside. Add cookies to the bowl of a food processor. Pulse 10-15 times until you have fairly uniform crumbs. Transfer two handfuls of crumbs to a small bowl, set aside.
Unwrap cream cheese, break into pieces and add to food processor. Process cookies and cream cheese 10-20 seconds, until thoroughly combined. Use a small cookie scoop or two teaspoons to form mixture into small balls and place them on the prepared cookie sheet (these will be the “insides” of your truffles). Cover and freeze at least 2 hours, or overnight.
Remove cookie balls from freezer, set aside. Break up the chocolate bar into small pieces. Add 1/3 of the chocolate to a large, microwave-safe bowl or measuring cup. Microwave on half-power for 30 second intervals, stirring in between, until most of chocolate is melted. Use a fork to stir and smooth out any lumps.
Gently place a prepared cookie ball in the melted chocolate. Use a spoon to cover completely with chocolate, then lift the truffle out of the bowl with a fork to drain any excess. Place truffle back on baking sheet and sprinkle with reserved cookie crumbs. Repeat with remaining ingredients, melting more chocolate in batches as needed. Return cookie sheet to freezer for 15 minutes or until chocolate is set.
Enjoy truffles immediately, or keep refrigerated until ready to serve.Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper, set aside. Add cookies to the bowl of a food processor. Pulse 10-15 times until you have fairly uniform crumbs. Transfer two handfuls of crumbs to a small bowl, set aside.Unwrap cream cheese, break into pieces and add to food processor. Return cookie sheet to freezer for 15 minutes or until chocolate is set.Enjoy truffles immediately, or keep refrigerated until ready to serve.

title: Coconut Water Smoothie
ingredients: 1 cup (about 12) TJ's Organic Cut and Peeled Carrots

directions:
Preheat oven to 200°F. In a medium frying pan over medium-low heat, melt 1 tablespoon of butter. Add bacon and fry until soft and well browned, but not crispy, about 10 minutes. Set on a cookie sheet and place in the oven to keep warm.
Turn the frying pan heat up to medium. Fry the bangers until the turn golden brown and the juices run clear or until the internal temperature reaches 170°F. Transfer cooked bangers to the cookie sheet in the oven.
In a small saucepan over low heat, begin warming the baked beans. In another skillet, sauté mushrooms over low heat until warmed. Meanwhile, fry the tomatoes until they are browned on all sides. Once finished, add to the cookie sheet in the oven.
Add another tablespoon of butter to pan and fry the bread. Once golden, add to the warmed plate in the oven.
Finally, fry 6 eggs to your taste. Divide ingredients among 6 plates, along with the prepared Corned Beef Hash and serve.Preheat oven to 200°F. ingredients: 2 tablespoons TJ's Kerrygold Irish Unsalted Butter, divided
6 slices TJ's Uncured Apple Smoked Bacon
3 TJ's Tomatoes on the Vine, halved

title: Boatswain Chocolate Stout Float
ingredients: 1 bottle Boatswain Chocolate Stout OR Campanology's Bûche de Noël Stout
Whipped Cream & chocolate chunks (optional), for garnish
directions: Place two scoops of ice cream into a tall glass. Slowly pour stout into glass, covering scoops. Top with whipped cream and chocolate chunks. Repeat with remaining glasses and enjoy immediately.Place two scoops of ice cream into a tall glass. Slowly pour stout into glass, covering scoops. Top with whipped cream and chocolate chunks. Repeat with remaining glasses and enjoy immediately.

title: Falafel Surprise
directions:
Combine falafel mix and water in a medium sized bowl; cover and set aside for one hour.
Roughly divide falafel dough into 9 sections. Holding one piece of dough in your palm, press a teaspoon of feta into the center and mold the dough around it to conceal the feta. Repeat with remaining dough (you should have 9 dough balls).
Fill a 3-quart stockpot with sunflower oil, about four inches high. Turn heat to medium-high and heat oil to 300°F.
Working in batches, use a long-handled slotted spoon to gently lower dough balls into oil. Fry until floating and dark golden brown, 2 to 2 1/2 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel lined plate and cool 2 to 3 minutes before serving. Serve as an appetizer with your favorite hummus, or atop a bed of greens or in a toasted flatbread for a meatless meal.Combine falafel mix and water in a medium sized bowl; cover and set aside for one hour.Roughly divide falafel dough into 9 sections. Holding one piece of dough in your palm, press a teaspoon of feta into the center and mold the dough around it to conceal the feta. Repeat with remaining dough (you should have 9 dough balls).Fill a 3-quart stockpot with sunflower oil, about four inches high. Turn heat to medium-high and heat oil to 300°F.Working in batches, use a long-handled slotted spoon to gently lower dough balls into oil. Fry until floating and dark golden brown, 2 to 2 1/2 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel lined plate and cool 2 to 3 minutes before serving. Serve as an appetizer with your favorite hummus, or atop a bed of greens or in a toasted flatbread for a meatless meal.
ingredients: Your favorite TJ's Hummus, Salad Greens, and Flatbread (Flatbread, Naan, Malabari Paratha, etc.), for serving (optional)
1 container TJ's Greek Whole Milk Egg Nog Yogurt OR Cultured Coconut Nog (seasonal)
title: Egg Nog Breakfast Bowl
directions: Spoon yogurt into a small serving bowl. Top with a spoonful of preserves, a handful of granola, and a few spoonfuls of pomegranate seeds. Enjoy!Spoon yogurt into a small serving bowl. Top with a spoonful of preserves, a handful of granola, and a few spoonfuls of pomegranate seeds. Enjoy!

title: Classic Cobb Salad
ingredients: 1/2 package TJ's Fully Cooked Uncured Bacon
1 package TJ's Romaine Hearts, rinsed and chopped
16 oz. TJ's Grape Tomatoes, rinsed and halved
5 TJ's Cage Free Fresh Hard-Cooked Eggs, quartered
1 bottle TJ's Red Wine & Olive Oil Vinaigrette OR 1 jar TJ's Chunky Blue Cheese Dressing
5 food storage containers for daily meal prep
directions:
Microwave bacon according to package directions. Chop bacon into bite sized pieces. Line up your food storage containers and lay a bed of romaine at the bottom of each. Divide bacon, tomatoes, eggs, and chicken evenly among containers. Top each salad with 2 tablespoons blue cheese. Measure 2 tablespoons dressing into each sauce container. Cover and refrigerate until ready to eat. Save avocado and slice fresh each day.
When ready to eat, slice 1/3 of an avocado atop salad and drizzle with dressing. Enjoy!Microwave bacon according to package directions. Chop bacon into bite sized pieces. Line up your food storage containers and lay a bed of romaine at the bottom of each. Divide bacon, tomatoes, eggs, and chicken evenly among containers. Top each salad with 2 tablespoons blue cheese. Measure 2 tablespoons dressing into each sauce container. Cover and refrigerate until ready to eat. Combine vegetables in a large bowl. Drizzle with vinaigrette and gently toss to coat. Season to taste with salt. Chill in refrigerator for 1 hour and serve.Combine vegetables in a large bowl. Drizzle with vinaigrette and gently toss to coat. Season to taste with salt. Chill in refrigerator for 1 hour and serve.
title: Grilled Asparagus Salad
ingredients: 1 package TJ's Grilled Asparagus Spears, thawed according to package directions and chopped into large pieces
1 bag TJ's Roasted Corn, microwaved according to package directions
2 TJ's Red Bell Peppers (or Enjoya Peppers), chopped
½ to ¾ cup TJ's Organic Rosé Vinaigrette
Juice from half of a TJ's Lemon
1 ripe TJ's D'Anjou Pear, peeled, halved and cored
4 Tbsp TJ's Organic Grass Fed Plain Whole Milk Yogurt
½ cup TJ's Gluten Free Cranberry Maple Nut Granola
directions:
Preheat oven to 375°F.
Combine water, lemon juice and brown sugar in a bowl and set aside.
Place pear halves, cut side up on a foil-lined baking sheet and begin baking for about 40 minutes. Baste with lemon mixture every 10 minutes. Remove from oven once pears are fork tender. Let cool 5 minutes before serving or refrigerate overnight for use the following morning.
To serve, spoon yogurt into pear cavities then sprinkle with granola.Preheat oven to 375°F.Combine water, lemon juice and brown sugar in a bowl and set aside.Place pear halves, cut side up on a foil-lined baking sheet and begin baking for about 40 minutes. Baste with lemon mixture every 10 minutes. Remove from oven once pears are fork tender. title: Baked Pear with Yogurt and Granola
Stuffed Soft Pretzels
directions: Remove dough from package and let rest on a floured work surface for 10-15 minutes. Preheat oven to 425°F. Spray a large baking sheet with cooking spray, or line with parchment paper. In a small bowl, beat egg with water. Set aside. Roll dough into a large rectangle. Cut dough lengthwise into 4 strips with a pizza cutter. Spread cheese along one edge of a dough strip. Lightly brush the other edge of the strip with egg wash, then stretch the dough over the filling and roll until dough is closed. Repeat for remaining strips. Transfer rolls to baking sheet, seam side down. To make the pretzel shape, form each roll into a “U”, twist the ends twice around one another, then overlap the ends over the bottom of the “U”. Generously brush the egg mixture over the top of the shaped pretzel and underneath where the dough overlaps. Bake 18 to 20 minutes, until the tops of pretzels turn golden brown.Remove dough from package and let rest on a floured work surface for 10-15 minutes. Preheat oven to 425°F. Spray a large baking sheet with cooking spray, or line with parchment paper. In a small bowl, beat egg with water. Set aside. Roll dough into a large rectangle. Cut dough lengthwise into 4 strips with a pizza cutter. Spread cheese along one edge of a dough strip. Lightly brush the other edge of the strip with egg wash, then stretch the dough over the filling and roll until dough is closed. Repeat for remaining strips. Transfer rolls to baking sheet, seam side down. To make the pretzel shape, form each roll into a “U”, twist the ends twice around one another, then overlap the ends over the bottom of the “U”. Generously brush the egg mixture over the top of the shaped pretzel and underneath where the dough overlaps. Bake 18 to 20 minutes, until the tops of pretzels turn golden brown.

ingredients: 1 1/2 (16 oz) cartons TJ's Curried White Chicken Deli Salad
directions: Slice off the bottom of the romaine lettuce, then wash and separate the leaves. Place lettuce onto a large serving dish. Peel the papaya, slice in half and then remove seeds with a spoon. Place papaya halves on top of lettuce, fill each papaya with half of the curried chicken salad. Serve!Slice off the bottom of the romaine lettuce, then wash and separate the leaves. Place lettuce onto a large serving dish. Peel the papaya, slice in half and then remove seeds with a spoon. Place papaya halves on top of lettuce, fill each papaya with half of the curried chicken salad. Serve!
title: Curried Chicken Papaya

ingredients: 2 teaspoons TJ's Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil
TJ's Shaved Parmesan, Romano & Asiago Cheese
title: Warm Cruciferous Cranberry Slaw
directions: In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add olive oil. When heated, add cruciferous crunch and sauté 3 minutes until slightly wilted. Remove pan from heat and pour contents into a large bowl. Add salt and lemon juice and toss until coated. Divide greens among two plates and top with a handful of dried cranberries, almonds and cheese. Serve warm.In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add olive oil. When heated, add cruciferous crunch and sauté 3 minutes until slightly wilted. Remove pan from heat and pour contents into a large bowl. Add salt and lemon juice and toss until coated. Divide greens among two plates and top with a handful of dried cranberries, almonds and cheese. Serve warm.

Place coconut milk and mango chunks in a blender and pulse a few times, just enough until the mango chunks break into smaller pieces. Pour the mixture into a medium bowl and stir in chia seeds, shredded coconut and clover honey until well incorporated. Fill each paper cup with the mixture until about 3/4 full. Cover each cup with foil and puncture with a craft stick down the center. Stick pops in the freezer for about six hours, or until frozen through. Peel the paper away and enjoy immediately!Place coconut milk and mango chunks in a blender and pulse a few times, just enough until the mango chunks break into smaller pieces. Pour the mixture into a medium bowl and stir in chia seeds, shredded coconut and clover honey until well incorporated. Fill each paper cup with the mixture until about 3/4 full. Cover each cup with foil and puncture with a craft stick down the center. Stick pops in the freezer for about six hours, or until frozen through. Peel the paper away and enjoy immediately!
title: Mango Coconut Chia Frozen Pops

ingredients: 1 pound (4 cups) TJ's Organic Rainier Cherries (seasonal), pitted
4 ounces (1/2 cup) TJ's Dry Roasted, Unsalted Pistachio Nutmeats Halves & Pieces
1 TJ's Gourmet Pie Crust, defrosted through step one of package directions
2 Tbsp TJ's Unsalted Butter, diced & chilled
*You will also need 1 sheet of parchment paper
directions: Add pistachios to a food processor and process until about half the nuts are powdered. Sift powder into a bowl. Set aside remaining nut pieces. Add pitted cherries, sugar and lemon juice to the bowl of pistachio powder; toss well and set aside for at least 30 minutes. Place pie dough onto parchment lined baking sheet, unfold and press together any cracks or breaks; place in refrigerator for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 400°F. Remove dough from refrigerator, place cherry filling in the center of dough, sprinkle with diced butter and remaining nuts. Use the parchment as a guide to fold the dough up and pinch around cherries to form an open top shell. Gently lay the parchment back down once the shell has been formed. Pinch together any breaks in the shell to hold juices in. In a small bowl, combine 1 egg with 1 Tablespoon of cold water to create an egg wash. Brush shell with egg wash and sprinkle with turbinado sugar. Place in oven and bake for about 35 to 40 minutes or until crust is golden brown and juices are bubbling. Remove from oven and rest for at least 10 minutes before slicing.Add pistachios to a food processor and process until about half the nuts are powdered. Sift powder into a bowl. Set aside remaining nut pieces. Add pitted cherries, sugar and lemon juice to the bowl of pistachio powder; toss well and set aside for at least 30 minutes. Place pie dough onto parchment lined baking sheet, unfold and press together any cracks or breaks; place in refrigerator for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 400°F. Remove dough from refrigerator, place cherry filling in the center of dough, sprinkle with diced butter and remaining nuts. Brush shell with egg wash and sprinkle with turbinado sugar. Place in oven and bake for about 35 to 40 minutes or until crust is golden brown and juices are bubbling. Remove from oven and rest for at least 10 minutes before slicing.
title: Cherry Pistachio Galette

directions:
Lay a large sheet of plastic wrap inside a 2-quart stainless steel bowl, with the plastic edges overhanging, set aside.
Rinse strawberries and cut off the tops and tips. Slice each strawberry into 3-4 thin circles. Arrange strawberry slices in a single layer on the inside of the bowl, starting in the center and working out to the edges. Scoop softened ice cream over the top of the strawberries and smooth out until the surface is flat.
In a separate bowl, crumble the cake with your fingers. Spread the cake crumbles in a thick layer atop the ice cream and gently press down to secure. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place in freezer for about 5 hours or until firm.
To serve, soak the bottom of the bowl in a separate bowl of warm water for a few seconds to help dislodge the cake. Remove the plastic wrap from the top of the bowl, place a serving plate over the cake and flip. Remove bowl and plastic wrap. Garnish cake with whipped cream, fresh blueberries and mint leaves. Serve immediately.Lay a large sheet of plastic wrap inside a 2-quart stainless steel bowl, with the plastic edges overhanging, set aside.Rinse strawberries and cut off the tops and tips. Serve immediately.
title: Strawberry Dome Cake
ingredients: 1 half gallon TJ's French Vanilla Ice Cream, softened
1 TJ's Chantilly Cream Vanilla Bean Mini Sheet Cake, or 18 ounces of YOUR favorite TJ's Bakery cake
1 package TJ's Organic Mint (optional), for garnish

directions:
Fill a large punch bowl with ice and set aside. Add lemonade and pineapple tidbits to a blender pitcher and blend until smooth. Pour blended mixture into punch bowl. Add limeade and cherry juice, stir to combine.
Top off punch bowl with Blanc de Blancs immediately before serving. Garnish with lemon and lime slices, if desired.Fill a large punch bowl with ice and set aside. title: Cherry Citrus Punch
ingredients: 3 cups TJ's French Sparkling Limeade, chilled
3 cups TJ's Blanc de Blancs Sparkling wine (or TJ's Plain Sparkling Spring Water), chilled
Sliced lemons and limes (optional), for garnish

directions: Add all ingredients to a blender. Cover and blend on high until thoroughly combined. Pour into a glass and enjoy!Add all ingredients to a blender. Cover and blend on high until thoroughly combined. Pour into a glass and enjoy!
ingredients: 8 fl. oz. TJ's Organic Cold Pressed Green Juice Beverage
1 heaping cup TJ's Frozen Pineapple Tidbits
4 tablespoons TJ's Oven Toasted Old Fashioned Organic Oats
title: Green Juice Smoothie

directions:
MICROWAVE: Remove bowl from outer box. Puncture film 3 to 4 times with a fork. Heat on high for 3 minutes; partially peel back film and stir. Re-cover and heat for an additional 2 minutes. Peel back film, stir, make two pockets with the back of a spoon and add 2 fresh eggs. Re-cover and cook for 2 to 2 ½ minutes to cook eggs to desired doneness. Top with feta and mint, and serve with crusty bread for dipping.
STOVE: Place contents of shakshuka starter bowl into a small sauté pan with 2 Tbsp. of water and cover. Heat on medium low for 6 to 7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until simmering. Make two pockets with the back of a spoon and add 2 eggs. Re-cover pan and cook for 2 to 2 ½ minutes to cook eggs to desired doneness. Top with feta and mint, and serve with crusty bread for dipping.MICROWAVE: Remove bowl from outer box. Puncture film 3 to 4 times with a fork. Toasted pita, flatbread, or baguette for dipping
title: Shakshuka

ingredients: 1 stick (1/2 cup) TJ's Unsalted Butter, melted
3 tablespoons TJ's Everything but the Elote Seasoning Blend
1 bag TJ's Fresh Jalapeños, deseeded and diced (use gloves!)
directions:
In a large mixing bowl, mix together egg, melted butter, and buttermilk. Mix in cornbread mix and seasoning, stirring until moistened. Mix in diced jalapeños until combine. Do not over-mix.
Preheat a large, nonstick pan or griddle over low heat. Working in batches and using about ¼ cup of batter per pancake as your measure, drop batter into preheated pan. Cook 3-4 minutes, flip pancake, and continue cooking for 2 minutes more.
Serve immediately, garnished with honey and butter if desired. Enjoy!In a large mixing bowl, mix together egg, melted butter, and buttermilk. title: Elote-Jalapeño Cornbread Pancakes
Carnitas Tacos
ingredients: TJ's Organic Sour Cream or 1 batch Cilantro Crema (get the recipe)
TJ's Cilantro and Lime, finely chopped and sliced for garnish
directions:
Microwave carnitas according to package directions. When warm, shred meat with forks. Cover and set aside.
To prepare tortillas, heat a griddle or grill pan to medium-high heat. Fill a shallow bowl or plate with water. Dip each side of tortilla in water and immediately place on grill pan. Warm tortilla 1 minute each side, then place in foil to keep warm. Repeat for each tortilla.
To assemble tacos, layer tortilla with carnitas, salsa, diced onions and a drizzle of crema. Garnish with chopped cilantro and lime wedges, and serve.Microwave carnitas according to package directions. When warm, shred meat with forks. Cover and set aside.To prepare tortillas, heat a griddle or grill pan to medium-high heat. Fill a shallow bowl or plate with water. Repeat for each tortilla.To assemble tacos, layer tortilla with carnitas, salsa, diced onions and a drizzle of crema. Garnish with chopped cilantro and lime wedges, and serve.

ingredients: 3 teaspoons TJ's Dijon Mustard with White Wine
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste
1/2 cup TJ's Extra Virgin California Estate Olive Oil
directions:
In a small bowl, whisk together shallot, lemon juice, vinegar, mustard, honey then season with salt and pepper. Slowly whisk in oil until emulsified. Taste and adjust seasoning as desired. Makes about 1 cup of vinaigrette.
Serving suggestions: mix with warmed lentils, wilted kale and tomatoes, drizzle over grilled asparagus, or dress a baby spinach salad (with pistachios, beets, goat cheese and red onion).In a small bowl, whisk together shallot, lemon juice, vinegar, mustard, honey then season with salt and pepper. title: Lemon-Mustard Vinaigrette

directions: Combine feta and bacon in a mixing bowl. Place 1/4 cup of the cheese/bacon mixture on the center of each chicken breast. Fold breast over to enclose mixture; fasten with a toothpick or kitchen twine. Heat a large sauté pan and add oil. Heat oil to medium and add stuffed breasts; turn breasts while cooking to brown on all sides. Add tomatoes and seasoning to pan. Lower heat to a simmer; cook about 15 - 20 minutes or until chicken reaches an internal temperature of 165°. Place chicken on a serving platter (remove toothpicks or twine) and spoon tomato sauce over.
ingredients: 1 package TJ's Uncured Bacon, cooked and crumbled
6 TJ's Boneless, Skinless Chicken Breasts, pounded flat
1 tbsp TJ's Extra Virgin Olive Oil
1 tsp (each) TJ's Dried Oregano, Dried Basil
1 can (28 oz.) TJ's Diced Tomatoes & Juice From Can
Toothpicks or kitchen twine (or whatever you can find in your kitchen drawer)
title: Chicken Breast Stuffed with Bacon 'n Feta

directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F. Unwrap camembert and place in the center of a small cast iron skillet or ceramic baking dish. Place on center rack of oven and bake 5-15 minutes (check every 5 minutes or so and remove from oven when cheese is oozing to your desired preference).
Top cheese with cranberry relish*. Let cool slightly and garnish with walnuts and rosemary. Serve with water crackers for dipping.
*You can add the cranberry relish prior to baking, if desired; the color and tanginess of the relish will be somewhat subdued if you go this route.Preheat oven to 350°F. ingredients: TJ's Walnuts and Fresh Rosemary (optional), for garnish
title: Cranberry Baked Camembert Cheese

directions:
Prepare mezzelune according to package directions. While mezzelune cooks, place a small skillet over medium heat and pour just enough sunflower oil in it to coat the bottom. Set a paper-towel-lined plate close to the skillet to drain and dry the fried basil. When the oil is hot, use tongs to carefully lower basil leaves into the skillet. Fry for 5–15 seconds, then flip them and fry another 5–15 seconds. Remove fried basil from skillet and set on paper towels to dry.
Plate the cooked mezzelune and generously drizzle with olive oil. Garnish with grated parmesan and fried basil, and enjoy immediately.Prepare mezzelune according to package directions. title: Roasted Cauliflower Mezzelune & Fried Basil
ingredients: 10 TJ's Fresh Basil Leaves, rinsed and dried
1 lb assorted TJ's Nuts (TJ's Raw Cashew Pieces, TJ's Raw Pecan Pieces, TJ's Walnut Halves & Pieces)
title: Sugar Pumpkin Pie Nuts
directions:
Place assorted nuts into a large bowl, set aside.
In a medium pot, combine the milk, sugar, salt and pumpkin pie spice and place over medium heat. Stir constantly for about 5 minutes until the sugar dissolves. Allow the mixture to come to a boil until it reaches at least 235°F but no more than 245°F.
Tip: If you do not have a candy thermometer, a great way to determine if you've reached this temperature range is to drop a spoonful of hot syrup into a bowl of very cold water. In the water, use your fingers to gather the cooled syrup into a ball. If it has reached soft-ball stage, the syrup easily forms a ball while in the cold water, but flattens once removed from the water—now you know!
 
Remove pot from heat, add vanilla extract, stir and pour over the bowl of mixed nuts. Using a wooden or silicone spatula, coat the nuts and lay on a flat surface covered with parchment or wax paper to cool. Once cooled, break apart and enjoy! Use as a topping on a salad, add to a fruit and cheese plate or simply eat by the handful.Place assorted nuts into a large bowl, set aside.In a medium pot, combine the milk, sugar, salt and pumpkin pie spice and place over medium heat. Stir constantly for about 5 minutes until the sugar dissolves. If it has reached soft-ball stage, the syrup easily forms a ball while in the cold water, but flattens once removed from the water—now you know!Remove pot from heat, add vanilla extract, stir and pour over the bowl of mixed nuts. Using a wooden or silicone spatula, coat the nuts and lay on a flat surface covered with parchment or wax paper to cool. Once cooled, break apart and enjoy! Use as a topping on a salad, add to a fruit and cheese plate or simply eat by the handful.

ingredients: 1 package (2 pounds) TJ's Organic Carrots Of Many Colors, rinsed and dried
1 tablespoon TJ's Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil
1 tablespoon TJ's Organic Apple Cider Vinegar OR Balsamic Vinegar
directions:
Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper, set aside.
Peel carrots and trim ends, discard ends and peels. Slice carrots in half crosswise, then slice in half lengthwise. Add carrots to a large bowl and drizzle with olive oil, vinegar, and salt, and toss to coat. Spread carrots evenly on prepared baking sheet and tuck a few sprigs of fresh thyme in between the carrots.
Place baking sheet on center rack of oven and roast 15-20 minutes, until carrots are fork tender. Turn oven to broil (high) and broil carrots 2-3 minutes (watch carefully to avoid burning). Remove sheet from oven and let cool 5 minutes before serving.Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper, set aside.Peel carrots and trim ends, discard ends and peels. Slice carrots in half crosswise, then slice in half lengthwise. Add carrots to a large bowl and drizzle with olive oil, vinegar, and salt, and toss to coat. Spread carrots evenly on prepared baking sheet and tuck a few sprigs of fresh thyme in between the carrots.Place baking sheet on center rack of oven and roast 15-20 minutes, until carrots are fork tender. Turn oven to broil (high) and broil carrots 2-3 minutes (watch carefully to avoid burning). Remove sheet from oven and let cool 5 minutes before serving.
title: Roasted Carrots Of Many Colors

directions: Combine almond beverage, cherry juice, coconut oil, beets and Medjool dates in a blender and blend until smooth. Add strawberries and continue pulsing until well blended. Serve immediately.Combine almond beverage, cherry juice, coconut oil, beets and Medjool dates in a blender and blend until smooth. Add strawberries and continue pulsing until well blended. Serve immediately.

2 TJ's Steamed & Peeled Baby Beets, sliced
title: Sweetheart Smoothie
Citrus Garlic Chicken Tacos
directions:
Remove outer packaging of Cuban Style Citrus Garlic Bowl and pierce film. Microwave on high 4 to 5 minutes or until heated through. Stir and set aside.
Fill tortillas with warmed Cuban Style Citrus Garlic Bowl. Garnish with salsa, sliced jalapeños, and cilantro.
Enjoy!Remove outer packaging of Cuban Style Citrus Garlic Bowl and pierce film. Microwave on high 4 to 5 minutes or until heated through. Stir and set aside.Fill tortillas with warmed Cuban Style Citrus Garlic Bowl. Garnish with salsa, sliced jalapeños, and cilantro.Enjoy!
ingredients: 1 package TJ's Cuban Style Citrus Garlic Bowl
2 packages TJ's Sriracha Flavored Baked Tofu
2 large TJ's Eggs, egg whites separated
¼ cup TJ's Grated Parmesan Cheese
¼ cup TJ's Nori Komi Furikake
directions:
Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a sheet pan with parchment paper and spray lightly with canola oil spray.
Cut tofu into thin, “fry-sized” strips.
Place egg whites in a small bowl.
In a medium bowl, combine breadcrumbs, Parmesan, and furikake and toss together.
One by one, dredge tofu strips in egg whites, making sure every side is covered. Briefly hold each strip over bowl and allow excess to drip off. Roll egg white-covered strip in the breadcrumb/furikake mix until all sides are thoroughly covered. Place on greased baking sheet. Repeat until all tofu strips are properly coated and placed on baking sheet, a few inches apart.
Once all tofu strips are placed on sheet, lightly spray them with canola oil spray.
Place sheet in center rack of oven and bake for about 25 minutes or until golden brown.
Remove from oven, let cool, enjoy!Preheat oven to 400°F. Meatless Meatball BBQ Subs
ingredients: 1 bottle TJ's Organic Kansas City Style BBQ Sauce
1 package TJ's Gourmet White Hot Dog Buns
directions:
In a large microwave safe dish, microwave meatballs according to package directions. Pour BBQ sauce over meatballs just to cover, and stir to combine. Continue to microwave on half power at 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until sauce is warmed through.
Open hot dog buns and arrange on a large baking sheet. Fill each bun with 4 meatballs and top with warmed sauce and a slice of provolone.
Heat broiler to high. Broil subs 3-5 minutes, until cheese is melted and brown, and buns are golden (depending on your broiler, you may have to cover empty side of bun with foil to prevent burning). Remove subs from oven and let cool slightly. Top with diced red onion and enjoy.In a large microwave safe dish, microwave meatballs according to package directions. Pour BBQ sauce over meatballs just to cover, and stir to combine. Broil subs 3-5 minutes, until cheese is melted and brown, and buns are golden (depending on your broiler, you may have to cover empty side of bun with foil to prevent burning). Remove subs from oven and let cool slightly. Top with diced red onion and enjoy.

ingredients: 1 package TJ's Mexican Style Roasted Corn with Cotija Cheese
1 package TJ's Creamy Chicken Poblano Ravioli
TJ's Fresh Cilantro (optional), chopped for garnish
directions:
In  large pot, bring 4 quarts of water to a boil. While water boils, prepare roasted corn according to package directions, reserving cotija cheese for serving. Set aside.
Add ravioli to boiling water and cook 5 to 6 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, gently transfer ravioli to a colander to drain.
Divide prepared corn among four plates, followed by ravioli. Drizzle with olive oil and garnish with reserved cotija cheese and cilantro, if using. Enjoy immediately.In  large pot, bring 4 quarts of water to a boil. While water boils, prepare roasted corn according to package directions, reserving cotija cheese for serving. ingredients: 1 part TJ's Bourbon (preferably High Rye Bourbon)
Handful TJ's Frozen Raspberries, plus more for serving
directions:
Prepare the ice ring (optional): line the bottom of a bundt pan with navel slices, raspberries and a few sprigs of rosemary. Fill pan halfway with water; freeze until solid.
To serve: add bourbon and wassail to large punch bowl, stir briskly to combine. Remove bundt pan from freezer and let sit at room temperature for 5 minutes. Run bottom and sides of pan under hot water, until ice ring slides out. Flip ice ring over and gently place in punch bowl. Serve punch with frozen raspberries for garnish.Prepare the ice ring (optional): line the bottom of a bundt pan with navel slices, raspberries and a few sprigs of rosemary. Fill pan halfway with water; freeze until solid.To serve: add bourbon and wassail to large punch bowl, stir briskly to combine. Remove bundt pan from freezer and let sit at room temperature for 5 minutes. Run bottom and sides of pan under hot water, until ice ring slides out. Flip ice ring over and gently place in punch bowl. Serve punch with frozen raspberries for garnish.
title: Here We Come A-Wassailing

directions:
Cake:
Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8x8” baking pan with butter, set aside.
In a medium bowl, combine eggs, melted butter, and sparkling wine. Add cake mix. Whisk together until batter is smooth.
Spread batter in pan, filling corners and leveling top.
Place on the center rack in oven and bake for 40 – 45 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Remove from oven. Let cool and remove from pan.
Frosting:
While cake is cooling, make buttercream frosting.
Add butter to a stand mixer fitted with a paddle (a hand mixer will work, too) and beat at medium speed until creamy, about 2 minutes. Add sugar, salt, cream, and vanilla; mix at low speed until just combined. To fully incorporate all of the sugar, stop mixer as needed and scrape down sides of bowl with a rubber spatula.
Increase speed to high and mix until smooth and fluffy, about 3 to 5 minutes.
Add strawberry spread and mix until just combined.
Assembly:
Pulverize freeze-dried strawberries in a food processor or thoroughly crush by hand; set aside.
Using an offset spatula or frosting knife, spread buttercream frosting into an even layer on top of the cooled cake.
Carefully spoon pulverized freeze-dried strawberries over top of cake until completely covered, gently spreading & pressing them into the frosting as you go.
Cut, serve and enjoy!

Optional Stenciling: Draw (or trace) desired shapes & letters onto a piece of paper. Cut them out. Arrange on top of frosted cake and press into place lightly.
Spoon pulverized strawberries over frosting very slowly, keeping spoon within close range of cake and spreading/pressing the strawberries in place as you go. Once top of cake is covered in a thick, even layer, peel paper stencils off cake. Voilà!Cake:Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8x8” baking pan with butter, set aside.In a medium bowl, combine eggs, melted butter, and sparkling wine. Add cake mix. Whisk together until batter is smooth.Spread batter in pan, filling corners and leveling top.Place on the center rack in oven and bake for 40 – 45 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Remove from oven. Let cool and remove from pan.Frosting:While cake is cooling, make buttercream frosting.Add butter to a stand mixer fitted with a paddle (a hand mixer will work, too) and beat at medium speed until creamy, about 2 minutes. Add sugar, salt, cream, and vanilla; mix at low speed until just combined. To fully incorporate all of the sugar, stop mixer as needed and scrape down sides of bowl with a rubber spatula.Increase speed to high and mix until smooth and fluffy, about 3 to 5 minutes.Add strawberry spread and mix until just combined.Assembly:Pulverize freeze-dried strawberries in a food processor or thoroughly crush by hand; set aside.Using an offset spatula or frosting knife, spread buttercream frosting into an even layer on top of the cooled cake.Carefully spoon pulverized freeze-dried strawberries over top of cake until completely covered, gently spreading & pressing them into the frosting as you go.Cut, serve and enjoy!

Optional Stenciling: Draw (or trace) desired shapes & letters onto a piece of paper. Cut them out. Arrange on top of frosted cake and press into place lightly.Spoon pulverized strawberries over frosting very slowly, keeping spoon within close range of cake and spreading/pressing the strawberries in place as you go. Once top of cake is covered in a thick, even layer, peel paper stencils off cake. Voilà!

1 cup, RSVP Brut Sparkling Wine or your favorite Champagne, room temperature
1 package TJ's Vanilla Cake & Baking Mix
1 stick (1/2 cup) TJ's Unsalted Butter, softened
1 ¾ cup TJ's Organic Powdered Sugar, sifted
1/8 cup TJ's Organic Strawberry Fruit Spread
