ingredients: 6 TJ's Fully Cooked Turkey Meatballs, microwaved according to package directions and halved
title: Stuffing Muffins

ingredients: 1/2 cup TJ's Organic Reduced Sugar Raspberry (or Strawberry) Preserves
title: Sweet Balls of Fire
directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Prepare sauce: In a sauce pan over medium heat, add raspberry preserves and sweet chili sauce. Heat until sauce begins to bubble, about 8-10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat.
Place meatballs in a 9x9 baking dish and cover with warm sauce mixture. Place dish in oven and heat for 40 minutes, or until meatballs are heated to 165°F and sauce is hot. Alternatively, use a slow cooker to heat meatballs and sauce, about 5-6 hours on low, or 2-4 hours on high until heated through.Preheat oven to 350°F.Prepare sauce: In a sauce pan over medium heat, add raspberry preserves and sweet chili sauce. Heat until sauce begins to bubble, about 8-10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat.Place meatballs in a 9x9 baking dish and cover with warm sauce mixture. Place dish in oven and heat for 40 minutes, or until meatballs are heated to 165°F and sauce is hot. Alternatively, use a slow cooker to heat meatballs and sauce, about 5-6 hours on low, or 2-4 hours on high until heated through.

ingredients: 1 package (about 1 pound) TJ's Sweet OR Hot Italian Sausage, casing removed
2 teaspoons TJ's Extra Virgin Olive Oil
1 cup TJ's Whole Milk Ricotta Cheese
2 cups TJ's Shredded Mozzarella Cheese, divided
TJ's Fresh Basil, shredded (optional), for garnish
title: Hot & Smoky Rigatoni Bake
directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add rigatoni to pot and boil for 10 minutes, just until al dente. Drain and set aside.
While pasta is cooking, in a small bowl, combine ricotta and half of the grated parmesan. Stir and set aside. In a large sauce pan over medium heat, add olive oil and sausage. Brown sausage for 7-9 minutes until it reaches 145°F, breaking meat up with a spoon as it cooks. Add paprika and stir to combine. Reduce heat to low and add marinara. Heat until sauce is warmed through, stirring occasionally.
Return drained pasta to pot and add half of marinara mixture, stirring to combine. Gently fold in ricotta mixture. Transfer half of the pasta to a 9x13 pan. Sprinkle half of the Mozzarella over pasta. Top with remaining pasta and remaining sauce and spread in an even layer. Top pasta with remaining Mozzarella and Parmesan cheeses.
Place pan in middle rack of oven and bake until edges are bubbling and cheese is melted, about 35 minutes. Remove pan from oven and let cool for 10 minutes. Garnish with shredded basil, if desired, and serve.
*If cooking from frozen, leave foil on and bake for 1 hour, then remove foil and bake an additional 15 minutes.Preheat oven to 350°F. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. title: Fiesta Bowl with Mexican Rice
ingredients: 2 Tbsp Clarified Butter or Canola Oil
2 1/2 cups TJ's Organic Low Sodium Chicken Broth (or Water)
TJ's Avocado's Number Guacamole or TJ's Reduced Guilt Guacamole
directions:
To prepare Mexican Rice: In large heavy-bottomed pan or dutch oven, heat oil until it shimmers. Add onion and saute until softened, about 2 minutes. Add rice, coating all the grains with oil. Stir often, until rice begins to brown, about 3 minutes. Add cumin, salt and garlic and stir about 1 minute until fragrant. Stir in broth and tomato sauce and bring to a boil. Cover with a tight-fitting lid and simmer about 15 minutes or until all liquid absorbs.
Assemble bowls with rice, carnitas, corn and black beans. Garnish with cheese, guacamole and salsa.To prepare Mexican Rice: In large heavy-bottomed pan or dutch oven, heat oil until it shimmers. Cover with a tight-fitting lid and simmer about 15 minutes or until all liquid absorbs.Assemble bowls with rice, carnitas, corn and black beans. Garnish with cheese, guacamole and salsa.

ingredients: 1 TJ's Pumpkin Cheesecake (seasonal), defrosted (note: place cake on serving platter prior to defrosting to avoid a gooey mess)
½ jar TJ's Fleur de Sel Caramel Sauce
½ cup TJ's Pumpkin Spiced Pumpkin Seeds (seasonal)
¼ cup TJ's Candied Pecans or Candied Walnuts
directions: Spread caramel sauce on top of cheesecake (use more than half the jar for extra gooey results, if desired). Top with pumpkin seeds and candied nuts. Serve immediately.Spread caramel sauce on top of cheesecake (use more than half the jar for extra gooey results, if desired). Top with pumpkin seeds and candied nuts. Serve immediately.
title: Caramel Pumpkin Cheesecake

ingredients: 1 package TJ's Fully Cooked Traditional Carnitas
2 bags TJ's Frozen Organic Jasmine Rice
1 can TJ's Organic Black Beans, rinsed and drained
TJ's Fresh Cilantro/ sliced Jalapeno/ sliced Lime (optional), for garnish
title: Carnitas Bowl
directions:
Microwave carnitas according to package directions. Shred with forks, set aside.
Microwave rice according to package directions. Divide among four serving bowls. Top bowls with carnitas, black beans, pico de gallo, and guacamole.  Drizzle generously with jalapeño sauce. Garnish with fresh cilantro, sliced jalapeño, and a squeeze of lime, if using. Enjoy!Microwave carnitas according to package directions. Top bowls with carnitas, black beans, pico de gallo, and guacamole.  Drizzle generously with jalapeño sauce. Garnish with fresh cilantro, sliced jalapeño, and a squeeze of lime, if using. Enjoy!

ingredients: 1½ cups TJ's Gluten Free Rice Crumbs
2 packages TJ's Organic Chicken Breast Tenders
Your favorite TJ's Sauce for dipping (Dijon Mustard/ BBQ Sauce/ Green Dragon Hot Sauce…)
directions:
Preheat oven to 425°F. Spread rice crumbs on a large baking sheet. Place on center rack of oven and bake 10 minutes. Remove from oven and transfer rice crumbs to a shallow bowl to cool.
Coat baking sheet with cooking spray, set aside. Remove chicken from packaging and pat dry with paper towels, set aside.
Add cheese, 21 seasoning, and salt to cooled rice crumbs, set aside. In another shallow bowl, whisk eggs, set aside. One by one, dredge a chicken tender in egg, letting excess drain off before dredging in rice crumb mixture. Dredge tender once more in egg and rice crumb mixture, then transfer to prepared baking sheet. Repeat with remaining tenders.
Spray tops of dredged chicken tenders with canola oil spray. Place baking sheet on center rack of oven and bake 15 minutes. Use tongs to flip chicken tenders and bake 8-10 minutes more, until internal temperature of chicken reaches 165°F and exterior is a light golden brown. Remove from oven and transfer chicken tenders to a wire rack to cool slightly before serving.Preheat oven to 425°F. Spread rice crumbs on a large baking sheet. Place on center rack of oven and bake 10 minutes. Remove from oven and transfer rice crumbs to a shallow bowl to cool.Coat baking sheet with cooking spray, set aside. Remove chicken from packaging and pat dry with paper towels, set aside.Add cheese, 21 seasoning, and salt to cooled rice crumbs, set aside. In another shallow bowl, whisk eggs, set aside. Place baking sheet on center rack of oven and bake 15 minutes. Use tongs to flip chicken tenders and bake 8-10 minutes more, until internal temperature of chicken reaches 165°F and exterior is a light golden brown. Remove from oven and transfer chicken tenders to a wire rack to cool slightly before serving.
title: Baked Parmesan Chicken Tenders

directions: Prepare salmon burgers according to package instructions. Place cooked salmon burger on bottom of brioche bun. Spoon salsa over burger. Arrange a few avocado slices atop salsa, followed by red onion and a handful of greens. Close burger with top half of brioche bun. Repeat with remaining ingredients and enjoy right away.Prepare salmon burgers according to package instructions. Place cooked salmon burger on bottom of brioche bun. Spoon salsa over burger. Arrange a few avocado slices atop salsa, followed by red onion and a handful of greens. Close burger with top half of brioche bun. Repeat with remaining ingredients and enjoy right away.
ingredients: 1 TJ's Large Avocado, pitted and thinly sliced
¼ TJ's Jumbo Red Onion, peeled and very thinly sliced
title: Salmon Burgers

ingredients: 1 pkg TJ's Boneless Skinless Chicken Breast Tenders
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste
1 bag TJ's Butter Lettuce & Radicchio Salad Mix
1/4 cup TJ's Green Onions (include bottom white sections), chopped
1/2 cup TJ's Unsalted, Dry Toasted Slivered Almonds
4 Tbsp TJ's Sugar (or 2 Tbsp TJ's Sugar, 2 drops TJ's Organic Liquid Stevia)
2 tsp TJ's Toasted Sesame Seed Oil
title: Grandma's Chinese Chicken Salad
directions:
Prepare the chicken: Wash and pat dry chicken tenders. Dredge chicken in flour seasoned with salt and pepper, set aside. Add 2 tablespoons canola oil to a frying pan and heat on medium until oil starts to shimmer. Cook chicken tenders about 3 minutes on each side or until internal temperature reaches 165 degrees. Remove from heat, and place chicken in refrigerator to cool.
Make the dressing: In a medium jar, dissolve sugar and salt in white balsamic vinegar then add canola oil, lemon juice, sesame seed oil and black pepper. Shake well. Place in refrigerator to chill.
Prepare the salad: In a large bowl, combine butter lettuce & radicchio salad mix, green onions, slivered almonds, cilantro and sesame sticks. Slice about 4 or 5 chicken tenders on the diagonal and add to the bowl. Add a few tablespoons of the chilled dressing to the salad just before serving and toss.Prepare the chicken: Wash and pat dry chicken tenders. Dredge chicken in flour seasoned with salt and pepper, set aside. Add 2 tablespoons canola oil to a frying pan and heat on medium until oil starts to shimmer. Remove from heat, and place chicken in refrigerator to cool.Make the dressing: In a medium jar, dissolve sugar and salt in white balsamic vinegar then add canola oil, lemon juice, sesame seed oil and black pepper. Shake well. Place in refrigerator to chill.Prepare the salad: In a large bowl, combine butter lettuce & radicchio salad mix, green onions, slivered almonds, cilantro and sesame sticks. Slice about 4 or 5 chicken tenders on the diagonal and add to the bowl. Add a few tablespoons of the chilled dressing to the salad just before serving and toss.

ingredients: TJ's Super Premium Pumpkin Ice Cream
directions: Crumble a couple of speculoos cookies into a serving bowl. Scoop ice cream on top of cookies and top with more cookies and handful of candied pecans. Grab a spoon and dig in!Crumble a couple of speculoos cookies into a serving bowl. Scoop ice cream on top of cookies and top with more cookies and handful of candied pecans. Grab a spoon and dig in!
title: Daylight Savings Sundae

directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a loaf pan with coconut oil spray, set aside.
Add banana bread mix, coconut and chopped ginger to a large bowl and stir to combine. Set aside. In a medium bowl, whisk eggs, coconut milk, banana and sunflower oil. Fold wet mixture into dry mixture just until combined. Pour batter into prepared pan and smooth top.
Bake on center rack of oven for 50 minutes, until loaf is dark golden brown and firm to the touch. Remove from oven and let cool before slicing.
Optional garnish: Slice an additional banana into coins and place on top of the batter in the loaf pan before baking. 
After the banana bread is cooled, slightly heat creamy peanut butter and drizzle it over the slices.Preheat oven to 350°F. title: Tropical Banana Bread
ingredients: TJ's Coconut Oil Spray or Canola Oil Spray
1/2 cup TJ's Organic Unsweetened Flake Coconut
1/3 cup finely chopped TJ's Uncrystallized Candied Ginger Pieces
3/4 cup canned TJ's Organic Coconut Milk
TJ's Creamy Peanut Butter (optional), melted for garnish
TJ's Roasted Red Peppers, drained and chopped
directions:
In a large bowl, combine falafel mix and water. Cover and let sit 1 hour. Stir in 1 tablespoon sunflower oil.
Preheat waffle iron. Scoop 1/3 of the batter onto the center of the waffle iron and spread evenly with a spatula toward the edges. Close waffle iron and cook 12 minutes, until golden brown. Remove waffle from iron and repeat process two more times (you'll end up with three large waffles).
To serve, garnish waffles with chopped peppers and parsley, a drizzle of tahini and a squeeze of lemon.In a large bowl, combine falafel mix and water. Cover and let sit 1 hour. Stir in 1 tablespoon sunflower oil.Preheat waffle iron. Scoop 1/3 of the batter onto the center of the waffle iron and spread evenly with a spatula toward the edges. Close waffle iron and cook 12 minutes, until golden brown. Remove waffle from iron and repeat process two more times (you'll end up with three large waffles).To serve, garnish waffles with chopped peppers and parsley, a drizzle of tahini and a squeeze of lemon.
title: Falafel Waffles
Grilled Sharp Cheddar, Applewood Bacon, & Shaved Sprouts
directions:
Spray one side of each slice of bread with canola oil, and place the slices (sprayed-side down) on a clean working surface.
Divide the cheese and pile evenly on each slice of bread. On each slice, place two strips of bacon. On one slice, add the sautéed sprouts. Carefully sandwich the two sides together.
Heat a large fry pan or griddle over medium heat until hot. Place the sandwich on the pan and reduce the heat to medium-low. After about a minute, cover the pan with a large lid, and let it cook for about 2-3 minutes more, until the bottom is golden brown. Flip the sandwich and let it cook for 3-4 more minutes (covering again after 1 minute to encourage the melt), until bottom is golden brown and the cheese is melting.
Transfer the sandwiches to a cutting board and cut in half. Serve immediately.Spray one side of each slice of bread with canola oil, and place the slices (sprayed-side down) on a clean working surface.Divide the cheese and pile evenly on each slice of bread. On each slice, place two strips of bacon. On one slice, add the sautéed sprouts. Carefully sandwich the two sides together.Heat a large fry pan or griddle over medium heat until hot. Serve immediately.
ingredients: ½ cup TJ's Shaved Brussels Sprouts, lightly sautéed
2 slices TJ's Multigrain Sliced Bread or TJ's Sprouted Wheat Sourdough Bread
½ cup TJ's Sharp Cheddar, shredded

title: Filet & Rib Eye Burger
directions: Bring meat to room temperature. Place into meat grinder or food processor; grind. Add to large bowl and season with Everyday Seasoning, salt and pepper. Mix well and form into four patties. (If you'd like to skip this burger-making step, start with a package of TJ's Organic Ground Beef Patties instead.) Baste burgers with butter; place on grill or in a cast iron skillet and cook over medium flame. Turn frequently until medium or pale pink on the inside. About 6 minutes per side. Remove from grill, cover and rest for 5 minutes. Place each patty on a roll bottom and top with hot sweet mustard, mayo, pickle, butter lettuce, 2 slices tomato, and finally, roll top.Bring meat to room temperature. (If you'd like to skip this burger-making step, start with a package of TJ's Organic Ground Beef Patties instead.) Baste burgers with butter; place on grill or in a cast iron skillet and cook over medium flame. Place each patty on a roll bottom and top with hot sweet mustard, mayo, pickle, butter lettuce, 2 slices tomato, and finally, roll top.
ingredients: 1 lb. TJ's Beef Filet Mignon, cut into 1 inch cubes
1/2 lb. TJ's Beef Rib Eye Steak, cut into 1 inch cubes
20 ounces of your favorite Joe-Joe's Sandwich Cookies
1 Box TJ's Vanilla Cake & Baking Mix
1 stick (8 Tbsp) TJ's Unsalted Butter, melted
3/4 block (6 oz) TJ's Cream Cheese, at room temperature
1/2 stick (4 Tbsp) TJ's Unsalted Butter, at room temperature
2 1/2 - 3 1/2 cups TJ's Organic Powdered Sugar, to taste
directions:
Prepare the cupcakes: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Line the wells of 2 cupcake pans with 18 paper liners, set aside.
Coarsely chop 10 Joe-Joe's Cookies, set aside. In a medium bowl, prepare Vanilla Cake Mix according to package instructions. Add chopped cookies to mix and gently fold in with a rubber spatula until evenly incorporated, being careful not to over mix.
Evenly divide the batter into lined cupcake pan, filling each cup about 3/4 full. Bake for 16-18 minutes, rotating the pans halfway through baking, until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from oven and allow cupcakes to cool completely.
Prepare the frosting: Combine the cream cheese, butter and vanilla in the bowl of an electric mixer. Beat on medium speed until smooth, 1-3 minutes, scraping down the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula as needed. Blend in the vanilla flavor. Add the powdered sugar in half-cup increments and blend to desired sweetness and thickness.
Frost the cooled cupcakes, then garnish with Joe-Joe cookie halves and crumbs. Enjoy!Prepare the cupcakes: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Add chopped cookies to mix and gently fold in with a rubber spatula until evenly incorporated, being careful not to over mix.Evenly divide the batter into lined cupcake pan, filling each cup about 3/4 full. title: Joe-Joe's Cupcakes

ingredients: 1 cup TJ's Shaved Cheese Blend, divided
6 TJ's Super Sweet Baby Bell Peppers, cored and sliced into rings
1/2 link TJ's Soy Chorizo, casing removed and crumbled
1/2 cup sliced TJ's Mini Pearl Grape Tomatoes (garnish)
directions:
Preheat oven to 375°F. In a large bowl, whisk together 12 eggs, 1/3 cup half & half and about 5 dashes of 21 seasoning salute. Whisk until eggs are nice and fluffy. Stir in 3/4 cup of shredded cheese then set aside.
Heat a deep, 10-inch ovenproof skillet (a well-seasoned cast iron skillet works best), over medium heat. Spray with canola oil, then sauté bell peppers and onions until they just begin to soften, about 2 minutes. Add baby spinach and sprinkle with a few dashes of 21 seasoning salute. Keep stirring until spinach begins to wilt, another 2 minutes. Add crumbled soy chorizo and stir another minute until well incorporated. Remove about 1/3 of the ingredients from the skillet and set aside on a plate (for garnishing the top of the frittata).
Make sure all the ingredients are in an even layer on the bottom of the skillet, then pour the egg mixture over the top. Cook the frittata over medium heat, without stirring, until about 1 inch from the edge has begun to set, about 4-5 minutes. Sprinkle the sautéed ingredients that had been set aside over the top of the frittata and turn off heat.
Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for about 16-18 minutes. Do not overcook. The consistency should be more like a custard than a sponge, so keep a close eye on it toward the end. The center might still look a little jiggly even when it is ready—so to check doneness—cut a small slit in the center of the frittata. If you see runny eggs in the cut, bake for another few minutes; if the eggs are set, it's done!
For a crispy top, heat broiler then sprinkle reserved 1/4 cup of cheese over the top of the frittata then broil until cheese is browned and bubbling, about 1 minute. To serve, run a rubber spatula around edge of frittata and transfer to a plate. Cut into wedges, garnish with tomatoes and cilantro and enjoy!Preheat oven to 375°F. Stir in 3/4 cup of shredded cheese then set aside.Heat a deep, 10-inch ovenproof skillet (a well-seasoned cast iron skillet works best), over medium heat. Sprinkle the sautéed ingredients that had been set aside over the top of the frittata and turn off heat.Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake for about 16-18 minutes. Do not overcook. The consistency should be more like a custard than a sponge, so keep a close eye on it toward the end. The center might still look a little jiggly even when it is ready—so to check doneness—cut a small slit in the center of the frittata. If you see runny eggs in the cut, bake for another few minutes; if the eggs are set, it's done!For a crispy top, heat broiler then sprinkle reserved 1/4 cup of cheese over the top of the frittata then broil until cheese is browned and bubbling, about 1 minute. To serve, run a rubber spatula around edge of frittata and transfer to a plate. Cut into wedges, garnish with tomatoes and cilantro and enjoy!
title: Soy Chorizo Frittata

directions:
Vinaigrette:
Place minced shallots in a small bowl. Squeeze the juice from one blood orange over the shallots. Add vinegar, salt, and pepper. Let sit for 10 minutes while you prep your salad. After 10 minutes, whisk in the olive oil. Set aside.
Salad:
Using a sharp knife, remove stems & fonds from fennel and slice in half vertically. Using only ½ of the bulb, cut out the core. Slice into thin bite-sized strips. Set aside.
Peel the remaining four blood oranges. Slice them into rounds or bite-sized pieces. Set aside.
Chop pecans. Set aside.
Dice avocado. Set aside.
In a large bowl, combine lettuce, fennel, blood oranges, pecans, avocado, feta, and ½ of the vinaigrette and lightly toss.
Serve with the remainder of the vinaigrette on the side. Enjoy!Vinaigrette:Place minced shallots in a small bowl. Squeeze the juice from one blood orange over the shallots. Add vinegar, salt, and pepper. Let sit for 10 minutes while you prep your salad. After 10 minutes, whisk in the olive oil. Set aside.Salad:Using a sharp knife, remove stems & fonds from fennel and slice in half vertically. Using only ½ of the bulb, cut out the core. Slice into thin bite-sized strips. Set aside.Peel the remaining four blood oranges. Slice them into rounds or bite-sized pieces. Set aside.Chop pecans. Set aside.Dice avocado. Set aside.In a large bowl, combine lettuce, fennel, blood oranges, pecans, avocado, feta, and ½ of the vinaigrette and lightly toss.Serve with the remainder of the vinaigrette on the side. Enjoy!
title: Blood Orange & Butter Lettuce Salad with Avocado, Fennel & Feta
ingredients: 2 tablespoons TJ's Organic Raw Apple Cider Vinegar
2 tablespoons TJ's Extra Virgin Olive Oil
1 cup TJ's Roasted & Salted Pecan Halves
3 tablespoons TJ's Organic Crumbled Feta Cheese

title: Cilantro Crema
directions: Add all ingredients to the bowl of a blender or food processor. Blend for 1-2 minutes until smooth. Pour into a bowl or squeeze bottle and drizzle atop eggs, burritos, tacos, salads, fajitas, burgers...Add all ingredients to the bowl of a blender or food processor. title: Oatmeal Date Breakfast Shake
ingredients: 1/4 cup TJ's Gluten Free Rolled Oats
3 Tablespoons TJ's Raw Shelled Hemp Seed, plus more for garnish
directions:
Add dates and rolled oats to a small bowl and cover with 1/2 cup of hot water for 1 minute to soften. Drain.
Add softened dates and oats, almond beverage, and hemp seed to a blender and pulse until smooth.
Pour into a glass and garnish with extra hemp seed. Enjoy!Add dates and rolled oats to a small bowl and cover with 1/2 cup of hot water for 1 minute to soften. Drain.Add softened dates and oats, almond beverage, and hemp seed to a blender and pulse until smooth.Pour into a glass and garnish with extra hemp seed. Enjoy!

Prepare the cupcakes: Preheat the oven to 350°F and move the oven rack to the lower third of the oven. Line a muffin pan with baking cups; set aside. In a large mixing bowl, combine melted butter, eggs, milk and cake mix; whisk until smooth. Add 4 matcha packets to bowl and whisk to combine.
Using a serving spoon or ice cream scoop, fill baking cups 2/3 full with matcha cake batter. Place pan in oven and bake for 15-17 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove pan from oven and allow cupcakes to cool completely before frosting.
Prepare the frosting: While cupcakes are baking, in the bowl of an electric mixer with paddle attachment (or in a bowl with a hand mixer), beat softened butter on medium speed until smooth. Reduce speed to medium low and add powdered sugar to bowl in 1/2 cup increments, mixing thoroughly between additions. Scrape bowl with a spatula. Add milk and 1 1/2 matcha packets to bowl and beat on medium-low speed to combine. Using a spatula, generously frost cooled cupcakes and sprinkle with remaining matcha powder. Enjoy immediately!Prepare the cupcakes: Preheat the oven to 350°F and move the oven rack to the lower third of the oven. Line a muffin pan with baking cups; set aside. title: Matcha Matcha Cupcakes
ingredients: 1 box TJ's Vanilla Cake & Baking Mix
1/2 cup (1 stick) TJ's Unsalted Butter, melted
4 TJ's Single Serve Matcha Green Tea Packets
1/2 cup (1 stick) TJ's Unsalted Butter, softened

title: Pumpkin Bars
ingredients: 1 stick TJ's Unsalted Butter, melted and cooled
1 box TJ's Pumpkin Bread & Muffin Mix (seasonal)
¾ cup TJ's Organic Cane Sugar
½ teaspoon TJ's Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract
directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8-inch square baking pan with canola oil spray, set aside.
In a medium bowl, whisk eggs. Slowly add butter, whisking to incorporate. Add pumpkin bread mix, sugar and water to bowl. Fold together with a spatula just until combined. Transfer batter to prepared baking pan, smoothing into an even layer (batter will be sticky).
Bake on center rack of oven for about 35 minutes, until top is a dark golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Remove from oven and let cool completely on cooling rack before slicing.
In a small bowl, whisk sour cream and vanilla. Add powdered sugar and continue whisking until combined. Cover and refrigerate.
To serve, slice into squares and top with a dollop of sour cream topping. Sprinkle with pumpkin pie spice, if desired, and serve.Preheat oven to 350°F. Fold together with a spatula just until combined. Cover and refrigerate.To serve, slice into squares and top with a dollop of sour cream topping. Sprinkle with pumpkin pie spice, if desired, and serve.

ingredients: 1/2 cup TJ's Whole Grain Dijon Mustard
title: Fancy Figgy Glazed Chicken
directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F. In a small mixing bowl, combine fig butter, mustard, and vinaigrette; set aside.
Remove chicken from packaging and pat dry with paper towels. Place chicken in a baking dish and cover with 2/3 of the glaze mixture. Turn chicken breast-side down and roast for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven, turn chicken breast-side up and spread the remaining glaze mixture on the chicken.
Continue roasting about 1.5 hours, basting every 20 minutes, until internal temperature registers 165°F. Allow chicken to sit for 15 minutes before carving.Preheat oven to 350°F. In a small mixing bowl, combine fig butter, mustard, and vinaigrette; set aside.Remove chicken from packaging and pat dry with paper towels. Place chicken in a baking dish and cover with 2/3 of the glaze mixture. Turn chicken breast-side down and roast for 30 minutes. Remove from the oven, turn chicken breast-side up and spread the remaining glaze mixture on the chicken.Continue roasting about 1.5 hours, basting every 20 minutes, until internal temperature registers 165°F. Allow chicken to sit for 15 minutes before carving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
Place bacon on foil lined baking sheet and bake 12 minutes or until desired crispness.
While the bacon cooks, carefully slice the croissants ALMOST all of the way through. Remove some of the breading from the inside to create shallow cavities for filling.
Remove bacon to a plate and let cool. Once cool enough to handle, crumble or cut to desired size.
Spread 1 tablespoon of cookie butter into the cavity of each cut side of the croissants. Sprinkle bacon pieces evenly among the croissants (or more in your own if no one is looking). Press the 2 sides back together.
In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter.
 
In a shallow dish, beat the eggs and milk together. Dip each croissant in the mixture, ensuring an even coating on all sides.
Add the croissants to the skillet, working in batches, if necessary. Cook about 2 minutes on each side until desired darkness, watching carefully to make sure they don't burn.
Finished croissants can be held in the warm oven while the others cook if working in batches. Serve warm and drizzled with Midnight Moo chocolate syrup.
 
Recipe Credit: Trader Joe's 2015 Strut Your Stuffed Recipe Contest 1st Runner-Up – Jeannette Powers of

title: Cookie Butter & Bacon Stuffed French Toast

ingredients: 1 package TJ's Dry Rubbed Bacon OR TJ's Uncured Fully Cooked Bacon
TJ's Gluten Free Whole Grain Bread
TJ's Fresh Pre-Sliced Mozzarella Cheese Log
TJ's Fresh Basil, rinsed and dried
directions:
If using fully cooked bacon, microwave bacon according to package directions, and skip down to toasting bread.
If using dry rubbed bacon, preheat oven to 400°F. Place a wire rack on a large rimmed baking sheet. Arrange bacon evenly on wire rack. Place sheet on center rack of oven and bake 15-20 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Tear bacon pieces in half, set aside.
Toast 8 slices of bread to desired doneness. Layer basil and baby lettuce on toasted bread, followed by bacon, mozzarella, and tomato. Drizzle with balsamic glaze and top with another piece of toasted bread. Repeat steps to build 3 more sandwiches. Enjoy immediately!If using fully cooked bacon, microwave bacon according to package directions, and skip down to toasting bread.If using dry rubbed bacon, preheat oven to 400°F. title: Caprese BLT

ingredients: 20 TJ's Dark Chocolate Peanut Butter Cups, cut into thirds
directions:
Coat a 13x9 pan with canola oil spray and set aside. Remove cereal bag from outer box. With cereal still in the bag, use your hands to crush cereal into smaller pieces; measure out 6 cups and set aside.
In a large pan, melt butter over medium heat. Add marshmallows and stir until melted. Turn off heat and add crushed cereal and 2/3 of the peanut butter cups to pan. Stir quickly to incorporate into marshmallow mixture.
Press the cereal mixture into greased pan with the back of a spoon. Top with remaining peanut butter cups. Using a piece of waxed paper, gently press peanut butter cups into treats. Let cool, then cut into squares and enjoy!Coat a 13x9 pan with canola oil spray and set aside. Remove cereal bag from outer box. title: Sriracha BBQ Meatballs
ingredients: 1 bag TJ's Frozen Meatballs (we used the Turkey variety)
1 bottle TJ's Organic Sriracha and Roasted Garlic BBQ Sauce
directions:
Empty meatball in a large microwave safe bowl. Cover with a lid or plate. Microwave for 4 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a medium saucepan, begin heating entire jar of Sriracha BBQ sauce on low, stirring occasionally.
Remove bowl of meatballs from microwave. Bowl will be hot, handle carefully. Add meatballs to saucepan and stir, coating meatballs on all sides with sauce. Continue to heat on low, about 3 minutes until bubbly.
Empty meatballs and sauce into a serving bowl. Garnish with chives and serve with toothpicks.Empty meatball in a large microwave safe bowl. Cover with a lid or plate. In a small bowl, mash garlic and salt together with the back of a spoon to form a paste. Set aside. In a separate bowl, whisk together lemon juice and olive oil. Slowly add the lemon juice and olive oil to the garlic paste and whisk until emulsified.
In a large, shallow serving bowl, toss arugula with lemon dressing. Arrange tomato wedges atop arugula. Remove cream-filled burrata balls from container, arrange atop arugula and gently break them open with your hands. Drizzle salad with balsamic glaze. Serve immediately.In a small bowl, mash garlic and salt together with the back of a spoon to form a paste. Set aside. In a separate bowl, whisk together lemon juice and olive oil. 4 large TJ's Heirloom Tomatoes OR Kumato Tomatoes, sliced into small wedges

Coconut White Hot Chocolate

Blend the Mangorita:
Place mango, 1 tablespoon lime juice, margarita mix, tequila and ice into a blender. Pulse several times until mixture is well blended and slushy.

title: Mangorita!
ingredients: 2 TJ's Lime (1 for .5 oz juice & 1 for garnish
1 TJ's Mango, peeled, pitted & coarsely chopped
6-8 TJ's Large Eggs (1 egg per guest)
2 bags TJ's Organic Baby Spinach, for serving
TJ's Avocado, sliced, and TJ's Sriracha Sauce, for garnish
title: Brunch Fried Rice
directions:
Heat oil in a large nonstick pan over medium-high heat. Add fried rice to pan and toss to coat. Cover and sauté 5-7 minutes until chicken is heated through, stirring halfway through cooking.
Remove lid and reduce heat to medium. Spread rice evenly in pan and create wells in the rice with the back of a spoon. Crack an egg into each well and replace lid. Cook 5-7 minutes or to preferred egg doneness. Remove lid and remove pan from heat.
Divide spinach among plates. Using a spatula, carefully separate rice around each egg into individual servings. Gently place an egg rice patty atop each bed of spinach. Top with sliced avocado and a generous squirt of sriracha sauce, and dig in!Heat oil in a large nonstick pan over medium-high heat. Add fried rice to pan and toss to coat. Cover and sauté 5-7 minutes until chicken is heated through, stirring halfway through cooking.Remove lid and reduce heat to medium. Spread rice evenly in pan and create wells in the rice with the back of a spoon. Crack an egg into each well and replace lid. Cook 5-7 minutes or to preferred egg doneness. Remove lid and remove pan from heat.Divide spinach among plates. Using a spatula, carefully separate rice around each egg into individual servings. Gently place an egg rice patty atop each bed of spinach. Top with sliced avocado and a generous squirt of sriracha sauce, and dig in!

title: PB&J Snack Mix
ingredients: 2 bags TJ's Freeze Dried Red Seedless Grapes Slices
3 TJ's Bagels cut in half (for a total of 6)
4 pieces TJ's Fully Cooked Uncured Apple Smoked Bacon, chopped
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place all bagel halves on a baking sheet. Spread pizza sauce on each, about 2 heaping tablespoons or more to your liking. Sprinkle shredded mozzarella liberally on each, covering the entire bagel. Chop 4 pieces of fully cooked bacon and put on 3 bagels. Place 3 pieces of pepperoni on top of the remaining 3 bagels. Place in oven for 12 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbling. We recommend dipping in your favorite Ranch or Blue Cheese Dip. Have fun with the toppings… add more or less to your liking!
title: Pizza Bagels

directions:
Prepare pickled onions: In a medium bowl, whisk together vinegar, sugar, salt and chili flakes. Add onion slices, cover with plastic wrap and set aside. Let sit at room temperature while preparing remaining ingredients. (Recommended: To prepare onions ahead of time, add 1/2 cup of water to vinegar solution, stir and refrigerate one hour or overnight for best results.) Drain onions before serving.

ingredients: 2 packages TJ's Frozen Brown Rice, heated
TJ's Bool Kogi, cooked and sliced
1/2 package TJ's Wasabi Roasted Seaweed Snacks, crumbled

directions:
Preheat oven to 425°F.
Prick sweet potatoes all over with a fork and place on a lined baking sheet.
Bake for 45- 50 minutes or until tender and a fork can be easily inserted in the thickest part of the potato.
Let cool slightly, cut potatoes partially open (length-wise) with a knife. Loosely "stuff" and top with salad. Sprinkle with cheese crumbles (optional) and serve immediately. Place onion chunks in pressure cooker. Remove brisket from package and cut into three large pieces. Arrange brisket atop onions, fat-side down. Pour beer and water over brisket.
Seal pressure cooker lid and cook on high pressure for 20 minutes per pound (that's 70 minutes for a 3.5-pound brisket; add or subtract cook time as necessary based on the weight of your brisket). Let pressure release naturally for 20 minutes, then manually release remaining pressure. Carefully transfer brisket pieces to a cutting board and cover with foil.
Strain cooking liquid, reserving 1.5 cups liquid to cook vegetables; discard solids. Add potatoes, carrots and cabbage wedges to pressure cooker and cover with reserved liquid. Seal lid and cook on high pressure for 3 minutes. Quick release pressure. Use tongs to transfer vegetables to a large serving platter; reserve cooking liquid for serving.
Gently slice corned beef against the grain and arrange next to vegetables on serving platter. Spoon cooking liquid atop corned beef. directions:
Cut corner off bag of haricots verts and microwave 2 minutes. Remove haricots verts from package and place on a clean dish towel to cool and dry. Transfer haricots verts to cutting board and slice in half crosswise; set aside.
Bring a large pot of generously salted water to a boil. Add pasta and cook 7 minutes. Add kale and cook about 2 more minutes, until noodles are very al dente and kale is wilted. Drain and rinse thoroughly with cold water. Drain very well and transfer mixture to a large bowl. Add haricots verts, dressing, and almonds to bowl and toss to combine. Season to taste with sea salt and toss once more.

directions:
Preheat oven to 425°F. Arrange taquitos in a single layer in a 7-inch by 10-inch baking dish and cover evenly with enchilada sauce. Top with 1 1/2 cups cheese, followed by olives and chiles.

ingredients: 1 cup TJ's Honey Graham Crackers, crumbed

directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 9x11-inch baking pan with canola oil spray, set aside.
In a medium mixing bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs, sugar, and one stick (1/2 cup) of melted butter. Mix until combined. Press mixture into an even layer on the bottom of the greased pan.
In a medium bowl mix egg, water, and the rest of the melted butter to combine. Add baking mix and stir, just until batter comes together. Pour batter in the pan on top of the crust and spread into an even layer, completely covering the crust.
Bake on the middle rack of the over for about 40 – 45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean.
Remove cake from oven, leaving oven on. Arrange marshmallows in a single layer on top of the cake, completely covering its surface. Place back in oven for about 5 minutes, or until marshmallows begin to brown on top. (For an extra-crisp top layer, toast the marshmallows with a kitchen torch after the cake comes out of the oven.)
Let cool completely. Remove from pan and enjoy!Preheat oven to 350°F. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees.
Line a small baking pan with foil.
Cut feta as you would cut a loaf of bread into four equal slices. Place slices facedown on foil-covered sheet pan. Cover with olive oil.
Bake for eight minutes, or until the cheese is soft to the touch (but not melted). Remove from oven.
Preheat the broiler.
Heat the honey in the microwave until it is fluid enough to spread with a pastry brush. Remove honey from microwave and spread generously over feta slices.
Place honey-covered feta in broiler for about two minutes. Keep a close eye on it and remove from broiler once the top of the cheese browns and begins to bubble.
Serve with flatbread, tomatoes, and thyme. Enjoy!Preheat the oven to 400 degrees.Line a small baking pan with foil.Cut feta as you would cut a loaf of bread into four equal slices. directions:
Fill a pot with a few inches of water and bring to a boil. Place a steamer basket in pot. Place tempeh in steamer basket. Steam for 15 minutes.
Remove from pot from heat. Remove tempeh from basket. Allow to cool slightly.
Dice tempeh into small, bite-sized cubes.
Combine tempeh cubes & coconut aminos in a small bowl. Toss to thoroughly coat tempeh in coconut aminos. Cover and let marinate for 10 minutes. Uncover and drain excess aminos.
Heat small amount of oil in a medium-sized pan. Pan-fry tempeh for 3 – 5 minutes, stirring continuously until crispy. Remove from heat and set aside.
In a large bowl, toss salad with dressing and toppings. Add tempeh and mix together.
Divide among plates or bowls and enjoy!Fill a pot with a few inches of water and bring to a boil. Place a steamer basket in pot. Place tempeh in steamer basket. directions:
Combine Ginger Brew and Orange Juice in a large pitcher.
To sugar the rims of your glasses: pour a splash of your liquid mixture onto a small plate. Combine orange zest and sugar on another small plate. Turn glasses upside down. One by one, dip each glass in the liquid mixture—submerging just the rim—then place it on the plate holding the sugar & zest mixture. Rotate glass until rim is sufficiently sugared.  
Pour the rest of the beverage into the sugared glasses carefully, so as not to rinse off the rim! For garnish, add as many frozen cranberries as you'd like... And if you add a splash of vodka or bourbon, we won't tell.Combine Ginger Brew and Orange Juice in a large pitcher.To sugar the rims of your glasses: pour a splash of your liquid mixture onto a small plate. directions: Preheat oven 350° F. Unroll pie crust over a 9 inch pie pan, per "Using Crust" package instructions. Mix together the sweet potatoes, 1/2 of the cream, 1/2 of sugar, butter, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt, until smooth. Taste and adjust seasoning (add more cream if desired or if mixture is too dry). In a separate small bowl, whip eggs with a whisk, and then fold into the sweet potato mixture. Pour mixture into the pie crust. Place pie in oven and bake for 1 hour or until the center is firm and dry (use a tooth pick to test). It may be a little brown around the edges. Remove from oven and allow pie to cool on a rack before cutting and serving. Serve with a dollop of whipping cream (see package directions).Preheat oven 350° F. ingredients: 1 package TJ's Pie Crusts, thawed according to package directions

directions:
Preheat oven to 375°F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper; set aside.
Working in two batches, unroll softened dough and smooth together any cracks with your hands. Remove top layer of plastic film and cut dough into quarters. Place a piece of dough on lined baking sheet and top with 1/4 cup channa masala. Starting at one corner and working around the edge of the dough, gently pull dough up toward center, pinching and folding edges to create a dumpling. Repeat with remaining dough and filling (you'll end up with 8 pasties on the baking sheet).
In a small bowl, thoroughly whisk the egg. Using a pastry brush, evenly brush the tops of the pasties with whisked egg. Place baking sheet on center rack of oven and bake for 30 minutes, until crust is golden. Allow to cool 5 minutes. Enjoy on the go, or at the table with mixed greens and Cumin-y Riced Cauliflower on the side.
Freezing/Reheating Instructions: Wrap leftover pasties in cling wrap and toss in the freezer. To reheat, remove cling wrap and place pasty on a microwave safe dish. Heat at 50% power for 1 minute, then at full power for 1 minute. Allow to cool slightly before serving.Preheat oven to 375°F. To reheat, remove cling wrap and place pasty on a microwave safe dish. Heat at 50% power for 1 minute, then at full power for 1 minute. Allow to cool slightly before serving.

title: Caprese Risoni
directions:
In a medium saucepan, bring 1.5 cups of water to a boil. Stir in 1 cup of Risoni and return to boil. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 9 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Remove from heat and let stand, covered, for 5 minutes.
Cut tomatoes into quarters.
Mix together Risoni, tomatoes, pesto, cheese, and drizzle with glaze.
Serve immediately and enjoy!In a medium saucepan, bring 1.5 cups of water to a boil. Stir in 1 cup of Risoni and return to boil. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 9 minutes, stirring occasionally.Remove from heat and let stand, covered, for 5 minutes.Cut tomatoes into quarters.Mix together Risoni, tomatoes, pesto, cheese, and drizzle with glaze.Serve immediately and enjoy!
ingredients: 1 cup TJ's Organic Chickpea & Red Lentil Risoni
6 TJ's Organic Tomatoes on the Vine

title: Hot & Spicy Wings with Chunky Blue Cheese
ingredients: 1 bag TJ's Hot & Spicy Chicken Wings Sections
1 cup (about 12) TJ's Organic Cut and Peeled Carrots
1/3 cup TJ's Chunky Blue Cheese Dressing & Dip
A handful of TJ's Parsley (optional), for garnish
directions:
Place wings in a circle (leave space in the center) on a microwave safe plate. Microwave uncovered on high: FROZEN wings 7 to 9 minutes – THAWED wings 4 to 5 minutes or until heated through. Plate will be hot, remove carefully.
While wings are heating, rinse celery stalks, trim both ends and cut into thirds.
Once wings have cooled for a minute, arrange them on a platter, over a bed of parsley. Serve with a bowl of blue cheese dressing, celery sticks and carrots.Place wings in a circle (leave space in the center) on a microwave safe plate. Serve with a bowl of blue cheese dressing, celery sticks and carrots.

Prepare the quinoa according to package directions. While quinoa cooks, add pineapple tidbits to a saute pan over medium heat. Cook 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally. Turn heat to medium-high and add snap peas and green onions to pan. Add 2 tablespoons water and cover with lid to steam, about 2 minutes. When water has evaporated, remove pan from heat.
In a large bowl, add all ingredients, tossing gently to combine. Season to taste with salt & pepper, and add more dressing if desired. Serve warm, or chill for 1 hour and serve.Prepare the quinoa according to package directions. While quinoa cooks, add pineapple tidbits to a saute pan over medium heat. Serve warm, or chill for 1 hour and serve.
ingredients: 1/2 bag TJ's Sugar Snap Peas, sliced
1/4 to 1/2 cup TJ's Fat Free Sesame Vinaigrette (to taste)
title: Sesame Quinoa Salad

directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F. Spray muffin pan with coconut oil spray, set aside.
In a medium bowl, whisk together sugar, brown sugar and cinnamon. Toss biscuit pieces in sugar mixture until well coated; set aside.
Add 1 tablespoon caramel sauce to 10 of the greased muffin pan cups. On top of the caramel, layer the following ingredients in order: 4 banana slices, 1 teaspoon of pecans, and one small handful of jumbo raisins. Gently press three of the coated biscuit pieces over each cup (you will have a couple extra pieces - be creative).
Place pan in center rack of oven and bake approximately 15 minutes or until dough turns golden brown and an inserted toothpick comes out clean. Remove pan from oven and allow to cool for 1 minute. Flip the entire muffin pan over a clean cutting board to release sticky buns from the cups. Serve warm.Preheat oven to 350°F. title: Sticky Monkey Buns
ingredients: 1 roll TJ's refrigerated Buttermilk Biscuits, separated & sliced into quarters
1 jar TJ's Fleur de Sel Caramel Sauce
2 ripe TJ's Bananas, sliced into medallions
1/3 cup TJ's Unsalted Dry Roasted Pecan Pieces
Standard 12-slot muffin pan (or 10 ceramic ramekin or 10 mason jars placed on a baking tray)
3 cups TJ's Frozen Hash Browns, thawed
TJ's Fire Roasted Red Peppers, thinly sliced for garnish
directions:
Prepare Boxty Pancakes: Mix hash browns, flour, eggs, heavy cream, chives, and salt in a bowl. Heat butter in nonstick pan on medium high heat until melted. Use ¼ cup measurer to spoon batter into pan. Flip when browned on one side (about 2 minutes), and remove when browned on second side.
Assemble Tacos: Place a banger atop each pancake and garnish with sliced peppers and Cruciferous Crunch. Drizzle tacos with gravy and serve immediately.Prepare Boxty Pancakes: Mix hash browns, flour, eggs, heavy cream, chives, and salt in a bowl. title: Irish Tacos

ingredients: 2 slices TJ's Cucumber, plus more for garnish
2 parts TJ's French Market Sparkling Lemonade
title: Lemony Gin Refresher
directions: Muddle 2 cucumber slices in the bottom of a rocks glass. Fill with crushed ice, lemonade and gin, and gently stir to combine. Garnish with rosemary and another cucumber slice, and serve.Muddle 2 cucumber slices in the bottom of a rocks glass. Fill with crushed ice, lemonade and gin, and gently stir to combine. Garnish with rosemary and another cucumber slice, and serve.

To make the dressing, combine BBQ sauce and mayonnaise in a small bowl, mixing a few tablespoons at a time until you reach the desired flavor. Sprinkle dressing with salt and pepper. Combine the remaining ingredients in a medium bowl and toss with the dressing. Chill 30 minutes prior to serving.To make the dressing, combine BBQ sauce and mayonnaise in a small bowl, mixing a few tablespoons at a time until you reach the desired flavor. Sprinkle dressing with salt and pepper. Combine the remaining ingredients in a medium bowl and toss with the dressing. Chill 30 minutes prior to serving.

4-5 Tbsp TJ's Carolina Gold BBQ Sauce (seasonal)

1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste

title: Carolina Gold Slaw
Pumpkin Pie Milkshake
directions: Place two glasses in the freezer to chill. Add pie, milk, and ice cream to a blender pitcher. Cover and pulse ingredients together on low to combine, then blend on high until smooth and uniform. Remove glasses from freezer. Pour milkshake into glasses and garnish with whipped cream and reserved pie crust. Enjoy!Place two glasses in the freezer to chill. Add pie, milk, and ice cream to a blender pitcher. Cover and pulse ingredients together on low to combine, then blend on high until smooth and uniform. Remove glasses from freezer. Pour milkshake into glasses and garnish with whipped cream and reserved pie crust. Enjoy!

4-5 scoops TJ's Super Premium French Vanilla Ice Cream

title: Cocoa Peanut Butter Bacon Bagel
directions: Slice bagel in half and toast until warm. Spread Cocoa Almond Spread over one side of bagel and peanut butter over the other. Cut slices of bacon in half and arrange on one side of bagel. Sandwich the sides together and cut in half. Serve immediately.Slice bagel in half and toast until warm. Spread Cocoa Almond Spread over one side of bagel and peanut butter over the other. Cut slices of bacon in half and arrange on one side of bagel. Sandwich the sides together and cut in half. Serve immediately.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons TJ's Creamy Salted Peanut Butter
2 slices TJ's Uncured Dry Rubbed Sliced Bacon, cooked

title: Tikka Masala Burritos
directions:
Remove tikka masala tray from carton and puncture film 2 to 3 times. Microwave on high for 3 minutes. Carefully peel back film enough to gently stir sauce. Heat an additional 1 to 1½ minutes to an internal temperature of 165°F. Carefully remove film; set aside.
Warm tortillas in a dry skillet or directly over flame. Remove from heat and lay tortillas on a clean work surface. Divide rice and tikka masala between tortillas. Top each with peas, a few dollops of yogurt and chutney, and cilantro.
To roll, pull half of the tortilla closest to you up to meet the top half, then pull the tortilla and fillings back toward you. Fold in the left and right sides of the tortilla, then roll tightly until closed. Enjoy!Remove tikka masala tray from carton and puncture film 2 to 3 times. Microwave on high for 3 minutes. Carefully peel back film enough to gently stir sauce. Heat an additional 1 to 1½ minutes to an internal temperature of 165°F. Carefully remove film; set aside.Warm tortillas in a dry skillet or directly over flame. Remove from heat and lay tortillas on a clean work surface. Divide rice and tikka masala between tortillas. Top each with peas, a few dollops of yogurt and chutney, and cilantro.To roll, pull half of the tortilla closest to you up to meet the top half, then pull the tortilla and fillings back toward you. Fold in the left and right sides of the tortilla, then roll tightly until closed. Enjoy!
ingredients: 1 package TJ's Chicken Tikka Masala OR Vegan Tikka Masala
½ cup TJ's Organic Peas, heated according to package directions and drained

directions:
Add 1 tablespoon olive oil to a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add half of the diced onion to pan and sauté until translucent, 3-5 minutes. Meanwhile, roughly chop jackfruit. Add jackfruit to pan and sauté another 5 minutes.
Add cumin, nutritional yeast, oregano, paprika, salt and pepper to pan, stirring to coat jackfruit. Sauté 3 minutes. Add coconut aminos, apple cider vinegar and orange juice to pan and sauté an additional 5 minutes, breaking jackfruit down into smaller pieces with a wooden spoon. Add remaining tablespoon olive oil and stir to coat. Let cool slightly.
Garnish cooked jackfruit with remaining diced onion and lime juice. Enjoy!Add 1 tablespoon olive oil to a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add jackfruit to pan and sauté another 5 minutes.Add cumin, nutritional yeast, oregano, paprika, salt and pepper to pan, stirring to coat jackfruit. Sauté 3 minutes. Add remaining tablespoon olive oil and stir to coat. Let cool slightly.Garnish cooked jackfruit with remaining diced onion and lime juice. Enjoy!
ingredients: 2 tablespoons of your favorite TJ's Olive Oil, divided
1/2 TJ's Jumbo Yellow Onion, diced and divided
2 cans TJ's Green Jackfruit in Brine, drained and deseeded
2 teaspoons TJ's Organic Apple Cider Vinegar
title: Jackfruit Carnitas

directions: Preheat to 425°F. Lightly brush top and bottom of crust with oil. Spread sauce evenly over crust to within half an inch of the edges. Top with cheese, pepperoni, and oregano. Place on a pizza pan, baking sheet, or for a crisper crust directly on oven rack, and bake 5 to 8 minutes. Cook until cheese is melted and crust is golden brown and crisp on edges.Preheat to 425°F. Lightly brush top and bottom of crust with oil. Spread sauce evenly over crust to within half an inch of the edges. Top with cheese, pepperoni, and oregano. Place on a pizza pan, baking sheet, or for a crisper crust directly on oven rack, and bake 5 to 8 minutes. Cook until cheese is melted and crust is golden brown and crisp on edges.
title: Pepperoni Slab Pizza
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups TJ's Organic Shredded Mozzarella Cheese
A few dashes TJ's Organic Oregano (optional)

title: Gouda Vibes Summer Cheese Plate
directions: Slice or cube cheeses as desired (wash your knife in between cheeses to keep the flavors separate). Arrange in piles on a large serving platter or cheese board. Fill in the gaps with fruit and almonds. Pour honey into a small dipping bowl or ramekin and nestle in between fruit and cheese. Serve with dry white wine, cider, or another sparkling summer refreshment of your choosing.Slice or cube cheeses as desired (wash your knife in between cheeses to keep the flavors separate). ingredients: ¼ TJ's Cantaloupe, seeds removed and cut into cubes or scooped into balls

title: Breakfast Tacos
ingredients: 1 bag TJ's Roasted Potatoes with Peppers & Onions
1 package TJ's Soy Chorizo, removed from casing
2 packages TJ's Corn & Wheat Tortillas, or your favorite TJ's tortillas
TJ's Mild or Hot Pico de Gallo Salsa
directions:
Preheat oven to 400°F. Spread potatoes, peppers & onions on a very large (or 2 medium-sized) rimmed baking sheet. Place sheet on center rack of oven and bake 20-25 minutes, until potatoes are crisp and golden. Remove from oven and transfer to a serving dish.
While potatoes roast, prepare soy chorizo: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add soy chorizo and sauté 5-8 minutes, until slightly browned and temperature reaches 165°F. Transfer to a serving bowl and cover to keep warm (wipe skillet with a paper towel; you'll use it to scramble the eggs).
If desired, warm tortillas in a clean, dry skillet (or use tongs if warming directly over the burner); cover and keep warm for serving.
In a large bowl, beat eggs and season with salt and pepper. Melt remaining oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Pour egg mixture into center of pan and stir slowly. When curds start to form, reduce heat to low and gently fold eggs over. Cook 2-3 minutes more, then transfer eggs to a plate and let rest 1 minute to finish cooking.
Assembly: Fill a tortilla with soy chorizo, roasted potatoes, and scrambled eggs. Garnish with cheese, salsa, and avocado. Alternatively, lay the ingredients out buffet-style, and let your guests be the captains of their own breakfast taco ships. Enjoy!Preheat oven to 400°F. Remove from oven and transfer to a serving dish.While potatoes roast, prepare soy chorizo: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Garnish with cheese, salsa, and avocado. Alternatively, lay the ingredients out buffet-style, and let your guests be the captains of their own breakfast taco ships. Enjoy!

title: 21 Seasoning Salute Vinaigrette
directions:
In a small bowl, whisk together cheese, vinegar, sugar, 21 seasoning salute, salt, and pepper. Slowly whisk in oil until emulsified. Taste and adjust seasoning as desired. Makes about 1 cup of vinaigrette.
Serving ideas: mixed in a tortellini salad, or as a marinade for fish or chickenIn a small bowl, whisk together cheese, vinegar, sugar, 21 seasoning salute, salt, and pepper. 1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste

1/3 cup TJ's Extra Virgin Olive Oil

directions:
Add cheeses, chili pepper sauce, seasoning and lemon juice to food processor bowl. Pulse to bring mixture together, scraping down sides of bowl as needed. Continue to process until mixture is smooth, 1-2 minutes.
Lay a square of cling wrap large enough to cover cheese ball on work surface. Scoop cheese mixture into center of wrap, then gather wrap up on all sides, gently shaping the mixture into a ball. Twist the ends of the cling wrap tightly, and refrigerate cheese ball (2 hours minimum, but overnight really lets the flavors meld together!).
Before serving, remove cheese ball from fridge. Spread chopped pecans on work surface. Unwrap cheese ball and press into chopped pecans, gently reshaping as needed. Serve with a cheese spreader, surrounded by TJ's Golden Rounds Crackers.Add cheeses, chili pepper sauce, seasoning and lemon juice to food processor bowl. ingredients: 1 package TJ's Unexpected Cheddar, broken into chunks
½ package TJ's Sweet & Spicy Pecans, chopped
TJ's Golden Rounds Crackers, for serving

title: Cumin-y Riced Cauliflower
directions: In a large skillet, heat coconut oil over medium-high heat. Add diced onions and sauté 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add riced cauliflower to skillet and sauté another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add cumin and sauté another two minutes, until fragrant. Season to taste with salt and serve immediately.In a large skillet, heat coconut oil over medium-high heat. Add diced onions and sauté 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add riced cauliflower to skillet and sauté another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add cumin and sauté another two minutes, until fragrant. Season to taste with salt and serve immediately.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon TJ's Organic Extra Virgin Coconut Oil

title: Roasted Strawberry Salad
ingredients: 1 pound TJ's Strawberries, cleaned, dried and hulled
1 tablespoon TJ's Extra Virgin Spanish Olive Oil
6 oz TJ's Baby Spinach (1 package or 1/2 package depending on region)
1/3 cup TJ's Chevre Log with Honey, crumbled
directions: Preheat oven to 400. Slice strawberries in half lengthwise. Toss with olive oil and place on a foil lined baking sheet. Cook for 15 minutes.  Toss with balsamic glaze and then set aside to cool. Once the strawberries have cooled, combine with spinach and cheese. Toss and serve.

Preheat a skillet to medium heat and add a little oil. Cook burgers for 4 to 5 minutes per side, until the shrimp turn opaque and reach an internal temperature of 145°F. Let cool slightly and set aside.
Divide spring mix among plates. Top each salad with a burger, sliced radish, and a drizzle of dressing. Enjoy immediately.Preheat a skillet to medium heat and add a little oil. Cook burgers for 4 to 5 minutes per side, until the shrimp turn opaque and reach an internal temperature of 145°F. Let cool slightly and set aside.Divide spring mix among plates. Top each salad with a burger, sliced radish, and a drizzle of dressing. Enjoy immediately.
title: Shrimp Burger Salad
ingredients: 2 – 4 tablespoons TJ's Carrot Ginger Miso Salad Dressing

directions:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cover a baking sheet with aluminum foil and set aside.
When working with jalapeños, wear disposable gloves to avoid eye irritation. Slice the jalapeños in half lengthwise. For a nicer presentation, slice each stem in half as well. Scrape out the seeds and membranes from each half. Place jalapeños on the baking sheet and set aside.
In a medium bowl, combine artichoke dip, 1 cup corn, ½ cup mozzarella and 2 teaspoons cilantro. Stir until well incorporated. Taste and add fresh ground black pepper as desired.
With a small spoon, fill each jalapeño half with about 1 tablespoon of the cheese mixture. Smooth the mixture so that it fills the entire cavity evenly, reaching the top edge of the pepper, but not overflowing (if the peppers are filled too much, they can tip over while baking). Sprinkle reserved ½ cup of mozzarella over the jalapeños. Arrange peppers on the baking sheet and bake until cheese is browned and bubbling and the peppers have softened, about 20 minutes. Remove from oven and cool before serving. Garnish with extra cilantro.Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cover a baking sheet with aluminum foil and set aside.When working with jalapeños, wear disposable gloves to avoid eye irritation. Slice the jalapeños in half lengthwise. For a nicer presentation, slice each stem in half as well. Scrape out the seeds and membranes from each half. Place jalapeños on the baking sheet and set aside.In a medium bowl, combine artichoke dip, 1 cup corn, ½ cup mozzarella and 2 teaspoons cilantro. Stir until well incorporated. Taste and add fresh ground black pepper as desired.With a small spoon, fill each jalapeño half with about 1 tablespoon of the cheese mixture. Smooth the mixture so that it fills the entire cavity evenly, reaching the top edge of the pepper, but not overflowing (if the peppers are filled too much, they can tip over while baking). Sprinkle reserved ½ cup of mozzarella over the jalapeños. Arrange peppers on the baking sheet and bake until cheese is browned and bubbling and the peppers have softened, about 20 minutes. Remove from oven and cool before serving. Garnish with extra cilantro.
ingredients: 1 package TJ's Chunky Artichoke & Jalapeño Dip
1 cup TJ's Shredded Mozzarella Cheese, divided
2 teaspoons finely chopped TJ's Cilantro, plus more for garnish
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste
title: Jalapeño Corn Kickers
Lasagna Carbonara
directions:
Heat the oven to 350°F and arrange a rack in the middle. Combine chopped bacon and 1 cup mozzarella cheese in a medium bowl, set aside.
In a large bowl, place the half can of pureed cannellini beans, 1 cup ricotta, 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese, 4 minced garlic cloves, 1/2 teaspoon basil and 1/4 teaspoon of chili flakes. Mix until combined, creating a cheese spread. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
In a blender or food processor, combine 1 cup defrosted peas, 1/2 cup parmesan, and 1/2 cup broth. Blend until smooth. Season pea sauce with salt and pepper, to taste.
Spread 1/2 cup of pea sauce in an even layer over the bottom of an 8-by-8-inch baking dish. Place two sheets of lasagna over the top of the sauce in the middle of the dish. There will be room around the edges of the noodles. Add one third of the ricotta cheese spread over the noodles. Use the back of a spoon to spread the cheese to the edges of the noodles. Next, sprinkle one third of the bacon mixture on top. Add another layer of noodles and repeat process two more times. Cover the top layer of noodles with remaining pea sauce. Sprinkle 1 cup of mozzarella over the top. For extra moisture, add 1/4 cup broth around the edges of the noodle stack.
Coat 1 side of a large piece of aluminum foil with canola oil spray and cover the dish tightly with the foil, oil-side down. Bake until the sauce is starting to bubble around the edges, about 40 minutes. Remove the foil and continue baking until the top of the cheese begins to brown, about 20 minutes more. Remove the pan and let cool for at least 15 minutes before slicing.Heat the oven to 350°F and arrange a rack in the middle. Mix until combined, creating a cheese spread. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.In a blender or food processor, combine 1 cup defrosted peas, 1/2 cup parmesan, and 1/2 cup broth. Cover the top layer of noodles with remaining pea sauce. Sprinkle 1 cup of mozzarella over the top. ingredients: 1 package TJ's Uncured Apple Smoked Bacon, cooked crispy, drained and chopped into small pieces
2 cups TJ's Shredded Mozzarella Cheese, divided
1/2 can TJ's Cannellini White Kidney Beans, rinsed, drained and pureed until smooth
1/2 tub (1 cup) TJ's Whole Milk Ricotta
4 medium cloves TJ's Premium Peeled Garlic, minced
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Red Chili Pepper Flakes, or more to taste
TJ's Sea Salt & Ground Black Pepper, to taste
1 cup TJ's Organic Frozen Peas, defrosted and drained
3/4 cup TJ's Organic Low Sodium Chicken Broth, divided
1 box TJ's No Boil Italian Lasagna Noodles

directions:
In a large non-reactive baking dish, whisk olive oil, lemon juice, vinegar, oregano, salt and lemon pepper seasoning. Add chicken pieces and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate 4 hours or overnight.
Preheat one side of the grill to high. Dip a crumpled paper towel in a tiny bit of olive oil, and use tongs to oil the grill grate with the paper towel.
Place chicken on cool side of the grill and cook for 5 minutes. Turn chicken over and cook another 20 minutes.
Place lemon halves on hot side of grill. Move chicken to the hot side of the grill, skin side-down, and cook until skin is crisp and chicken is cooked to 165°F. Remove from heat and serve with grilled lemon halves.In a large non-reactive baking dish, whisk olive oil, lemon juice, vinegar, oregano, salt and lemon pepper seasoning. Add chicken pieces and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate 4 hours or overnight.Preheat one side of the grill to high. Dip a crumpled paper towel in a tiny bit of olive oil, and use tongs to oil the grill grate with the paper towel.Place chicken on cool side of the grill and cook for 5 minutes. Turn chicken over and cook another 20 minutes.Place lemon halves on hot side of grill. Move chicken to the hot side of the grill, skin side-down, and cook until skin is crisp and chicken is cooked to 165°F. Remove from heat and serve with grilled lemon halves.
ingredients: 1/4 cup of your favorite TJ's Olive Oil, plus more for oiling grill grate
Juice of 2 TJ's Lemons, plus 1 more Lemon (halved) for grilling
1 package TJ's All Natural Bone-In Skin-On Chicken Thighs
title: Lemony Grilled Chicken Thighs

ingredients: 2 cups (1 jar) TJ's Creamy Salted Peanut Butter, stirred
2 cup TJ's Organic Cane Sugar, plus more for rolling cookies
2 teaspoons TJ's Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract
16 TJ's Dark Chocolate Peanut Butter Cups, wrappers removed
title: Preposterously Peanut Butter Cup Cookies
directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper, set aside. Pour a bit of sugar on a shallow plate for rolling cookies, set aside.
In a large bowl, mix peanut butter, sugar, eggs, baking soda, and vanilla until combined. Take a large scoop of cookie dough, place peanut butter cup in the center and pat dough closed around the cup to form a dough ball. Roll dough ball in sugar and place on prepared baking sheet. Repeat with remaining ingredients until you have 8 dough balls per baking sheet.
Bake sheets, one at a time, on center rack of oven for about 13 minutes, until golden brown. Remove from oven and let cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring cookies to cooling racks. Cookies are best enjoyed warm!Preheat oven to 350°F. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper, set aside. Pour a bit of sugar on a shallow plate for rolling cookies, set aside.In a large bowl, mix peanut butter, sugar, eggs, baking soda, and vanilla until combined. Take a large scoop of cookie dough, place peanut butter cup in the center and pat dough closed around the cup to form a dough ball. Roll dough ball in sugar and place on prepared baking sheet. Repeat with remaining ingredients until you have 8 dough balls per baking sheet.Bake sheets, one at a time, on center rack of oven for about 13 minutes, until golden brown. Remove from oven and let cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring cookies to cooling racks. Cookies are best enjoyed warm!

ingredients: 1 package TJ's Sliced Aged Swiss Cheese
TJ's Gluten Free Whole Grain or Multigrain Bread (toasted or untoasted, your call!)
6-8 TJ's Large Eggs (1 egg per sandwich)
title: Basic Breakfast Sandwich
directions:
Preheat oven to 375°F. Place a wire rack on top of a large rimmed baking sheet. Arrange bacon slices evenly on rack. Bake on center rack of oven for 15-20 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool 5 minutes.
Pre-assemble sandwiches: layer a handful of arugula, 2-3 slices bacon, 1 slice cheese, and tomato atop one slice of bread. Repeat for each sandwich.
Fry the eggs: melt 1 tablespoon butter in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Crack 3-4 eggs into skillet and sprinkle with salt & pepper. Cook 1 minute, until whites are slightly opaque. Reduce heat to low, cover skillet with lid and cook 4-6 minutes more, to desired level of yolk doneness.
Using a spatula, carefully lift eggs out of skillet and slide onto prepared sandwich halves. Top with second slice of bread. Cook remaining eggs following steps above and assemble remaining sandwiches. Serve immediately.Preheat oven to 375°F. Place a wire rack on top of a large rimmed baking sheet. Arrange bacon slices evenly on rack. Bake on center rack of oven for 15-20 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool 5 minutes.Pre-assemble sandwiches: layer a handful of arugula, 2-3 slices bacon, 1 slice cheese, and tomato atop one slice of bread. Repeat for each sandwich.Fry the eggs: melt 1 tablespoon butter in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Crack 3-4 eggs into skillet and sprinkle with salt & pepper. ingredients: 4 Fresh Sage leaves, chopped (plus more for garnish)
directions:
Cook biscuits according to package directions. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, add ghee and melt to coat pan. Add ground turkey to pan, breaking it into pieces with a spoon as it cooks, about 8-10 minutes. When the turkey reaches 165ºF and is no longer pink, reduce heat to medium. Sprinkle half of the flour over the turkey and stir to combine. Add remaining flour and stir to combine. Add one cup of milk to the pan and stir. Continue to add milk as the gravy thickens, one cup at a time.
Add syrup and chopped sage to gravy and stir to combine. Cook gravy 5 minutes more, stirring occasionally. Season with salt and pepper to taste. To serve, place biscuits in a shallow bowl and top with gravy and chopped sage. Serve immediately.Cook biscuits according to package directions. title: Biscuits & Maple Turkey Gravy

directions: Toast bagels per your preference. Slather each half with cream cheese. Top with salmon, red onion, capers, and dill. Serve immediately.Toast bagels per your preference. Slather each half with cream cheese. Top with salmon, red onion, capers, and dill. Serve immediately.
ingredients: 3 TJ's Everything Bagels, sliced in half
1 package TJ's Wild Alaska Sockeye Smoked Salmon
1/4 TJ's Red Onion, very thinly sliced
A few sprigs TJ's Fresh Dill, for garnish
title: Smoked Salmon & Cream Cheese Bagel

ingredients: 1 package TJ's Vanilla Cake & Baking Mix
3 TJ's Envy Apples, peeled and sliced (if unavailable, Granny Smith or Cripps Pink apples will work just fine)
Whipped Cream or TJ's Vanilla Ice Cream (optional), for serving
title: Vanilla Chai Cake with Spiced Apples
directions:
Preheat oven to 375°F. Grease an 8-inch pan with 1 tablespoon Ghee and set aside. In a small saucepan, add milk and Spiced Chai Tea Bags and cook over medium heat. Simmer for 10 minutes, stirring frequently, being careful not to scorch the milk. Remove from heat and let cool completely; discard tea bags.
In a large mixing bowl, combine cooled Chai milk, eggs and melted butter. Add Vanilla Cake Mix and stir to combine. Spread cake batter into greased pan. Bake for 40 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from oven and set aside.
While cake is baking, add remaining ghee to a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add sliced Envy apples and cinnamon to skillet, stirring to coat. Let cook for 5 minutes without disturbing apples. Stir, cover pan and cook for another 15 minutes, until apples are soft.
Slice cake and top each piece with a scoop of warm spiced apples. Serve with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream, if desired.Preheat oven to 375°F. Grease an 8-inch pan with 1 tablespoon Ghee and set aside. In a small saucepan, add milk and Spiced Chai Tea Bags and cook over medium heat. Let cook for 5 minutes without disturbing apples. Stir, cover pan and cook for another 15 minutes, until apples are soft.Slice cake and top each piece with a scoop of warm spiced apples. Serve with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream, if desired.

ingredients: 1 TJ's Acorn Squash, peeled, de-seeded and cubed
2 teaspoons TJ's Extra Virgin Olive Oil
1 jar TJ's Chipotle Black Bean Dip
TJ's Lime wedges & Fresh Cilantro, chopped for garnish
directions:
Preheat oven to 400ºF. Place squash in a large bowl. Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil and taco seasoning and toss to coat. Spread seasoned squash on a large baking sheet and roast for 20-25 min until fork-tender, tossing squash halfway through cooking.
While squash is roasting, remove lid from Chipotle Black Bean Dip and microwave on half-power for one-minute intervals, stirring in between, until warm. Warm tortillas over low heat.
To assemble tacos: spread warm bean dip on tortillas and layer with cabbage, squash and salsa. Garnish with cilantro and limes wedges. Serve immediately.Preheat oven to 400ºF. Place squash in a large bowl. Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil and taco seasoning and toss to coat. Warm tortillas over low heat.To assemble tacos: spread warm bean dip on tortillas and layer with cabbage, squash and salsa. Garnish with cilantro and limes wedges. Serve immediately.
title: Acorn Squash Tacos

ingredients: 1/2 cup (1 stick) TJ's Unsalted Butter, melted
1 box TJ's Vanilla Cake & Baking Mix
2 teaspoons TJ's Rum of the Gods
Handful TJ's Roasted & Salted Pecan Halves (optional), for garnish
directions:
Prepare the cake: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8-inch pan with canola oil spray and set aside.
In a large mixing bowl, combine egg nog, eggs, and melted butter. Add cake mix and nutmeg, and stir until batter is smooth. Spread cake batter into greased pan. Bake on center rack of oven for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from oven and allow to cool 10 minutes. Invert cake onto a cooling rack and remove pan; allow to cool completely before frosting (you can hasten the cooling process by placing the cake in the freezer for 10-15 minutes).
Prepare the frosting: In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment (or using a hand mixer in a large bowl), beat powdered sugar, butter, rum, and 2 tablespoons of egg nog on low speed until combined (add more egg nog if necessary to achieve desired texture). Add sea salt and beat on medium speed until smooth.
Assemble cake: Transfer cooled cake to a serving platter. Frost generously and top with pecans, if desired. Slice and enjoy!Prepare the cake: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8-inch pan with canola oil spray and set aside.In a large mixing bowl, combine egg nog, eggs, and melted butter. Add cake mix and nutmeg, and stir until batter is smooth. Spread cake batter into greased pan. Bake on center rack of oven for 35-40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from oven and allow to cool 10 minutes. Invert cake onto a cooling rack and remove pan; allow to cool completely before frosting (you can hasten the cooling process by placing the cake in the freezer for 10-15 minutes).Prepare the frosting: In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment (or using a hand mixer in a large bowl), beat powdered sugar, butter, rum, and 2 tablespoons of egg nog on low speed until combined (add more egg nog if necessary to achieve desired texture). Add sea salt and beat on medium speed until smooth.Assemble cake: Transfer cooled cake to a serving platter. Frost generously and top with pecans, if desired. Slice and enjoy!
title: Egg Nog Cake with Rum Buttercream Frosting
Greek Style Potato Salad
directions: Transfer potato salad to a large serving bowl. Gently fold in cucumbers, bell pepper, cheese, and olives. Garnish with parsley and serve.Transfer potato salad to a large serving bowl. Gently fold in cucumbers, bell pepper, cheese, and olives. Garnish with parsley and serve.

1 TJ's Red Bell Pepper, cored, de-seeded and diced

title: Crispy Tofu Sesame Salad
directions:
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high until sizzling. Carefully add tofu to pan (use tongs or a slotted spoon to avoid oil spatter) and stir fry for 7-10 minutes, until golden brown. Transfer tofu to a paper-towel lined plate and season with salt & pepper, set aside.
In a serving bowl, toss salad with included dressing and toppings. Add tofu and mandarins and gently toss to combine. Enjoy immediately.Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high until sizzling. Carefully add tofu to pan (use tongs or a slotted spoon to avoid oil spatter) and stir fry for 7-10 minutes, until golden brown. Transfer tofu to a paper-towel lined plate and season with salt & pepper, set aside.In a serving bowl, toss salad with included dressing and toppings. Add tofu and mandarins and gently toss to combine. Enjoy immediately.

Position oven racks in upper and lower thirds of oven. Preheat oven to 400°F. Arrange chicken tenderloin breasts on a large baking sheet. Place baking sheet on upper rack of oven and bake 10 minutes.
Arrange bagel halves, cut side down, in a single layer on a large baking sheet. Move the baking sheet of chicken to lower rack of oven. Place baking sheet of bagels on top rack. Bake another 15-20 minutes, until bagels are toasted and internal temperature of chicken reaches 165°F. Remove chicken and bagels from oven.
While chicken and bagels bake, add 2 tablespoons each of mayonnaise and sriracha to a small bowl. Mix and set aside.
Add remaining mayonnaise and sriracha to a medium bowl. Add cabbage & carrots to bowl and toss to combine. Set aside.
To assemble sandwiches, slather prepared sriracha mayo mixture on both bagel halves. Place a generous handful of slaw on bottom half of bagel, followed by two chicken tenderloin breasts and a few pickle chips. Top with other bagel half. Repeat with remaining ingredients. Serve immediately.Position oven racks in upper and lower thirds of oven. Preheat oven to 400°F. Arrange chicken tenderloin breasts on a large baking sheet. ingredients: 1 cup TJ's Mexican Blend Shredded Cheese, divided
title: Carne Asada Salad
directions: Grill Carne Asada Autentica on high heat, about 3 minutes each side. Remove from grill and allow to rest for about 5 minutes, then slice across the grain. On each plate, arrange lettuce, sprinkle 1/4 cup cheese, drizzle 1 tablespoon of Cilantro Dressing, place carne asada slices and top with avocado. Dollop 1 tablespoon of sour cream over the top and serve with a side of salsa. Garnish with cilantro and serve.

ingredients: 1 package TJ's Organic Cole Slaw Kit (seasonal)
2 trays TJ's Pulled Pork in Smoky BBQ Sauce
directions:
Place cole slaw in a medium bowl. Toss with dressing packet, set aside.
Microwave pulled pork according to package directions. Use a fork to split rolls. Pile pulled pork and cole slaw on bottom half of roll and top with the other half. Enjoy!Place cole slaw in a medium bowl. Toss with dressing packet, set aside.Microwave pulled pork according to package directions. Use a fork to split rolls.
