ingredients: 1 large TJ's Butternut Squash (seasonally available), peeled, sliced lengthwise and cleaned of seeds and string
2 cups TJ's Chopped Frozen Spinach, defrosted and squeezed of some water
12 sheets TJ's No Boil Lasagna Noodles
1/2 cup TJ's Grated Parmigiano Reggiano Cheese
directions:
Preheat oven to 375°F. Slice squash halves into 1/2" half-moon-shaped pieces. Spray a large baking sheet with a light dusting of oil and sprinkle with a little sea salt and pepper. Place the slices on the sheet in a single layer. Lightly spray the tops and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake until the slices are tender, about 35 minutes. Remove from oven and set aside to cool; lower oven temperature to 350°F.
Empty Alfredo sauce into a sauce pan; warm over very low heat, just enough to liquefy, and remove from heat. Place ricotta, spinach, nutmeg and a pinch of salt into a bowl and combine. Set aside.
Assemble lasagna: Coat the bottom of a 9" x 13" baking dish with a light layer of Alfredo sauce. Place four sheets of noodles side by side and top them with more Alfredo sauce. Next, add squash in a single layer. Top squash with more Alfredo sauce and another layer of noodles. Top noodles with all of the ricotta-spinach mixture and smooth out. Top with another layer of noodles, then Alfredo sauce and the last of the squash. Pour over the remainder of Alfredo sauce and top with Mozzarella & Parmesan cheeses.
Cover lasagna with foil and bake for 40 minutes. Remove foil and bake another 5-10 minutes or until cheese is golden and bubbly. Remove from oven and rest 15 minutes before slicing.Preheat oven to 375°F. Slice squash halves into 1/2" half-moon-shaped pieces. Spray a large baking sheet with a light dusting of oil and sprinkle with a little sea salt and pepper. Place the slices on the sheet in a single layer. Remove foil and bake another 5-10 minutes or until cheese is golden and bubbly. Remove from oven and rest 15 minutes before slicing.

ingredients: 1 tub TJ's Organic Whipped Cream Cheese
1 tablespoon TJ's Organic Powdered Sugar (more or less to taste)
directions: Add cream cheese, vanilla, lemon juice and powdered sugar to blender or food processor and mix well. Spread cheese mix on almond cookie and top with another to make sandwich. Repeat assembly with remaining ingredients. Enjoy sandwiches with a cup of coffee or hot tea.Add cream cheese, vanilla, lemon juice and powdered sugar to blender or food processor and mix well. Spread cheese mix on almond cookie and top with another to make sandwich. Repeat assembly with remaining ingredients. Enjoy sandwiches with a cup of coffee or hot tea.

directions:
In a small bowl, mix coconut beverage, chia seeds, vanilla, and syrup until combined. Let mixture sit 10 minutes, stirring every 2-3 minutes to break up any clumps. Cover bowl and refrigerate for a minimum of two hours, or overnight.
Remove pudding from fridge, divide between two small bowls or jars, and garnish as desired.In a small bowl, mix coconut beverage, chia seeds, vanilla, and syrup until combined. Let mixture sit 10 minutes, stirring every 2-3 minutes to break up any clumps. Cover bowl and refrigerate for a minimum of two hours, or overnight.Remove pudding from fridge, divide between two small bowls or jars, and garnish as desired.

1 teaspoon TJ's Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract or TJ's Alcohol-Free Vanilla Flavor
Your favorite toppings (we like whipped cream, TJ's Unsweetened Coconut Chips, chopped cling peaches, fresh mint, & a sprinkle of cinnamon)
title: Golden Milk Coconut Chia Pudding

directions: To marinate fish, remove frozen Ahi from packaging and place into a medium baking dish. Pour half the bottle of Spicy Peanut Vinaigrette over steaks, cover dish with plastic wrap and leave in refrigerator 8 hours or overnight, flipping steaks half way through. Alternatively, defrosted steaks can marinate in vinaigrette for 1 hour in the refrigerator prior to preparation. To sear the Ahi, bring a medium frying pan up to medium high to high heat, and coat the bottom of the pan lightly with canola oil spray. Remove and discard excess marinade from fish. Sear the fish for 1-2 minutes on each side until desired doneness. Remove from pan onto a cutting board and slice against the grain into 1/2 inch-thick slices. Arrange tuna slices atop lettuce leaves, then sprinkle with snap peas, pineapple, oranges, avocado, chives and peanuts. Drizzle fresh dressing over each taco and enjoy!
ingredients: 1 package TJ's Frozen Ahi Tuna Steaks (about 1 pound)
1 package TJ's Smallish Gems Sweet Lettuce (seasonal) OR TJ's Romaine Hearts, leaves separated, rinsed, patted dry and chilled in the refrigerator
1/2 cup sliced TJ's Sugar Snap Peas
1/2 cup diced TJ's Sliced Fresh Del Monte Gold Pineapple Spears
1 TJ's Valencia Orange, peeled and diced
1/4 cup TJ's Old Fashioned Salted Blister Peanuts OR TJ's Organic Roasted & Salted Valencia Peanuts
title: Seared Spicy Peanut Ahi Tuna Tacos

directions:
Bring a medium pot of salted water to a boil. Add pasta to boiling water. Cook uncovered, stirring occasionally for about 7-10 minutes. Remove pasta and drain thoroughly. Place back in empty pot.
Cook broccoli according to package instructions. Chop broccoli and chicken into bite-sized pieces; chop or smash pecans into smaller pieces.
Add pesto, mascarpone, broccoli, chicken, pecans, and salt to pasta and mix until thoroughly combined. If needed, place pot back on burner and mix over low heat instead. (Heat will soften the mascarpone, making it easier to work with.)
Serve and enjoy!Bring a medium pot of salted water to a boil. Add pasta to boiling water. Cook uncovered, stirring occasionally for about 7-10 minutes. Remove pasta and drain thoroughly. title: Creamy Pesto Chicken & Broccoli Bow Tie Pasta
ingredients: 1 cup TJ's Roasted & Salted Pecan Halves
½ package TJ's Organic Broccoli Florets (fresh not frozen)

title: Loaded Totchos
ingredients: 1 block TJ's Jalapeño Jack Cheese, shredded and divided
1 can TJ's Organic Black Beans, drained
1/2 batch of TJ's Jackfruit Carnitas (or 2 cups of your favorite cooked protein)
TJ's Hot & Sweet Jalapeños, Sour Cream & Cilantro (for garnish)
directions:
Spread tots on a large, rimmed baking pan and cook according to package directions. Remove pan from oven and set on heat-safe work surface.
Using tongs or a spatula, pile half of the tots in the center of the pan. Sprinkle with half of the cheese, then pile remaining tots on top. Scatter black beans, jackfruit carnitas, remaining cheese and jalapeños atop the tots. 
Return pan to oven and cook 5-10 minutes more to melt the cheese. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Garnish with cilantro and sour cream, and enjoy!Spread tots on a large, rimmed baking pan and cook according to package directions. Remove pan from oven and set on heat-safe work surface.Using tongs or a spatula, pile half of the tots in the center of the pan. Sprinkle with half of the cheese, then pile remaining tots on top. Scatter black beans, jackfruit carnitas, remaining cheese and jalapeños atop the tots.Return pan to oven and cook 5-10 minutes more to melt the cheese. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Garnish with cilantro and sour cream, and enjoy!

Plan ahead! This cookie dough requires at least three hours in the refrigerator prior to baking.
Place butter in a glass measuring cup; heat in the microwave on half-power for 30-second intervals until melted. Set aside to cool. Add 2 cups sugar, eggs and molasses to a stand mixer (a hand mixer will work, too) fitted with a paddle; beat at medium speed. Add melted butter and beat just until incorporated; set aside.
In a separate bowl, sift together remaining dry ingredients. Add one cup of dry ingredients to wet ingredients and beat at medium speed just until combined. Scrape the sides of the bowl and repeat the addition of dry ingredients, one cup at a time, until fully combined with wet ingredients. Cover dough with cling wrap and refrigerate at least three hours or overnight.
Preheat oven to 375°F and line a cookie sheet with parchment paper. Spread remaining ½ cup sugar on a large dinner plate. Form refrigerated dough into golf ball-sized balls and roll in sugar. Place on cookie sheet 2 inches apart and bake for 10-12 minutes. Remove sheet from oven; let cookies cool for five minutes prior to removing them from the baking sheet. Makes 48 cookies.Plan ahead! Blueberry Corn Cake
directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8-inch square baking pan, set aside.
In a large bowl, whisk sour cream, oil, milk and egg until smooth. Add cornbread mix and stir gently to combine; do not overmix.
Add 1/2 cup frozen blueberries to prepared baking pan. Scrape cornbread batter atop blueberries, spreading batter evenly to sides of pan. Cover surface of batter with remaining blueberries.
Place baking pan on center rack of oven and bake 40-45 minutes, until cake is golden and edges pull away from sides of pan. Remove from oven and let cool 15 minutes before slicing.Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8-inch square baking pan, set aside.In a large bowl, whisk sour cream, oil, milk and egg until smooth. Remove from oven and let cool 15 minutes before slicing.

directions:
In a large microwave safe dish, microwave meatballs according to package directions. Pour BBQ sauce over meatballs just to cover, and stir to combine. Continue to microwave on half power at 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until sauce is warmed through.
Open hot dog buns and arrange on a large baking sheet. Fill each bun with 4 meatballs and top with warmed sauce and a slice of provolone.
Heat broiler to high. Broil subs 3-5 minutes, until cheese is melted and brown, and buns are golden (depending on your broiler, you may have to cover empty side of bun with foil to prevent burning). Remove subs from oven and let cool slightly. Top with diced red onion and enjoy.In a large microwave safe dish, microwave meatballs according to package directions. Pour BBQ sauce over meatballs just to cover, and stir to combine. Broil subs 3-5 minutes, until cheese is melted and brown, and buns are golden (depending on your broiler, you may have to cover empty side of bun with foil to prevent burning). ingredients: 1 bottle TJ's Organic Kansas City Style BBQ Sauce
1 package TJ's Gourmet White Hot Dog Buns

directions:
Remove shrimp from bag and place in a colander. Run shrimp under cold water for 5 to 7 minutes to defrost, set aside to drain.
Cut baguette into 3-inch pieces lengthwise (about 6 pieces), slice each piece into halves crosswise.
Grease skillet on stove and bring to medium heat. Spread 1 teaspoon of mayonnaise on each slice of baguette and toast face-down in skillet until golden brown (about 2 minutes each). (Alternatively, place baguettes, cut side up, on a baking sheet and broil until browned and crispy (about 3-5 minutes).)
In a medium sized bowl, mix together defrosted shrimp, tomatoes, parsley, and chili pepper sauce.
To assemble, spoon ¼ cup of shrimp mixture over each slice of toasted bread. Enjoy immediately.Remove shrimp from bag and place in a colander. title: Spinach & Artichoke Sweet Potato Gratin
directions:
Preheat oven to 400F. Stir milk into microwaved spinach dip, set aside. Grease a 9-inch by 13-inch baking dish with canola oil spray. Arrange half of the potato slices in an even layer in baking dish, slightly overlapping as you go. Spread half of the spinach dip over potatoes and sprinkle with half of the cheese. Repeat potato and dip layers (the rest of the cheese will be added later) and cover baking dish with foil.
Bake on center rack of oven for 40 minutes. Remove dish from oven and discard foil. Sprinkle remaining cheese on top, return to oven and bake 25-30 minutes, until golden and bubbling. Remove from oven and let cool 15-20 minutes before serving.Preheat oven to 400F. Stir milk into microwaved spinach dip, set aside. Grease a 9-inch by 13-inch baking dish with canola oil spray. Arrange half of the potato slices in an even layer in baking dish, slightly overlapping as you go. Spread half of the spinach dip over potatoes and sprinkle with half of the cheese. Repeat potato and dip layers (the rest of the cheese will be added later) and cover baking dish with foil.Bake on center rack of oven for 40 minutes. Remove dish from oven and discard foil. Sprinkle remaining cheese on top, return to oven and bake 25-30 minutes, until golden and bubbling. Remove from oven and let cool 15-20 minutes before serving.
ingredients: 1 bag (3 lbs.) TJ's Organic Sweet Potatoes, peeled and sliced into thin planks

ingredients: TJ's Sauerkraut with Pickled Persian Cucumbers
TJ's Deli Style Spicy Brown Mustard
directions:
Heat a skillet over medium. Add bratwurst and pan-fry 8-10 minutes, until lightly browned and bratwurst reach an internal temperature of 165°F. Remove from heat.
To serve, place each sausage in a hot dog bun, top with sauerkraut and drizzle with mustard. Serve with cold bottles of Josephsbrau Oktoberfest Lager on the side.Heat a skillet over medium. title: Chewy Chocolate Mochi Cake

1 ½ cups TJ's Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips
directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8-inch square baking pan with canola oil spray, set aside.
In a large bowl, whisk cake mix and water until smooth. Add butter, eggs, and cocoa powder, whisk until smooth. Stir in chocolate chips.
Pour batter into greased pan. Bake on center rack of oven for 45-50 minutes, or until the cake begins to pull away from the sides of the pan. Remove from oven and place on cooling rack for 15-20 minutes prior to slicing.Preheat oven to 350°F. ingredients: TJ's Canola Oil or Coconut Oil Spray, to grease pan
1 box TJ's Brownie Truffle Baking Mix
1 stick (4 oz) TJ's Salted Butter, melted
1/4 cup TJ's Fleur de Sel Caramel Sauce, warmed in the microwave
directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8-inch square baking pan with canola oil spray; set aside.
In a large bowl, whisk eggs. Add brownie mix and melted butter, stir to combine (do not overmix). Pour batter into prepared pan, spreading evenly to pan edges with a spatula. Drizzle warmed caramel and tahini atop batter. Gently drag a sharp knife along the surface of the batter to swirl the tahini and caramel.
Place pan on center rack of oven and bake 25-30 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool 45 minutes before slicing.Preheat oven to 350°F. directions: Slather the underside of a benne wafer with a generous amount of cocoa almond spread. Top with another cookie and enjoy! Repeat until satisfied.Slather the underside of a benne wafer with a generous amount of cocoa almond spread. Top with another cookie and enjoy! Repeat until satisfied.

directions:
Add a small amount of oil to a large saucepan, sauté diced green pepper over medium heat, stirring occasionally until softened about 5 minutes.
Remove each Bolognese tray from its carton and microwave separately. Cut open end of film to vent. Microwave on defrost for 3 minutes. Take out of the microwave and partially remove from film and stir gently. Put back in the microwave and continue to microwave on high setting for 2 – 3 minutes or until sauce is fully cooked to a temperature of 165°F.
Mix Bolognese, ketchup and bell pepper together with a spatula in the large saucepan.
Cut aloha rolls in half, spoon mixture onto rolls to make a sandwich and enjoy.Add a small amount of oil to a large saucepan, sauté diced green pepper over medium heat, stirring occasionally until softened about 5 minutes.Remove each Bolognese tray from its carton and microwave separately. directions:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Slice bread into 1-inch cubes and toss with 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Place bread cubes on a rimmed baking sheet and bake until lightly toasted, about 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, fry bacon over medium heat for 10-15 minutes, turning frequently until cooked through. Place cooked bacon on a paper towel lined plate to drain. Once cool, chop or crumble bacon into bite-sized pieces.
In a large bowl, combine spring salad mix, bacon pieces, grape tomatoes and sourdough croutons. Toss with desired amount of Blue Cheese Dressing. Enjoy!Preheat oven to 400 degrees. ingredients: 1/2 loaf (about 12 ounces) TJ's Sliced Sourdough Bread
2 Tablespoons TJ's Extra Virgin Olive Oil
1 package (12 oz) TJ's Uncured Apple Smoked Bacon
2 cups TJ's Mini Pearl Grape Tomatoes, halved
2-4 Tablespoons TJ's Blue Cheese Dressing and Dip
title: BLT Salad & Croutons

ingredients: 1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste, for seasoning

title: Sassy Slaw Fish Tacos
directions: In a medium bowl, combine broccoli slaw with cilantro dressing and allow flavors to meld (20 minutes to overnight). Liberally season 1 cup of white flour with salt and pepper and dredge the cod in it, shaking off excess flour. In a large skillet, heat 2-3 tablespoons oil and fry fish until golden and flaky. Remove fish from pan and put aside. Wipe skillet clean with a paper towel. Heat the pan again with about 1 tablespoon of oil and heat 2 tortillas at a time, 20 seconds on each side. While tortillas are still warm, spread 1-2 tablespoons of guacamole and place 2-3 pieces of fish along one half. Using tongs, cover fish with broccoli slaw (shaking off excess liquid) and fold tortilla over. Optional Topping Suggestions: a squeeze of fresh lime, chopped fresh cilantro, a few dashes of your favorite hot sauce...In a medium bowl, combine broccoli slaw with cilantro dressing and allow flavors to meld (20 minutes to overnight). ingredients: 1 cup TJ's Spiced Chai Black Tea Concentrate (do not dilute!)
1¾ cup TJ's Buttermilk Pancake & All-Purpose Baking Mix
directions:
In a medium bowl, whisk egg and spiced chai concentrate until combined. Whisk in pancake mix until smooth. Let batter stand 5 minutes.
Preheat a skillet over medium. Working in batches, use a quarter-cup measuring cup to drop batter into skillet. Cook for 1-2 minutes, flipping pancakes when edges are no longer glossy and bubbles form in the center. Cook another minute or so and transfer pancakes to a serving platter. Serve pancakes with toasted pecan pieces and plenty of syrup for drizzling.In a medium bowl, whisk egg and spiced chai concentrate until combined. Whisk in pancake mix until smooth. Serve pancakes with toasted pecan pieces and plenty of syrup for drizzling.

Cook cheese according to package instructions, remove from pan and cut each slice in half. Slice the watermelon spears into thirds. Assemble 6-8 wooden skewers as follows… Cheese, watermelon, fig, basil. Repeat. Drizzle balsamic glaze over each stick and enjoy!

To warm taco shells, place shells on a sheet pan and warm in preheated oven for 2-3 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool slightly before handling.
Assemble tacos: Spoon beef-less beef into warm taco shell. Top with slaw and drizzle with included dressing packet. Serve immediately.Preheat oven to 425°F. Preheat oven to 400°F. Arrange potato pancakes on a non-stick baking sheet and cook for 8 minutes. Flip pancakes and cook for 7 minutes. Add shredded cheese and cook for an additional minute. title: Ridge Crispy S'moreover Bars
ingredients: 1 bag TJ's Ridge Cut Potato Chips with Sea Salt, crushed

directions: Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir in marshmallows and melt completely. In a large mixing bowl, pour the crushed chips, followed by the melted marshmallow and mix together thoroughly (take care to use utensils while mixing – the melted marshmallows are HOT!). Fold in the chocolate drops, and then press the mixture into a 9" x 13" baking pan (you can use 9" x 9" if you like your bars super dense). Let cool (place in freezer for 5 minutes to expedite); cut and serve.Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir in marshmallows and melt completely. Preheat oven to 350°F. Combine cranberries with one cup of turkey broth and set aside. Add butter to skillet and melt. Add veggies and sauté until soft; about 10 to 15 minutes. Place bread cubes from stuffing mix in medium-large bowl. Add cooked veggies to bowl; add broth with cranberries; add chopped chestnuts and mix well. Add additional broth, one cup at a time, and continue to mix until all bread is moist. Season with pepper. Add contents of seasoning packet, to taste, and mix until well combined. Place in a 9" x 13" (approx. 4 qt.) casserole dish and bake for 35 to 45 minutes.
title: Classic Cranberry Chestnut Stuffing
ingredients: 2 packages TJ's Peeled & Cooked Chestnuts, coarsely chopped
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste
2 pouches TJ's  Fully Cooked Organic Thai Jasmine Rice, cooked according to package directions and cooled
1 jar TJ's Corn and Chile Tomato-Less Salsa
1/2  package TJ's Mélange a Trois Peppers
3/4 cup TJ's Green Olives Stuffed with Garlic, coarsely chopped
1/3 cup TJ's Extra Virgin Olive Oil
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste
1 pound TJ's Large Fully Cooked Shrimp, defrosted
directions: In a medium bowl, combine rice, corn salsa, green onions, peppers, olives and cilantro. Set aside. Blend oil, lime juice & zest, cumin, salt & pepper in blender or food processor until smooth. Toss mixture over shrimp, then cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate rice and shrimp separately in fridge for 30 minutes to marinate flavors and to allow shrimp to "cook" in lime juice. When ready to serve, mix the rice and shrimp together; season with salt and pepper to taste. Let dish come to room temperature and serve.
title: Cornfetti Rice with Shrimp

directions:
Preheat oven to 450°F. Roll pizza dough onto a pizza stone or baking sheet. Evenly distribute 1 1/2 - 2 cups tomato sauce out to the edges of the pizza dough. Top with artichoke hearts. Pinch off small pieces of goat cheese and scatter them around the pizza. Top with olives. Sprinkle pizza liberally with olive oil, if desired.
Place pizza on center rack of oven. Bake 20 minutes, or until edges are nicely browned and cheese is bubbling. Let cool slightly before slicing and serving.Preheat oven to 450°F. directions:

directions:
Preheat oven to 450°F. Remove burgers from packaging and place on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake 5 minutes or until browned. Carefully flip and continue to bake an additional 5 minutes, or until heated through and well browned. Remove from oven and let cool slightly.
Place burger patty on bottom of hamburger bun. Top with a generous swipe of Avocado Tzatziki dip, followed by sliced red onion and cilantro. directions:
Combine 1 tablespoon vinegar, 5 grinds South African seasoning, 1 teaspoon oregano, 3 garlic cloves and 2 tablespoons of EVOO in a blender or food processor. Pulse until garlic minces to desired consistency. Add cilantro and parsley and pulse a few more times until desired consistency. Pour mixture into a small bowl and stir in reserved 3 tablespoons of EVOO. Taste and adjust seasoning as desired. Makes about ½ cup of sauce.
Serving ideas: drizzled over a steak, gorgonzola and arugula salad, spoon over grilled salmon or bruschetta.Combine 1 tablespoon vinegar, 5 grinds South African seasoning, 1 teaspoon oregano, 3 garlic cloves and 2 tablespoons of EVOO in a blender or food processor. directions:
In a deep frying pan or pot, empty the container of canola oil. Save the container for easy disposal. Heat the oil on medium-high heat until it reaches 340-360 degrees on a deep-fry thermometer or until a pinch of breadcrumbs drops down the middle of the oil and quickly bobs to the top, turning golden brown.
 Set up three dipping stations. In the first dish, whisk 5 eggs with 1/2 cup of milk. In a second dish, mix 2 cups of flour and ½ teaspoon each of salt and pepper. In a third dish, mix 2 cups of breadcrumbs with 1/2 teaspoon each of salt and pepper.
Dip each ravioli into the eggwash, first one side and then the other. Shake to remove excess. Next, dip the ravioli into the flour, coating all sides evenly then dip into the eggwash again. Finally, coat the ravioli in breadcrumbs. Set aside on a plate.
 Begin heating 1/2 jar of pasta sauce in a small saucepan on low heat.
 Using a slotted spoon, gently fry 3-4 breaded ravioli at a time. Depending on the temperature of your oil, fry for about 1-2 minutes per side until golden brown. Transfer ravioli to a paper towel-lined baking sheet to drain.
 To serve, place marinara in a bowl and arrange fried ravioli on a plate. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and parsley and enjoy right away.
 To dispose canola oil, wait until oil cools completely, drain back into the bottle over a trash can. Do not put oil down kitchen sink.In a deep frying pan or pot, empty the container of canola oil. Save the container for easy disposal. 1 tsp TJ's Ground Black Pepper, divided
1/2 jar TJ's Creamy Tomato Basil Pasta Sauce
1/4 cup freshly grated TJ's Parmesan Cheese

1 bag TJ's Sweet & Spicy Pecans, crushed
title: For The Love Of Pumpkin (Cheesecake)
directions: Spoon half of the fudge sauce into a microwave-safe dish. Heat on half-power for 30 second intervals until melted, stirring in between. Drizzle melted fudge sauce over cheesecake (and feel free to top with even more melted fudge, if that's your thing). Top with crushed pecans, and then slice, serve and enjoy!Spoon half of the fudge sauce into a microwave-safe dish. Heat on half-power for 30 second intervals until melted, stirring in between. Drizzle melted fudge sauce over cheesecake (and feel free to top with even more melted fudge, if that's your thing). Top with crushed pecans, and then slice, serve and enjoy!

Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8 x 8-inch baking pan with cooking oil spray; set aside.
Slice 1 stick of butter into 8 pieces; put back in fridge to chill, if necessary. Empty crust mix into the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, add chilled butter and beat on low speed until mixture becomes crumbly. Increase speed to medium and beat until dough comes together.
Turn dough out into greased baking pan and use your hands to press evenly into pan bottom and up sides. Bake on center rack of oven until edges begin to brown, about 18 to 20 minutes. Remove from oven and cool to room temperature, about 30 minutes.
Melt remaining 2 tablespoons butter. Empty contents of filling packet into a medium mixing bowl, whisk in egg, melted butter, and water; mix until combined. Pour filling evenly over crust and sprinkle with chocolate chips. Return pan to oven and bake until center of filling is set, 30 to 35 minutes. Cool to room temperature in the pan on a wire rack or stove top. Once cooled, cut into 16 bars and enjoy.Preheat oven to 350°F. Pour mixture over cereal and toss until pieces are completely coated. Spread mixture evenly onto baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes, stirring after 10 minutes. Cool completely before serving.Preheat oven to 300°F. In a large mixing bowl, mix cheddar rockets, oyster crackers, pretzel slims, and peanuts. Slice whole pineapple lengthwise into 2 halves.
With a sharp knife, carefully score the insides of both halves like a checker board. With a large spoon, scoop out the inside which will produce bite-sized pineapple pieces. Set pineapple pieces along with their juice aside in a separate bowl.
Add 2 tablespoons of coconut oil to a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add the chicken and cook for 5 minutes until heated through. Add cooked rice, soyaki and reserved pineapple pieces and juices to the pan and continue to stir to heat through until the rice becomes a little sticky, about 2 minutes. Add sauce packets that come with the BBQ Chicken Teriyaki. Continue to sauté until heated through.
Add fried rice to the pineapple halves and serve.

Green Curry Chickpeas
directions:
Preheat oven to 400°F. Toss the tomatoes lightly with olive oil, salt and pepper and spread them out into one layer on a sheet pan. Roast for 15 to 20 minutes, until the tomatoes are soft. While tomatoes are roasting, prepare quinoa according to package directions.
Warm the curry sauce in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add garbanzo beans and tomatoes and stir to combine. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes. Add spinach and simmer until wilted and tender, about 10 minutes. Serve curry atop a bed of cooked quinoa.Preheat oven to 400°F. Toss the tomatoes lightly with olive oil, salt and pepper and spread them out into one layer on a sheet pan. Roast for 15 to 20 minutes, until the tomatoes are soft. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes. Add spinach and simmer until wilted and tender, about 10 minutes. Serve curry atop a bed of cooked quinoa.

Preheat oven to 350º F. In a large frying pan, heat garlic oil and add kale; add water, cover and steam, stirring occasionally for about 10-15 minutes. Add the tomatoes to the pan and continue to cook for a few more minutes (add a little more oil, if desired); season with salt and pepper. While the kale is cooking, split each pie crust in half and roll into 4 rounds of dough. Scoop kale mixture into the center of each dough round and top with desired amount of sausage (or falafel) and cheese.  Fold dough up and pinch around; kale mixture will stick out of the top. Top with more cheese, if desired. Brush dough with milk. Place in oven and bake for about 30-40 minutes or until crust is golden brown.

4 tablespoons TJ's Garlic Infused Olive Oil

1/2-1 cup TJ's Uncured Bavarian Bratwurst (or Frozen Falafel), cut into small pieces

directions: Toast waffles according to directions on box. While waffles are toasting, combine blueberries, cream cheese, sugar and a splash of vanilla in a food processor or blender and mix until smooth. Spread the blended mixture between two waffles, sprinkle on a few whole blueberries, sandwich and enjoy.
ingredients: 1 package (8 waffles) TJ's Frozen Toaster Waffles
1 package TJ's Blueberries, fresh or frozen
title: Waffle Sandwich

ingredients: 4 cups shredded TJ's Zucchini (4-5 medium zucchinis)
1 ½ teaspoons TJ's Sea Salt, divided
1 medium TJ's Yellow Onion, sliced thinly
1/4 cup TJ's Balsamic Vinegar of Modena
2 cups frozen TJ's Roasted Corn, defrosted
2 Tablespoons chopped TJ's Cilantro, plus more for garnish
title: Mozzarella & Roasted Corn Egg Bake
directions:
To extract the moisture from the zucchini, spread the zucchini out on a tray and sprinkle with 1 teaspoon salt. Set aside.
While the zucchini sits, prepare the balsamic caramelized onions: In a medium skillet over medium heat, melt 1 tablespoon of butter. Add onion slices and stir to coat with butter. Sprinkle the onions with reserved ½ teaspoon salt. Stir until onions cook down and begin to turn golden, about 5 minutes. Add 2 teaspoons sugar and continue to stir until onions darken to a medium golden color and turn translucent, about 5 more minutes. Add ¼ cup balsamic vinegar, scrape up the bits from the bottom of the pan and turn heat to low. Heat, stirring occasionally, until most of the liquid absorbs, about 5-7 more minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.
Preheat oven to 375°F. In small batches, place the zucchini shreds in a clean cloth and squeeze the water out. Repeat as needed. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt reserved 2 tablespoons of butter. Add zucchini shreds and cook until slightly golden. Add corn and stir until heated through. Transfer zucchini and corn to a large bowl and let cool completely (if the mixture is too hot for these next steps, the ingredients clump together and will result in uneven cooking!).
Add caramelized onions, mozzarella, 2 tablespoons cilantro and 6 eggs to zucchini. Gently stir until uniform. Transfer mixture to a greased 9.5 inch glass pie dish. Cover loosely with greased foil, grease side down. Place on center rack of oven and bake 25-30 minutes, until there is no liquid when a knife is inserted into the center of the egg bake. Remove foil and broil until the cheese on top is brown and bubbly, about 3-5 minutes. Remove from oven and cool. Garnish with cilantro just before serving.
Serve warm with fruit for breakfast, or with a side salad for lunch or dinner.To extract the moisture from the zucchini, spread the zucchini out on a tray and sprinkle with 1 teaspoon salt. Set aside.While the zucchini sits, prepare the balsamic caramelized onions: In a medium skillet over medium heat, melt 1 tablespoon of butter. Add onion slices and stir to coat with butter. title: Spicy Sausage and Kale Soup
ingredients: 1 package TJ's Spicy Italian Chicken Sausage (or any spicy TJ's Chicken Sausage)
3 tablespoons TJ's Extra Virgin Olive Oil, divided
1 teaspoon TJ's Spice of the World, Garlic Powder
1/2 teaspoon TJ's Spices of the World, Oregano
2 containers TJ's Organic Low Sodium Chicken Broth
1 cup TJ's Organic Red Quinoa, rinsed and drained
1 bag TJ's Organic Tuscan Kale, stems removed
TJ's Grated Parmesan Cheese or Fresh Lemon, sliced for garnish
directions:
Slice sausage links into half-inch thick coins, then slice coins in half. Heat a skillet over medium heat and add 1 tablespoon olive oil. When oil is hot, add sausage to pan and cook undisturbed for 5 minutes. Flip sausage pieces and continue to cook until browned, 3-5 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.
Heat a large pot over medium heat, add remaining olive oil. When oil is hot, add mirepoix, garlic powder, oregano, salt and pepper. Sauté until onions are translucent and spices are fragrant, 3-5 minutes.
Add broth, water, and quinoa, and bring to a boil for 5 minutes. Add kale, cover pot and simmer for 10-15 minutes, until kale is tender and quinoa is cooked. Add sausage and cook another few minutes until warmed through. 
Ladle soup into large bowls and garnish with grated parmesan or a squeeze of lemon. Serve with crusty bread for dipping and dig in!Slice sausage links into half-inch thick coins, then slice coins in half. Heat a skillet over medium heat and add 1 tablespoon olive oil. When oil is hot, add sausage to pan and cook undisturbed for 5 minutes. Flip sausage pieces and continue to cook until browned, 3-5 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.Heat a large pot over medium heat, add remaining olive oil. Add kale, cover pot and simmer for 10-15 minutes, until kale is tender and quinoa is cooked. Add sausage and cook another few minutes until warmed through.Ladle soup into large bowls and garnish with grated parmesan or a squeeze of lemon. Serve with crusty bread for dipping and dig in!

ingredients: 2 packages TJ's Chevre With Honey Goat's Milk Cheese
directions: Slather brioche toasts with goat cheese and garnish with blueberries. Enjoy!Slather brioche toasts with goat cheese and garnish with blueberries. Enjoy!

ingredients: Your favorite TJ's Hummus/ Salad Greens/ Flatbread (Flatbread, Naan, Malabari Paratha, etc.) (optional), for serving
title: Falafel Surprise
directions:
Combine falafel mix and water in a medium sized bowl; cover and set aside for one hour.
Roughly divide falafel dough into 9 sections. Holding one piece of dough in your palm, press a teaspoon of feta into the center and mold the dough around it to conceal the feta. Repeat with remaining dough (you should have 9 dough balls).
Fill a 3-quart stockpot with sunflower oil, about four inches high. Turn heat to medium-high and heat oil to 300°F.
Working in batches, use a long-handled slotted spoon to gently lower dough balls into oil. Fry until floating and dark golden brown, 2 to 2 1/2 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel lined plate and cool 2 to 3 minutes before serving. Serve as an appetizer with your favorite hummus, or atop a bed of greens or in a toasted flatbread for a meatless meal.Combine falafel mix and water in a medium sized bowl; cover and set aside for one hour.Roughly divide falafel dough into 9 sections. Holding one piece of dough in your palm, press a teaspoon of feta into the center and mold the dough around it to conceal the feta. Repeat with remaining dough (you should have 9 dough balls).Fill a 3-quart stockpot with sunflower oil, about four inches high. Turn heat to medium-high and heat oil to 300°F.Working in batches, use a long-handled slotted spoon to gently lower dough balls into oil. Fry until floating and dark golden brown, 2 to 2 1/2 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel lined plate and cool 2 to 3 minutes before serving. Serve as an appetizer with your favorite hummus, or atop a bed of greens or in a toasted flatbread for a meatless meal.

Preheat oven to 350°F.
Prepare 2 Cake Pans (8"x8"x2"): use bottom of cake pan to measure/trace 2 circles on parchment paper; cut out the circles and set aside. Spray the inside of the cake pans with canola oil.  Place parchment circles in the pan bottoms and spray over top with butter flavored oil. Set aside.
Prepare & Bake Cakes: in a large mixing bowl, beat eggs, sunflower oil, and milk. Add cornbread mix and stir until moistened, being careful not to overmix. Fold in shredded Cheddar. Divide batter between prepared cake pans. Place on center rack of oven and bake. At 35 minutes, test centers with a toothpick; when toothpicks come out clean, remove cornbread to cool (in pans) for 10 minutes. After 10 minutes, run a knife around the inside of the pans, flip pans upside down and ease cornbread out onto a cooling rack to cool completely, about 40-50 minutes.
Prepare Bacon: while cornbread is cooling, prepare bacon according to package stove top directions. Let rest on paper towels to cool completely. Once cooled, chop bacon into ½ inch pieces. Set aside.
Prepare Frosting: add mascarpone, crème fraiche and Dijon mustard to the mixer bowl. Using an electric mixer with whip attachment, start mixing on low setting; gradually increase speed to medium and whip to stiff peaks, about 2 minutes or less.
Assemble Cake: place a dollop of frosting onto cake plate to anchor. Place 1 cornbread cake, top side down, on top and center on plate. Frost and sprinkle with ¼ of chopped bacon. Top with second cornbread cake and lightly frost sides the entire cake. Frost cornbread top with what remains, and pile on remainder of bacon, as decoratively as you like!Preheat oven to 350°F.Prepare 2 Cake Pans (8"x8"x2"): use bottom of cake pan to measure/trace 2 circles on parchment paper; cut out the circles and set aside. Set aside.Prepare & Bake Cakes: in a large mixing bowl, beat eggs, sunflower oil, and milk. Add cornbread mix and stir until moistened, being careful not to overmix. Fold in shredded Cheddar. Using an electric mixer with whip attachment, start mixing on low setting; gradually increase speed to medium and whip to stiff peaks, about 2 minutes or less.Assemble Cake: place a dollop of frosting onto cake plate to anchor. Place 1 cornbread cake, top side down, on top and center on plate. Frost and sprinkle with ¼ of chopped bacon. Top with second cornbread cake and lightly frost sides the entire cake. ingredients: 2 cups TJ's Sharp Cheddar Cheese, shredded
1 pkg TJ's Fully Cooked Uncured Applewood Smoked Bacon
title: Bared Bacon Cheddar Cornbread Cake
Easy Mocha Mud Pie
ingredients: 20 TJ's Joe-Joe's (Chocolate Cookies with Vanilla Bean Creme)
14 oz (1 tub) TJ's Dark Chocolate Covered Espresso Beans
8 Tbsp (1 stick) TJ's Salted Butter, melted
1 quart TJ's Coffee Bean Blast Ice Cream, softened slightly
1 cup TJ's Cold Brew Coffee Concentrate
¼ cup TJ's Raw Sliced Almonds
You will also need a 9-inch pie dish OR a 9-inch springform pan AND a hand mixer
directions:
Generously coat a 9-inch pie dish or springform pan with canola oil spray and set aside. Reserve about 25 dark chocolate covered espresso beans for garnish and set aside.
To make the crust: In a food processor, combine 20 Joe-Joe cookies, remaining dark chocolate espresso beans (about 1.5 cups) and 8 Tablespoons of melted butter. Pulse until uniform crumbs form. Scoop cookie mixture into your oiled pie dish and press along the bottom and the sides to form an even crust.
Add softened ice cream atop the crust and smooth into an even layer with a spatula. If ice cream is too runny once added to the dish, place pie dish into the freezer until it hardens slightly, about 10 minutes. Remove the lid from the fudge and microwave about 30 seconds or until lightly warmed. Spread the jar of hot fudge over the ice cream in an even layer. Place pie dish into freezer until fudge and ice cream layers harden, about 1 hour. If layers have not hardened before adding the whipped cream they will overflow, so use caution (the springform pan is a little more forgiving).
To make the cold brew whipped cream: Meanwhile, with a stand mixer or hand mixer, in a large bowl, whip 2 cups heavy cream, 1 cup cold brew and 2 tsp sugar until firm peaks form. Cover and refrigerate. Once ice cream and fudge layers harden, remove dish from freezer, then add whipped cream. Garnish the top with reserved chocolate covered espresso beans and sliced almonds.
Place dish back into freezer 6-8 hours or overnight until completely solid. To serve, let pie soften a few minutes in room temperature and slice with a knife warmed in hot water.
Enjoy immediately!Generously coat a 9-inch pie dish or springform pan with canola oil spray and set aside. Divide cruciferous crunch between two plates, set aside. Heat oil in a nonstick pan over medium heat. Add morsels to pan and cook 6-8 minutes, turning regularly to avoid browning. Add mandarin orange sauce packet and pineapple to pan and cook 2 minutes, stirring to coat. Remove pan from heat. Divide morsels and pineapple among prepared plates and serve immediately.Divide cruciferous crunch between two plates, set aside. Heat oil in a nonstick pan over medium heat. scant 1/3 cup TJ's Pineapple Tidbits, defrosted

directions: Combine all ingredients in a bowl and toss with dressing, to taste. Add salt and pepper, to taste. Refrigerate for at least one hour to marry flavors.Combine all ingredients in a bowl and toss with dressing, to taste. Add salt and pepper, to taste. directions:
Prepare pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, prepare a large bowl of ice water. Transfer cooked, drained pasta to ice water to cool. Drain pasta thoroughly and add to a very large mixing bowl.
Add cabbage, carrots, bell peppers and vinaigrette to pasta. Gently toss to combine. Adjust dressing to taste and add cilantro, if desired. Cover and chill 30 minutes. Garnish with crushed peanuts prior to serving.Prepare pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, prepare a large bowl of ice water. Transfer cooked, drained pasta to ice water to cool. directions:
Add cashews and almond milk to a blender pitcher or food processor. Cover and set aside for one hour to soak.
Purée soaked cashews and almond milk until smooth. Scrape down the sides of the pitcher. Add all remaining ingredients (except pasta) and purée to combine.
Prepare pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta and add back to warm pot. Pour sauce mixture into pot and stir gently to combine. Turn heat to low and continue stirring for 2-3 minutes until sauce is warm (you may need to add more almond milk to maintain desired texture). Scoop into serving bowls, drizzle with your favorite TJ's olive oil and dig in.Add cashews and almond milk to a blender pitcher or food processor. directions: Mix cabbage, salsa and cumin together, set aside. Wrap 6 tortillas in a paper towel and microwave for 1 minute. Remove from microwave and set aside to cool slightly. Add full piece of pork belly to sauté pan and brown on all sides until golden and warmed through. Remove from pan and slice into very thin slivers. Place a tortilla on a plate and spread with a layer of Avocado's Number, top with cabbage mixture, pork, lots of lime and cilantro; fold over and eat right away.

title: Grilled Carrot Miso Salmon
directions:
Whisk dressing and soy sauce in a shallow casserole dish. Place salmon in dish skin side-up, making sure to coat sides of fillets with marinade. Cover and refrigerate 4 hours or overnight.
Remove salmon from refrigerator about 20 minutes before you're ready to grill. Heat grill to high. Shake excess marinade from salmon, rub skin with olive oil and place directly on grill over center burners, skin side-down. Reduce heat to medium, close lid and cook salmon 4-5 minutes.
Open lid; salmon should be nearly done. Turn off center burners, close lid and finish cooking over indirect heat, about 2-3 minutes more. Salmon is ready when flesh is opaque and flakes easily with a fork. Remove from heat and let rest a few minutes. Add a dollop of dressing to each fillet just before serving.Whisk dressing and soy sauce in a shallow casserole dish. Place salmon in dish skin side-up, making sure to coat sides of fillets with marinade. Cover and refrigerate 4 hours or overnight.Remove salmon from refrigerator about 20 minutes before you're ready to grill. Heat grill to high. Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a casserole dish with canola spray; set aside.
Remove sausage from casing and add to a large skillet. Place skillet over medium heat and saute sausage 10-15 minutes until cooked through, stirring occasionally.
Line the bottom of the casserole dish with cooked sausage. Cover with half of the shredded cheese; set aside.
Whisk eggs, milk and 21 seasoning in a large bowl. Pour evenly over sausage and cheese mixture. Arrange potato tots in a single even layer atop mixture (save the rest for later!).
Place dish on center rack of oven and bake for 30 minutes. Remove dish from oven and sprinkle with remaining cheese, to taste. Return dish to oven and bake an additional 25-30 minutes. (Add diced bacon to oven during last 10 minutes of cooking, if desired). Remove dish from oven and let cool slightly before serving.Preheat oven to 350°F. title: Cherry Galette
ingredients: 1 pound (4 cups) TJ's Sweet Red Cherries (seasonal), pitted
1 TJ's Gourmet Pie Crust, defrosted through step one of package directions
2 Tbsp TJ's Unsalted Butter, diced & chilled
*You will also need 1 sheet of parchment paper
directions: Add pitted cherries, sugar, almond flour and cherry juice to a bowl; toss well and set aside for at least 30 minutes. Meanwhile, place pie dough onto parchment lined baking sheet, unfold and press together any cracks or breaks; place in refrigerator for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 400°F. Remove dough from refrigerator, place cherry filling in the center of dough and sprinkle with diced butter. Use the parchment as a guide to fold the dough up and pinch around cherries to form an open top shell. Gently lay the parchment back down once the shell has been formed. Pinch together any breaks in the shell to hold juices in. In a small bowl, combine 1 egg with 1 tablespoon of cold water to create an egg wash. Brush dough shell with egg wash and sprinkle with turbinado sugar. Place in oven and bake for about 35 to 40 minutes or until crust is golden brown and juices are bubbling. Remove from oven and rest for at least 10 minutes before slicing.Add pitted cherries, sugar, almond flour and cherry juice to a bowl; toss well and set aside for at least 30 minutes. Brush dough shell with egg wash and sprinkle with turbinado sugar. Place in oven and bake for about 35 to 40 minutes or until crust is golden brown and juices are bubbling. Remove from oven and rest for at least 10 minutes before slicing.

Combine sugar, soy sauce, sriracha, lime juice, sesame oil and garlic in a shallow dish. Add steak, cover and marinate for 1 hour; turn after 30 minutes.
While steak is marinating combine sauerkraut and fresh cabbage together and set aside.
Preheat grill to medium-high. Remove steak and discard marinade. Thread steak onto skewers; sprinkle with salt. Place skewers on grill and cook 3 minutes on each side or until desired degree of doneness. Remove, cover and set aside.
Grill tortillas 30 seconds on each side or until lightly charred; keep warm.
Place 2 tortillas per plate, and divide steak evenly among tortillas. Top each taco with cabbage mixture; sprinkle with onions, top with harissa and serve.Combine sugar, soy sauce, sriracha, lime juice, sesame oil and garlic in a shallow dish. Add steak, cover and marinate for 1 hour; turn after 30 minutes.While steak is marinating combine sauerkraut and fresh cabbage together and set aside.Preheat grill to medium-high. Remove steak and discard marinade. Thread steak onto skewers; sprinkle with salt. Place skewers on grill and cook 3 minutes on each side or until desired degree of doneness. Remove, cover and set aside.Grill tortillas 30 seconds on each side or until lightly charred; keep warm.Place 2 tortillas per plate, and divide steak evenly among tortillas. Top each taco with cabbage mixture; sprinkle with onions, top with harissa and serve.
ingredients: 5 Tbsp TJ's Reduced Sodium Soy Sauce
1 Tbsp iuice from ½ TJ's Lime , squeezed fresh
1 Tbsp TJ's Organic Toasted Sesame Oil
1 pkg (about 1 lb) TJ's USDA Choice Premium Angus Beef Flank steak, sliced against the grain into thin strips

title: Con Fusion Steak Tacos

ingredients: 1 package TJ's Chicken Tikka Masala OR Vegan Tikka Masala
½ cup TJ's Organic Peas, heated according to package directions and drained
title: Tikka Masala Burritos
directions:
Remove tikka masala tray from carton and puncture film 2 to 3 times. Microwave on high for 3 minutes. Carefully peel back film enough to gently stir sauce. Heat an additional 1 to 1½ minutes to an internal temperature of 165°F. Carefully remove film; set aside.
Warm tortillas in a dry skillet or directly over flame. Remove from heat and lay tortillas on a clean work surface. Divide rice and tikka masala between tortillas. Top each with peas, a few dollops of yogurt and chutney, and cilantro.
To roll, pull half of the tortilla closest to you up to meet the top half, then pull the tortilla and fillings back toward you. Fold in the left and right sides of the tortilla, then roll tightly until closed. Enjoy!Remove tikka masala tray from carton and puncture film 2 to 3 times. Microwave on high for 3 minutes. Carefully peel back film enough to gently stir sauce. Heat an additional 1 to 1½ minutes to an internal temperature of 165°F. Fold in the left and right sides of the tortilla, then roll tightly until closed. Enjoy!

ingredients: 3 sticks TJ's Unsalted Butter, separated and melted
1 box TJ's Vanilla Cake & Baking Mix
2 ¼ cup TJ's Organic Powdered Sugar
½ jar TJ's Fleur de Sel Caramel Sauce, for the layers
4 TJ's Sea Salt Brownie Petites, halved
4 TJ's Chocolate with Vanilla Bean Cream Joe-Joe's, halved
8 TJ's Crispy Crunchy Chocolate Chip Cookies
title: Decadence on Display Cake
directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Prepare 3 Cake Pans (8"x8"x2"): use bottom of a cake pan to measure/trace 3 circles on parchment paper; cut out the circles and set aside. Spray the inside of the pans with canola oil. Place parchment circles on the bottom of each pan and spray over top with butter flavored oil. Set aside.
Prepare & Bake Cakes: in three separate bowls, prepare each cake mix. For vanilla cake, mix together 2 eggs, 1 stick of melted butter, and 1 cup milk; add dry mix and whisk until batter is smooth; pour into cake pan. For brownies, whisk together 2 eggs with 1 stick of melted butter; add dry mix and stir until moistened; pour into cake pan. For blondies, whisk together 1 egg with 1 stick of melted butter; add dry mix and stir until moistened; pour into cake pan. Bake all three cakes per directions on package (note: the vanilla cake takes about 10 minutes longer, so make this one first). Remove cakes and let cool (in pans) for 10 minutes. After 10 minutes, run a knife around the inside of each cake pan, flip pans upside down and ease cakes out onto a cooling rack to cool completely, about 40-50 minutes.
Prepare Frosting: while cakes are cooling, make buttercream frosting. Add butter to stand mixer (a hand mixer will work too) fitted with a paddle; beat at medium speed until creamy, about 2 minutes. Add sugar, cream, and vanilla; mix at low speed until just incorporated. Increase the speed to high and mix until smooth and fluffy, about 3 to 5 minutes. If it becomes too thick, add a little more cream. If it's too thin, add more powdered sugar.
Assemble Cake: place a dollop of buttercream on cake stand or platter to anchor, place brownie layer on top. Pipe or spread buttercream frosting along the edges of the cake; fill in center with ¼ jar of caramel sauce. Top with blondie cake and repeat buttercream and caramel step. Top with vanilla cake layer; as lightly as you like frost sides of the entire cake with remaining buttercream.
Decorate Cake: warm the jar of fudge sauce for 10 seconds in the microwave and pour ½ over the top of the cake and allow to flow down the sides in long drips. Decorate top of the cakes with brownie petites and cookies.Preheat oven to 350°F.Prepare 3 Cake Pans (8"x8"x2"): use bottom of a cake pan to measure/trace 3 circles on parchment paper; cut out the circles and set aside. Decorate top of the cakes with brownie petites and cookies.

title: Chocolate Cream Pie
directions:
Add pudding and instant coffee to a small bowl (if omitting instant coffee, skip to next step). Mix to incorporate. Cover and refrigerate 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 375°F. Unwrap crust and poke holes all over to allow air to escape. Bake on center rack of oven until golden brown, about 15 minutes. Remove from oven, place on a cold sheet pan and place in the freezer for 10 minutes to cool.
Remove pudding from refrigerator and stir (instant coffee should be dissolved). Spoon pudding evenly into cooled pie crust and level the top. Cover with cling wrap and freeze 2 hours.
Meanwhile, in a medium bowl, whisk heavy cream and powdered sugar until soft peaks form, about 5 minutes. Cover and refrigerate.
20 minutes prior to serving, remove pie from freezer. When ready to serve, use a spatula to gently spread whipped cream atop pie. Grate dark chocolate atop whipped cream and serve.Add pudding and instant coffee to a small bowl (if omitting instant coffee, skip to next step). Mix to incorporate. ingredients: *If you'd prefer to skip the pretzel-making, substitute the ingredients above with 1 package of TJ's Big Soft Pretzels, prepared according to package instructions & cut into bite-sized pieces.
1 teaspoon TJ's Extra Virgin Olive Oil
4 cups TJ's Shredded Sharp Cheddar Cheese (or your preferred Cheddar)

title: Pretzel Bites & Beer Cheese Dip
directions:
Prepare the Pretzel Bites:
Remove dough from package and let rest for 10 minutes. Preheat oven to 350°F. Spray a large baking sheet with cooking spray. In a small bowl, beat one egg and set aside. Roll out pizza dough to about 1/2 inch thick. Cut into 1 1/2 inch strips, and then cut strips lengthwise into small rectangles. Brush tops of dough pieces with egg and use grinder to add desired amount of salt on top. Place bites on a baking sheet, two inches apart. Bake 12-15 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool 5 minutes prior to serving. 
Prepare the Beer Cheese Dip:
In a medium saucepan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add shallots and cook until translucent. Add beer, garlic powder, Dijon, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Lower heat and slowly add cream cheese, whisking to incorporate. Slowly add shredded cheeses and stir until melted. Serve immediately.Prepare the Pretzel Bites:Remove dough from package and let rest for 10 minutes. Preheat oven to 350°F. Spray a large baking sheet with cooking spray. Add beer, garlic powder, Dijon, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Lower heat and slowly add cream cheese, whisking to incorporate. Slowly add shredded cheeses and stir until melted. Serve immediately.

ingredients: 1 cup TJ's Quick Cook Steel Cut Oats
½ cup TJ's Unsweetened Apple Sauce
½ cup TJ's Jumbo Raisin Medley
¼ cup TJ's Unsalted Dry Toasted Slivered Almonds
directions:
In a small saucepan over high heat, combine oatmeal and water. When the mixture begins to boil, reduce heat to low and simmer 5 minutes.
Stir applesauce, cinnamon, raisins, sugar, and almond slivers into oatmeal, and continue cooking another 5 minutes. (If you prefer a thinner oatmeal, add more water or applesauce to your preference.)
 Transfer oatmeal to serving bowls and enjoy.In a small saucepan over high heat, combine oatmeal and water. When the mixture begins to boil, reduce heat to low and simmer 5 minutes.Stir applesauce, cinnamon, raisins, sugar, and almond slivers into oatmeal, and continue cooking another 5 minutes. (If you prefer a thinner oatmeal, add more water or applesauce to your preference.)Transfer oatmeal to serving bowls and enjoy.
title: Oatmeal Cookie Oatmeal

ingredients: 1 box TJ's Raspberry Stars Shortbread Cookies (seasonal)
1 TJ's 72% Dark Chocolate Pound Plus Bar, broken into small pieces
directions:
Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper, set aside. Add half of the chocolate pieces to a medium microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on half-power for 1 minute intervals, stirring in between, until chocolate is melted.
Dip cookies in melted chocolate and place on prepared baking sheet. Place sheet in refrigerator for 10 minutes to set chocolate (cookies will set even faster in the freezer, if you're on a time-crunch). Repeat process with remaining cookies and chocolate.
Use a spatula to transfer cookies to a serving plate, and enjoy!Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper, set aside. Add half of the chocolate pieces to a medium microwave-safe bowl. Repeat process with remaining cookies and chocolate.Use a spatula to transfer cookies to a serving plate, and enjoy!
title: Chocolate Dipped Raspberry Stars

directions: Preheat oven to 400º F. Place dough onto parchment lined baking sheet, unfold and press together any cracks or breaks in dough. Add peaches to a mixing bowl and toss together with brown sugar and cinnamon. Top dough with peach mixture and dot with butter. Fold dough up and pinch around; peaches will stick out of top. Pinch together and smooth any breaks in dough or juices will leak out. Brush dough with milk and sprinkle with Turbinado sugar. Place in oven and bake for about 45 minutes or until crust is golden brown and peaches are bubbling. Remove from oven and rest for about 10 minutes before slicing.Preheat oven to 400º F. Brush dough with milk and sprinkle with Turbinado sugar. Place in oven and bake for about 45 minutes or until crust is golden brown and peaches are bubbling. Remove from oven and rest for about 10 minutes before slicing.

1/3 stick TJ's Unsalted Butter, diced and chilled

Cheesy Truffle Snack Mix

ingredients: 2 packages TJ's Oven Baked Cheese Bites with Black Summer Truffle (seasonal) or TJ's Oven Baked Cheese Bites

title: Double Chocolate Triple Ginger Tart
directions:
PREPARE THE CRUST: Preheat oven to 325°F. In the bowl of a food processor combine ginger snap crumbs with melted butter and process until moist. Pour mixture into an 11-inch tart pan with removable bottom; press firmly into pan bottom and up sides. Place pan on a rimmed baking sheet. Set aside.
MELT THE CHOCOLATE: Add chopped 72% dark chocolate and heavy whipping cream to a medium saucepan. Place over low heat and stir gently until melted and smooth. Remove from heat and set aside.
MIX THE FILLING: In a medium bowl whisk together egg yolks, egg, sugar, flour, salt and cinnamon. Gradually whisk chocolate mixture into egg mixture until well blended. Pour into crust and smooth out to edges.
BAKE: Bake until filling puffs slightly at edges and center is softly set, about 30 minutes. Remove from oven and cool in pan 35 minutes.
PREPARE GARNISH: While tart is cooling, prepare the milk chocolate flakes. To do this, let the unwrapped milk chocolate bar come to slightly higher than room temperature. Hold the bar in one hand—you may want to hold it in a piece of parchment or waxed paper to stop the bar from melting in your hand—then slowly and carefully, use a vegetable peeler to shave along the length of the bar to form chocolate flakes.
SERVE: Finally, gently remove tart pan sides and using a spatula, carefully slide tart onto a serving dish. Once completely cooled, top with milk chocolate flakes and fresh fruit. Cut into 12 wedges and serve.PREPARE THE CRUST: Preheat oven to 325°F. In the bowl of a food processor combine ginger snap crumbs with melted butter and process until moist. Pour mixture into an 11-inch tart pan with removable bottom; press firmly into pan bottom and up sides. Place pan on a rimmed baking sheet. Set aside.MELT THE CHOCOLATE: Add chopped 72% dark chocolate and heavy whipping cream to a medium saucepan. Place over low heat and stir gently until melted and smooth. Remove from heat and set aside.MIX THE FILLING: In a medium bowl whisk together egg yolks, egg, sugar, flour, salt and cinnamon. Gradually whisk chocolate mixture into egg mixture until well blended. Hold the bar in one hand—you may want to hold it in a piece of parchment or waxed paper to stop the bar from melting in your hand—then slowly and carefully, use a vegetable peeler to shave along the length of the bar to form chocolate flakes.SERVE: Finally, gently remove tart pan sides and using a spatula, carefully slide tart onto a serving dish. Once completely cooled, top with milk chocolate flakes and fresh fruit. Cut into 12 wedges and serve.
ingredients: 2 cups crumbled TJ's Triple Ginger Snaps
12 ounces TJ's 72% Dark Chocolate Pound Plus Bar, finely chopped
8 oz. TJ's Milk Chocolate Pound Plus Bar, shaved into flakes
3/4 cup Fresh TJ's Raspberries or TJ's Strawberries
11-inch tart pan with a removable bottom
2 jars TJ's Organic Kosher Hot & Spicy Dill Pickle Chips, drained
title: Spicy Fried Pickles
directions:
Line a large cutting board with paper towels. Arrange pickles atop paper towels and pat dry, set aside.
In a medium bowl, whisk beer, egg, baking powder and salt. Add flour and whisk until smooth, set aside.
Pour sunflower oil in a medium saucepot (about an inch high) and heat to medium high—oil should reach 375°F. Oil is ready when a drop of batter sizzles when added to the pot.
While oil heats, place a cooling rack atop a rimmed cookie sheet. (This is where your pickles will hang out after you fry each batch—the air circulation helps avoid sogginess, so don't skip this step!)
Working in batches (8-10 pickles at a time, depending on the size of your pot), dredge pickle chips in beer batter, shake off excess and carefully lower into hot oil with tongs. Fry 3-4 minutes, turning halfway through with a slotted spoon, until chips are golden brown. Remove from pot and place on cooling rack to cool for a few minutes. Enjoy!Line a large cutting board with paper towels. Arrange pickles atop paper towels and pat dry, set aside.In a medium bowl, whisk beer, egg, baking powder and salt. Add flour and whisk until smooth, set aside.Pour sunflower oil in a medium saucepot (about an inch high) and heat to medium high—oil should reach 375°F. Oil is ready when a drop of batter sizzles when added to the pot.While oil heats, place a cooling rack atop a rimmed cookie sheet. (This is where your pickles will hang out after you fry each batch—the air circulation helps avoid sogginess, so don't skip this step!)Working in batches (8-10 pickles at a time, depending on the size of your pot), dredge pickle chips in beer batter, shake off excess and carefully lower into hot oil with tongs. Fry 3-4 minutes, turning halfway through with a slotted spoon, until chips are golden brown. Remove from pot and place on cooling rack to cool for a few minutes. Enjoy!

Pre-heat oven to 400°F. Slice tomatoes in half, and scoop out insides; set aside. Sprinkle cut sides with a small amount of salt and place over a rack, cut side down, to drain.
Heat skillet over medium-high heat; add oil; swirl. Add sausage and begin to brown. Separate out as many tomato seeds as possible and discard. Chop tomato insides. Add to sausage pan along with onions and garlic and sauté for one minute. Add mushrooms and sauté 2 to 3 minutes longer. Add rice; sauté until all ingredients are cooked tender; about an additional 3 or 4 minutes. Deglaze pan with white wine and cook off excess. Add pepper, taste and adjust seasoning.
Stuff tomato bottoms with rice mixture; top with cheese and a sliced mushroom. Stuff tomato tops with cheese. Place all in a small enough pan to keep them as upright as possible and into oven to bake until cheese is melted, golden and bubbly. About 10 to 15 minutes. Serve each tomato bottom with a cheesy top.Pre-heat oven to 400°F. Slice tomatoes in half, and scoop out insides; set aside. Sprinkle cut sides with a small amount of salt and place over a rack, cut side down, to drain.Heat skillet over medium-high heat; add oil; swirl. Add sausage and begin to brown. Place all in a small enough pan to keep them as upright as possible and into oven to bake until cheese is melted, golden and bubbly. About 10 to 15 minutes. Serve each tomato bottom with a cheesy top.
title: Stuffed Vine Tomatoes with Cheesy Hats
ingredients: 1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste
1 Tbsp TJ's 100% Greek Kalamata Olive Oil
1 TJ's Sweet Italian Sausage link, casing removed and crumbled
4 individual Sliced Crimini Mushrooms (set aside for garnish)
1 cup Sliced TJ's Crimini Mushrooms, chopped
1 1/2 cups TJ's Wild Rice, cooked according to package directions
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste
1 bar TJ's Pound Plus Milk Chocolate, broken into chunks
1 ½ cups TJ's Butter Toffee Pretzels (seasonal), divided
1 ½ cups TJ's Mini Marshmallows, divided
directions:
Line a quarter-sheet rimmed baking pan with parchment paper. Spread 1 cup pretzels and 1 cup marshmallows in an even layer in pan, set aside.
Fill a sauce pot half-full with water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to allow the water to simmer. Rest a large stainless bowl over the top of the pan, making sure that the bottom of the bowl does not touch the water. Add chocolate to the top bowl and stir occasionally as chocolate melts, until it becomes smooth. Turn off heat.
Pour melted chocolate over lined pan, using a spatula to smooth it evenly across pretzels and marshmallows. Top melted chocolate with remaining pretzels and marshmallows. Refrigerate for 2 hours or until firm. Remove from refrigerator and let sit 15 minutes before slicing.Line a quarter-sheet rimmed baking pan with parchment paper. Refrigerate for 2 hours or until firm. Remove from refrigerator and let sit 15 minutes before slicing.
title: Butter Toffee Pretzel Bark
Irish Bangers & Champ
directions:
Prepare the Bangers: In a large skillet or frying pan over medium heat, heat 3 tablespoons oil. Add bangers and brown on all sides, about 10 minutes. Add water and cook until bangers until internal temperature reaches 165?F. Remove bangers from pan and set aside.
Prepare the Gravy: Add remaining oil, onion, and garlic to skillet and cook over medium heat until onions are translucent. Add flour and mix thoroughly. Add one cup of broth and stir until a thick paste is formed. Pour in remaining beef broth, one cup at a time, mixing thoroughly between additions. Continue heating until gravy has thickened (about 5 minutes). Turn heat to low and cover pan until ready to serve.
Prepare the Champ: Heat frozen mashed potatoes in microwave or on the stovetop according to package directions. Once heated through, stir in butter and scallions. To serve, place a large scoop of champ on a plate, top with bangers and a generous ladleful of gravy.Prepare the Bangers: In a large skillet or frying pan over medium heat, heat 3 tablespoons oil. title: Lemon Chicken Orzo Soup
directions: Use forks to pull apart chicken and shred into pieces. Add all ingredients to a medium saucepan and heat over medium high. Bring to a boil, then lower heat and simmer 8 minutes. Add pita chips and olive oil to a medium bowl and toss to coat; set aside.
Add romaine and 2 tablespoons dressing to a large bowl, toss to combine. Add more dressing to taste. Top with cucumbers, tomatoes, red onion, and pita chips. Garnish with a squeeze of lemon and a few grinds of salt & pepper. title: Crunchy Pita Salad

ingredients: 1 (1lb) bag TJ's Dutch Yellow Baby Potatoes
4 Tablespoons TJ's Extra Virgin Olive Oil
directions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Bring a medium pot of salted water to a boil. Add potatoes and boil until fork tender, about 10 minutes. Drain potatoes. Place potatoes onto a cutting board then gently smash (we used the base of a heavy glass Pyrex measuring cup) until each potato reaches about half its thickness, being careful to keep the potato intact. Drizzle about 2 tablespoons of olive oil onto a baking tray, then gently transfer each smashed potato onto the baking tray with a spatula. Generously brush the remaining olive oil atop the potatoes then sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place tray of potatoes in the heated oven and bake for 15 minutes. Flip the potatoes, season salt and pepper and bake an additional 10 more minutes the tops are until golden brown and crispy. Serve immediately.
title: Smashed Potatoes

directions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Unwrap brie and place in the center of a small baking dish (there should be room for the cheese to spread and fill the dish as it melts). Place on center rack of oven and bake 10-15 minutes or until gently bubbling (watch closely after the 10 minute mark to avoid burned cheese!). Remove from oven and let cool 5 minutes. If desired, stir in a spoonful of pumpkin butter, then grab some Pumpkin Tortilla Chips and dig in!Preheat oven to 350°F. Unwrap brie and place in the center of a small baking dish (there should be room for the cheese to spread and fill the dish as it melts). Place on center rack of oven and bake 10-15 minutes or until gently bubbling (watch closely after the 10 minute mark to avoid burned cheese!). Remove from oven and let cool 5 minutes. If desired, stir in a spoonful of pumpkin butter, then grab some Pumpkin Tortilla Chips and dig in!

Enjoy immediately, or refrigerate until ready to serve.Combine potato salad and harissa in a medium serving bowl. Taste and add more harissa, if desired. Gently fold in bacon crumbles. directions: Generously slather toast with mascarpone; set aside. Using a sharp knife, cut the poles off the citrus so the flesh is exposed. Stand citrus upright, and slice peel and pith off in sections until fully removed. Turn citrus on its side and slice thinly. Arrange citrus slices atop prepared toast and drizzle with honey. Serve immediately, with a piece of honeycomb on the side.Generously slather toast with mascarpone; set aside. Using a sharp knife, cut the poles off the citrus so the flesh is exposed. Stand citrus upright, and slice peel and pith off in sections until fully removed. Turn citrus on its side and slice thinly. Arrange citrus slices atop prepared toast and drizzle with honey. Serve immediately, with a piece of honeycomb on the side.
title: Fifty Fifty Toast
ingredients: TJ's European Style Multigrain Bread (available in the West Coast) OR Multigrain Bread, lightly toasted
1 package TJ's Gyoza (Pork, Chicken, Shrimp or Vegetable)
2 packages TJ's Low Sodium Chicken Broth
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste
title: Potsticker Soup's On!
directions:
Coat the bottom of a large frying pan with oil (about 2-3 tablespoons) and lightly fry the gyoza over medium-high heat until they get some nice browning on both sides (about 10 minutes). Remove from heat and set aside.
Meanwhile, in a large soup pot (about 6 qt.), pour a couple tablespoons of oil and add the mirepoix. Saute the vegetables in the pot until the onions start to appear translucent. Add the broth to the pot and bring to a slow simmer. When the soup gets some energy, toss in the spinach and add the soy sauce and sesame oil.
When the soup is officially simmering, add the potstickers. Serve it up in bowls and garnish with cilantro. (Make sure you have extra spoons on hand... never underestimate the charisma of Trader Joe's Potsticker Soup's On!)Coat the bottom of a large frying pan with oil (about 2-3 tablespoons) and lightly fry the gyoza over medium-high heat until they get some nice browning on both sides (about 10 minutes). Combine all ingredients in a bowl and stir until blended. Serve with sliced apples or Cinnamon Apple Sticks for dipping.Combine all ingredients in a bowl and stir until blended. Serve with sliced apples or Cinnamon Apple Sticks for dipping.
title: Pumpkin Spice Honey Dip

ingredients: 1 TJ's Butternut Squash, roasted and cubed
½ teaspoon TJ's Paprika, plus more for garnish
Juice of ½ a TJ's Lime
¼ cup TJ's Avocado Oil, plus more for garnish
TJ's Organic Blue Corn Tortilla Chips, or your favorite chips or veggies
directions:
Add all ingredients, except avocado oil, to food processor or blender. Turn on food processor/ blender and slowly drizzle oil into the mixture, about 30-45 seconds.
Once the oil has been added, turn off the machine and scrape down sides of bowl. Blend for another 30 seconds to 1 minute. Spoon into serving dish. using spoon to create a well in the center of hummus.
Garnish with olive oil and paprika. Serve with chips or veggies for dipping, or dig in with a spoon!Add all ingredients, except avocado oil, to food processor or blender. title: Butternut Squash Hummus

directions: In a large bowl, combine quinoa, black beans, mango, bell pepper, green onions and cilantro.  In a separate smaller bowl, whisk olive oil, lime zest and lime juice. Drizzle over quinoa salad and toss to distribute evenly. Add salt and pepper to taste. Chill and serve.
ingredients: 3 cups TJ's Tri Color Quinoa, cooked
1 can TJ's Organic Black Beans, drained and rinsed
1 cup TJ's Mango, peeled, pitted (or defrosted from frozen) & cut into bite size pieces
1/4 cup TJ's Extra Virgin California Estate Olive Oil
Juice of 1 TJ's Lime & 1/2 teaspoon of zest
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste
title: Mango Black Bean Quinoa

ingredients: 2 tubs TJ's Kettle Cooked Chicken Soup
directions: Add all ingredients to a medium saucepan. Heat over medium and bring to a simmer. Simmer 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Garnish with fresh thyme and serve.Add all ingredients to a medium saucepan. Heat over medium and bring to a simmer. Simmer 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Garnish with fresh thyme and serve.
title: Creamy Chicken Gnocchi Soup
Leek & Bacon Egg Tottins
directions:
Preheat oven to 400°F degrees. Spray cups with canola oil. Line each cup with three potato tots and set aside.
Add butter and leeks to a skillet over medium heat, and sauté 2-3 minutes until leeks are caramelized. Transfer sauteed leeks to a medium bowl. In the same pan, cook bacon according to package directions. Once crispy, remove to cool, blot dry, then chop into small pieces.
Add bacon pieces to bowl of leeks, then stir in eggs, salt and pepper. Set aside. Add three to four pinches of goat cheese on top of the potato tots in each cup. Then, evenly distribute the egg mixture among the cups.
Place pan in center rack of oven and bake 20-23 minutes until egg is cooked and tops have browned slightly. Allow to cool for a minute, then run a knife around the edge of each cup, and carefully remove tottins and place in a serving platter. Enjoy!Preheat oven to 400°F degrees. Spray cups with canola oil. Allow to cool for a minute, then run a knife around the edge of each cup, and carefully remove tottins and place in a serving platter. Enjoy!
ingredients: 36 (less than 1 bag) TJ's Trader Potato Tots
1 package fresh TJ's Trimmed Leeks, ends trimmed, quartered lengthwise & roughly chopped
6 slices TJ's Uncured Apple Smoked Bacon
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste

TJ's Organic Shredded Green & Red Cabbage with Orange Carrots
directions:
Preheat oven to 475°F. Arrange fish nuggets on a greased baking sheet. Bake on center rack of oven for 15-18 minutes until crisp. Remove from oven and let cool slightly.
While fish nuggets bake, slice tomatoes and set aside. Warm tortillas in a pan over medium heat or directly over the gas flame, using tongs to flip.
To assemble each taco, place two nuggets in a warm tortilla and top with tomatoes and cabbage. Drizzle with as much hot sauce as you like and enjoy!Preheat oven to 475°F. Arrange fish nuggets on a greased baking sheet. Bake on center rack of oven for 15-18 minutes until crisp. title: Green Dragon Fish Tacos

directions:
Gently remove dough from bag, place on a lightly floured work surface and let sit at room temperature for 30 minutes.
Add olive oil and onion to a skillet over medium heat. Sauté about 5 minutes, until translucent. Add ground beef to skillet and cook until meat is no longer pink and reaches 160°F. Drain, loosely cover and set aside.
Preheat oven to 475°F. Stretch dough by hand or rolling pin into a circle 12 inches in diameter. Place on a lightly oiled pizza pan or baking sheet. Spread sauce evenly over crust to within half an inch of the edges, and top with ground beef mixture and cheese. Brush edges of dough with olive oil.
Place pan on center rack of oven and bake for about 25 minutes, or until cheese is golden and bubbly around the edges and the bottom of the crust is a light golden brown. Remove pan from oven and let cool slightly. Top pizza with pickles, drizzle with ketchup & mustard and serve.Gently remove dough from bag, place on a lightly floured work surface and let sit at room temperature for 30 minutes.Add olive oil and onion to a skillet over medium heat. ingredients: TJ's All-Purpose Flour, for work surface
2 teaspoons TJ's Olive Oil, plus more for brushing pizza crust
1 package (1 pound) TJ's Organic Grass Fed Ground Beef
1 cup TJ's Mild Shredded Cheddar Cheese
TJ's Organic Sweet Bread & Butter Pickles
TJ's Organic Ketchup & Yellow Mustard, for garnish
title: Cheeseburger Pizza

directions:
Preheat a grill to medium-high. Season burgers with salt and pepper. Grill burgers according to package directions; remove from heat and let rest 5 minutes.
To assemble, place a burger on the bottom half of a bun. Top with goat cheese crumbles, tomato, arugula and onion. Generously slather fig butter on top half of bun and place on burger. Repeat with remaining ingredients and serve immediately.Preheat a grill to medium-high. Season burgers with salt and pepper. Grill burgers according to package directions; remove from heat and let rest 5 minutes.To assemble, place a burger on the bottom half of a bun. title: Buffalo Fig Burger
ingredients: 2 packages TJ's Ground Buffalo Burgers, thawed according to package directions

directions:
Defrost shrimp and peaches according to package instructions; under running water or overnight in the refrigerator. Combine the lime juice, lemon juice, olive oil, onion, 21 seasoning salute, and cilantro in a medium bowl. Cut shrimp into ½ inch pieces and add to mixture. Place bowl to the side and allow to marinade.
Meanwhile, dice the peaches, avocado, and red bell pepper into ½ inch cubes. Add this to the bowl of cut shrimp and toss.
Serve as is, or alongside Frozen Organic Jasmine Rice for a quick and delicious weeknight meal.Defrost shrimp and peaches according to package instructions; under running water or overnight in the refrigerator. title: Tropical Shrimp Salad
ingredients: 1 pound TJ's Frozen Shrimp 70-110 medium peeled
½ medium TJ's red onion, finely minced
1 package TJ's Chicken & Bell Pepper Sausage
1 cup TJ's Organic Tomato Basil Marinara
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste
1 stalk TJ's Green Onions (optional), for garnish
directions:
Heat oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. When oil shimmers, add chicken drumsticks and brown on all sides, about 5 minutes. Stir in sausage and heat for a minute and a half longer. Mix in quinoa, 21 Seasoning Salute, olive tapenade and tomato basil marinara. Pour over vegetable stock; stir and bring to a gentle boil. Cover with a lid; adjust heat to medium-low and cook until liquid is absorbed and chicken is done, about 13-15 minutes. Taste and adjust seasoning.
