title: Quinoa Con Pollo

ingredients: ¼ cup TJ's Unsalted Butter, melted
1 ½ cups TJ's Organic Bran Flakes, crushed
1 cup TJ's Wild Organic Frozen Blueberries
1 cup TJ's Organic Frozen Strawberries, cut in quarters
title: Berry Best Bran Muffins
directions:
Preheat oven to 400°F. Thoroughly coat two 12-count muffin tins. Set aside.
In a large bowl combine honey, milk, and eggs. Set aside
In another large bowl combine crushed bran flakes, flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Fold dry ingredients into wet ingredients and add melted butter. Mix just until combine, then mix in berries.
Scoop about ¼ cup of batter into each muffin cup, you will only need about 4 to 6 of the spaces in the second tin. 
Bake on center rack of the oven for 15-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean.
Remove from oven, let cool, and enjoy!Preheat oven to 400°F. Thoroughly coat two 12-count muffin tins. Set aside.In a large bowl combine honey, milk, and eggs. Set asideIn another large bowl combine crushed bran flakes, flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.Fold dry ingredients into wet ingredients and add melted butter. Mix just until combine, then mix in berries.Scoop about ¼ cup of batter into each muffin cup, you will only need about 4 to 6 of the spaces in the second tin.Bake on center rack of the oven for 15-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean.Remove from oven, let cool, and enjoy!

ingredients: 1 cup TJ's Organic Multicolor Quinoa, dry
1 can TJ's Organic Diced No Salt Added Tomatoes
1 cup TJ's Mexican Blend Shredded Cheese
TJ's Organic Spanish Extra Virgin Olive Oil Spray, to grease pan

title: Cowboy Quinoa Bake
directions:
Preheat oven to 350°. Add Quinoa and 2 cups water to a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer. Cover and cook for 10-12 minutes, until water is completely absorbed. Turn off heat and fluff quinoa with a fork.
In a large bowl, fold together cooked Quinoa, Cowboy Caviar, Diced Tomatoes and Cheese, just until mixed. Grease an 8-inch square baking pan with Organic Olive Oil Spray and spread mixture into pan. Cook for 25 minutes, then turn broiler on high and cook 5 more minutes. Remove from oven and let cool 5 minutes. Top with Sour Cream and Cilantro, if desired and serve.Preheat oven to 350°. Thaw shrimp according to package instructions. Set aside.
Heat oil in saucepan over medium-high heat. Add all vegetables from bag and sauté for 3 to 4 minutes, stirring frequently.
Remove rice from packaging. Using your hands, break up/crumble rice into pan and mix with vegetables. Add shrimp right away, and sauté for an additional 1 to 2 minutes, or until shrimp is heated through.
Lower heat, add sauce, and stir until vegetables, shrimp, and rice are fully coated.
Allow to cool slightly. Serve warm and enjoy!Thaw shrimp according to package instructions. Set aside.Heat oil in saucepan over medium-high heat. 1 bag TJ's Miso Vegetable & Brown Rice Sauté Kit

title: Spaghetti Squash with Meatball Marinara
directions:
Cook the squash: Use a sharp knife to cut squash in half lengthwise. Use a large table spoon to scrape out the seeds and string. Season with salt and pepper, place cut side up in a microwave safe dish and add about an inch of water to the bottom of the dish. Cover dish with cling wrap and microwave on high for 10-14 minutes. Allow to cool enough to handle before unwrapping. Use a table fork to scrape squash from top to bottom to separate flesh into strands of "spaghetti."
Prepare Meatball Marinara: Place meatballs in large skillet and cook according to package stove top directions. Once warmed through, add marinara sauce and cooked squash. Toss to cover and heat through; add Parmesan, salt and pepper, to taste. Serve right away.Cook the squash: Use a sharp knife to cut squash in half lengthwise. ingredients: 1 can TJ's Organic Salsa Style Refried Black Beans
1 tub (16 oz) TJ's Organic Sour Cream
1/2 bag TJ's Organic Shredded 3 Cheese Blend
TJ's Restaurant Style Tortilla Chips (or your favorite TJ's Tortilla Chips) for dipping

directions:
In a 2-quart serving dish, use a spatula to spread beans across the bottom of the dish in an even layer. Continue gently layering with guacamole, sour cream, and salsa (rinse your spatula when switching ingredients to keep your layers clean).
Top with cheese, green onions, cilantro, and olives. Dig in with your favorite TJ's tortilla chips.In a 2-quart serving dish, use a spatula to spread beans across the bottom of the dish in an even layer. directions:
Microwave rice according to package directions. Pat tilapia filets dry with paper towels and generously season both sides with paprika, sea salt & pepper.
In a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, melt ghee. Add tilapia to skillet and cook 2-3 minutes per side, until fish is opaque and flakes easily with a fork. Remove from heat.
To assemble: Divide rice among two plates and top each with a tilapia filet. Drizzle filets with desired amount of salsa, and garnish with lemon slices and cilantro. Enjoy immediately.Microwave rice according to package directions. TJ's Smoked Paprika, Sea Salt & Pepper

directions:
Combine olive & sesame oils and heat in large skillet. Add chicken and cook over medium-high heat until chicken is cooked through, about 8 minutes, or until internal temperature reaches 165°F.
Add diced onions, stir to combine, and cook for about 5 minutes or until onion is soft and translucent. Stir occasionally.
Add Soyaki, soy sauce, rice vinegar, ginger, cashews, chives, salt and pepper. Cook for another 5 minutes or until fragrant.
Remove from heat and let cool slightly.
Rise head of lettuce, pat dry, and pull off desired leaves. Spoon about ¼ cup of the mixture into each of the lettuce leaves to serve. Enjoy!Combine olive & sesame oils and heat in large skillet. 1 package TJ's Chile & Garlic Cashews, chopped
title: Cashew Chicken Lettuce Wraps

directions:
Preheat oven to 425°F. Place burgers on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake 20 minutes on center rack of oven, flipping burgers halfway through cooking; remove from heat.
While burgers bake, in a small bowl, toss sweet potato rounds with olive oil. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Heat a grill pan to medium-high. Grill sweet potatoes 3-4 minutes per side; remove from heat.
In a medium bowl, toss shredded cabbage with salad dressing; set aside.
To assemble: place a veggie burger on the bottom half of a hamburger bun. Top with sweet potato rounds, slaw, sliced avocado, and top half of bun. Repeat with remaining ingredients and serve immdiately.Preheat oven to 425°F. Place burgers on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. ingredients: 2 TJ's Sweet Potatoes, peeled and sliced into 1/4" rounds
1 bag TJ's Organic Shredded Cabbage & Carrots
1-2 tablespoons TJ's Almond Butter Turmeric Salad Dressing

title: Coconut Cold Brew Ice Pops
ingredients: 6 Tablespoons TJ's Shredded Sweetened Coconut, divided
1 ¾ cup TJ's Non-Dairy Coconut Beverage (Vanilla Flavor), divided
1 ½ cups TJ's Coconut Cold Brew Coffee Concentrate (or original TJ's Cold Brew Coffee Concentrate)
You will also need 12 wooden craft sticks, 12 small square pieces of foil and 12 small paper cups to use as molds
directions:
Arrange 12 paper cups on a small tray. Sprinkle ½ tablespoon of shredded coconut in the bottom of each cup. Pour 1 Tablespoon of coconut milk into each cup and swish until the shredded coconut is completely saturated. Place tray of cups in the freezer for at least 1.5 hours or until layer solidifies.
Meanwhile, in a small pitcher combine remaining 1 cup of coconut milk, 1.5 cups of cold brew and 3 teaspoons of sugar. Stir, cover and set aside.
Once the coconut milk layers are solid, remove tray from freezer and add about 3 tablespoons of your cold brew mixture to each cup. Cover each cup with foil and puncture with a wooden craft stick down the center. Stick the pops in the freezer for about six hours. Peel the paper away and enjoy!Arrange 12 paper cups on a small tray. Sprinkle ½ tablespoon of shredded coconut in the bottom of each cup. Pour 1 Tablespoon of coconut milk into each cup and swish until the shredded coconut is completely saturated. Place tray of cups in the freezer for at least 1.5 hours or until layer solidifies.Meanwhile, in a small pitcher combine remaining 1 cup of coconut milk, 1.5 cups of cold brew and 3 teaspoons of sugar. directions:

Preheat the oven to 350°.
Prepare brownies according to package instructions.
Remove brownies from oven and press half of the the peanut butter cups, bottoms down, into the warm brownies making rows that cover the top of the brownies entirely. Place brownies back into the oven for one to two minutes, or until the peanut butter cups soften. Use a spatula or knife to spread softened peanut butter cups into a gooey frosting over the brownies .
Optional: chop the rest of the peanut butter cups in half, then press them into the already-melted "frosting" or use as garnish.
Allow to cool (if you can). Enjoy!Preheat the oven to 350°.Prepare brownies according to package instructions.Remove brownies from oven and press half of the the peanut butter cups, bottoms down, into the warm brownies making rows that cover the top of the brownies entirely. title: Peanut Butter Cup Brownies
ingredients: 1 container TJ's Peanut Butter Cups, unwrapped

directions: Mix half of the blue cheese with the ranch dressing. Set aside. Place wedges of lettuce on a large serving dish. Pour dressing over saald and top with tomatoes, green onions, remaining cheese, and crumbled bacon. Serve family style.Mix half of the blue cheese with the ranch dressing. Set aside. Place wedges of lettuce on a large serving dish. Pour dressing over saald and top with tomatoes, green onions, remaining cheese, and crumbled bacon. Serve family style.
title: Family Style Wedge Salad
ingredients: 1 large head TJ's Iceberg Lettuce, cut into several wedges
3/4 cup halved TJ's Mini Pearl Grape Tomatoes
2 TJ's Green Onions, white and green parts sliced thin
1/2 cup TJ's Crumbled Blue Cheese, crumbled and divided
1 cup cooked and crumbled TJ's Uncured Black Forest Bacon
2 rolls (1 box) TJ's Pie Crust, defrosted in fridge overnight
1 jar (about 2 cups) TJ's Dark Morello Cherries, drained
1 tsp TJ's Unbleached All Purpose Flour, plus more for rolling dough
1 large TJ's Egg, beaten with 1 tsp Water
1/4 cup TJ's Turbinado Sugar (optional for sanding tops)
*You will also need a wide-mouthed jar or circular cookie cutter (3.5 in diameter = about 7 hand pies)
title: Cherry Cocoa-Almond Hand Pies
directions:
Remove both pie crust rolls from refrigerator and let soften to room temperature. Once dough is softened, working in two batches, unroll and smooth together any cracks with your hands over the top of the plastic film of the dough. Remove plastic film and place dough onto a floured surface. Cut out 7 circles from one roll and 7 circles from the other (it could be more or less depending on the size of your cookie cutter, just make sure you end up with an even number). Place all dough circles onto two baking trays lined with parchment paper and place back in refrigerator to chill.
In a medium bowl, combine strained cherries, flour and cocoa almond spread (Cocoa almond spread will be difficult to stir at first, but it will eventually incorporate as it comes to room temperature). Set aside. Prepare egg wash by whisking egg with water in a small bowl. Set aside.
Remove dough from refrigerator and place a spoonful of the cherry-cocoa mix onto 7 of the dough circles, making sure not to overfill or touch the edges of the dough. Brush egg wash around the perimeter of each filled dough circle. Place the remaining 7 dough circles on top of the mounds, then crimp the edges of the dough with a fork to seal each pie. Place prepared pies back in refrigerator to chill another 10 minutes before baking.
Preheat oven to 375°F. Remove pies from refrigerator and brush tops generously with egg wash. With a sharp knife, cut a slit or a small design on the top of each pie to help steam release while baking. Sprinkle turbinado sugar over the top of each pie, if using. Bake pies in center rack for 20-25 minutes, or until the cherry juices start bubbling and the pastry is golden brown, rotating sheet halfway through. Transfer to a cooling rack and serve warm.Remove both pie crust rolls from refrigerator and let soften to room temperature. title: Charlotte's Chocolate Bread Pudding
ingredients: TJ's Unsalted Butter, to grease pan
½ cup plus 2 tablespoons TJ's Organic Cane Sugar
1 ¼ cups TJ's Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips
1 teaspoon TJ's Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract
4 cups cubed TJ's French Baguette (about half of a baguette)
directions:
Preheat oven to 325°F. Grease an 8-inch square baking pan with butter, set aside.
Add cream and ½ cup sugar to a heavy-bottomed saucepan and bring to a gentle simmer, stirring until sugar dissolves.  Remove from heat and whisk in 1 cup chocolate chips until melted and smooth, set aside. 
In a large mixing bowl, whisk egg and vanilla.  Gradually whisk in cooled chocolate mixture. Let chocolate custard mixture cool for 10 minutes, stirring often.
Fold bread cubes and remaining chocolate chips into chocolate custard.  Transfer mixture to baking pan and sprinkle with remaining sugar. 
Bake pan on center rack of oven for 50 minutes, until custard thickens and center is set. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Serve warm with whipped cream, if desired.Preheat oven to 325°F. Let chocolate custard mixture cool for 10 minutes, stirring often.Fold bread cubes and remaining chocolate chips into chocolate custard.  Transfer mixture to baking pan and sprinkle with remaining sugar.Bake pan on center rack of oven for 50 minutes, until custard thickens and center is set. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Serve warm with whipped cream, if desired.

title: Pulled Pork Sandwiches
ingredients: 1 package TJ's Organic Cole Slaw Kit (seasonal)
2 trays TJ's Pulled Pork in Smoky BBQ Sauce
directions:
Place cole slaw in a medium bowl. Toss with dressing packet, set aside.
Microwave pulled pork according to package directions. Use a fork to split rolls. Pile pulled pork and cole slaw on bottom half of roll and top with the other half. Enjoy!Place cole slaw in a medium bowl. Toss with dressing packet, set aside.Microwave pulled pork according to package directions. Use a fork to split rolls. Pile pulled pork and cole slaw on bottom half of roll and top with the other half. Enjoy!

Preheat oven to 375º F. In a large bowl, mix by hand the cottage cheese, cheddar, spinach, eggs, flour and butter. Pour mixture into the pie crust. Bake at 375º for 45 minutes. Let sit 15 minutes and serve.
Recipe Credit: Trader Joe's 2011 HiiP Recipe Showdown Winner - Melinda Torres.Preheat oven to 375º F. In a large bowl, mix by hand the cottage cheese, cheddar, spinach, eggs, flour and butter. ingredients: 1 TJ's Gourmet Pie Crusts, thawed and placed in 9-inch pie dish
1 package TJ's Frozen Chopped Spinach, defrosted and drained
1/2 a stick TJ's Unsalted Butter, cut into chunks
title: Spinach Pie
Linguine Limone Alfredo with Shrimp
directions:
In a large pot, bring water to a rolling boil; add salt if desired. Add noodles and stir gently to separate. Bring water back to a boil and cook 8 – 10 minutes or until desired doneness is reached.
Remove from heat and drain pasta well. Place pasta back in empty pot.
In a medium skillet, melt butter. Once melted, add shrimp and garlic; sauté for 2 – 3 minutes, just until shrimp are thoroughly heated.
Add sauce and shrimp to noodles and mix until thoroughly coated. Add parsley if desired and salt to taste.
Serve and enjoy!In a large pot, bring water to a rolling boil; add salt if desired. Add noodles and stir gently to separate. Bring water back to a boil and cook 8 – 10 minutes or until desired doneness is reached.Remove from heat and drain pasta well. Place pasta back in empty pot.In a medium skillet, melt butter. ingredients: ½ bag TJ's Frozen Cooked Medium Shrimp
1/4 cup plus 1 Tablespoon TJ's Extra Virgin Olive Oil, divided
1/4 cup TJ's Organic Sriracha and Roasted Garlic BBQ Sauce
1 tub TJ's Premium French Vanilla Ice Cream
directions:
Cut nectarines into thick wedges (about 6-7 wedges per nectarine). Heat a cast-iron grill on the stovetop over medium heat and grease with 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Pour olive oil in a small bowl and dip nectarine wedges until fully immersed in oil. Place wedges on grill and sear until grill marks appear, about 2-3 minutes. Flip and repeat. Baste wedges with Sriracha BBQ Sauce on all sides, then remove from grill and set aside to cool slightly.
Gently split biscuits in half—careful, they are fragile! To serve, scoop ice cream onto the bottom half of the biscuit then top with grilled and glazed nectarine wedges. Add an extra drizzle of Sriracha BBQ Sauce for an extra zing. Enjoy immediately!Cut nectarines into thick wedges (about 6-7 wedges per nectarine). title: Grilled Nectarine Shortcake & Sriracha BBQ Glaze
Salted Caramel Speculoos Milkshake
ingredients: 4 scoops TJ's Cookie Butter Ice Cream or TJ's French Vanilla Ice Cream
1 Tbsp TJ's Fleur de Sel Caramel Sauce
directions: In a blender, pulse together ice cream, caramel sauce, cookies, milk and ice until smooth. Pour into a glass and top with whipped cream, Speculoos cookie crumbles and more caramel sauce.In a blender, pulse together ice cream, caramel sauce, cookies, milk and ice until smooth. Pour into a glass and top with whipped cream, Speculoos cookie crumbles and more caramel sauce.

ingredients: 1 cup (about 14) TJ's Fancy Medjool Dates, pitted
title: Trailblazer Bites
directions: Combine almonds, flaxseed and pitted dates in a food processor or blender and pulse until ingredients are crumbled in an even consistency. Spoon mixture into a medium sized bowl. Add cashew butter, rolled oats and cacao (or chocolate) then stir until combined. Refrigerate mixture in bowl for 15 minutes to set. Remove from refrigerator, then form mixture into 1 1/2 inch balls. Makes about 12 balls. Enjoy right away and store remaining bites in a resealable bag in the freezer.Combine almonds, flaxseed and pitted dates in a food processor or blender and pulse until ingredients are crumbled in an even consistency. Spoon mixture into a medium sized bowl. Add cashew butter, rolled oats and cacao (or chocolate) then stir until combined. Refrigerate mixture in bowl for 15 minutes to set. Remove from refrigerator, then form mixture into 1 1/2 inch balls. Makes about 12 balls. Enjoy right away and store remaining bites in a resealable bag in the freezer.

Preheat oven to 425°F.
Prick sweet potatoes all over with a fork and place on a lined baking sheet.
Bake for 45- 50 minutes or until tender and a fork can be easily inserted in the thickest part of the potato.
Let cool slightly, cut potatoes partially open (length-wise) with a knife. Loosely "stuff" and top with salad. Sprinkle with cheese crumbles (optional) and serve immediately. Enjoy!Preheat oven to 425°F.Prick sweet potatoes all over with a fork and place on a lined baking sheet.Bake for 45- 50 minutes or until tender and a fork can be easily inserted in the thickest part of the potato.Let cool slightly, cut potatoes partially open (length-wise) with a knife. Loosely "stuff" and top with salad. Sprinkle with cheese crumbles (optional) and serve immediately. Enjoy!
ingredients: TJ's Organic Crumbled Feta or TJ's Crumbled Goat Cheese (garnish)
title: Harvest Grain Sweet Potatoes

directions:
Lay the closed bag of corn chip dippers flat on a clean work surface. Using a sharp pair of scissors, cut the corn chip dipper bag in half crosswise, so that each half of the bag contains dippers (even the portions out if necessary). Roll the cut edges of each side down to create “bowls.”
Top the dippers with warmed turkey chili, cheese, and jalapeños to taste. Dig in!Lay the closed bag of corn chip dippers flat on a clean work surface. Using a sharp pair of scissors, cut the corn chip dipper bag in half crosswise, so that each half of the bag contains dippers (even the portions out if necessary). Roll the cut edges of each side down to create “bowls.”Top the dippers with warmed turkey chili, cheese, and jalapeños to taste. Dig in!
ingredients: 1 bag TJ's Organic Corn Chip Dippers
1 can TJ's Turkey Chili, heated according to package directions
TJ's Shredded Three Cheese Mexican Blend
title: Corn Chip Dipper Chili Pie

directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Prepare 2 Cake Pans (8"x8"x2"): use bottom of cake pan to measure/trace 2 circles on parchment paper; cut out the circles and set aside. Spray the inside of the pans with canola oil. Place parchment circles in the bottom of each pan and spray over top with butter flavored oil. Set aside.
Prepare Cakes: in a large mixing bowl, whisk together eggs, oil, and water. Add both boxes of dry mix to the liquids in the bowl; stir with a large spoon, until the ingredients are just combined. Divide batter between the 2 cake pans and bake for 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove cakes and let cool completely, about 1 hour.
Prepare Frosting: while cakes are cooling, prepare the frosting. Whip cookie butter cream cheese, cookie butter, and vanilla until fluffy, blended together, and thoroughly mixed. Refrigerate frosting until ready to use.
Prepare Milk Soak, Bananas, & Cake Layers: once cake is cooled, prepare the milk soak. Place 1 cup cookie butter and ½ cup milk into a sauce pan over a low flame; stir until melted together. Add a little more milk if needed to make it slightly runny.
Cut bananas into ¼ inch round slices.
Remove cakes from pans to a wire rack. Use a serrated knife to cut off cake crowns and slice each cake into 2 layers. Set the crowns aside for another use (ideas: crumbled & toasted for ice cream topping; use to craft trifles, banana bread pudding, or cake pops; blend into a chocolate shake).
Assemble Cake: place a dollop of cookie butter frosting on cake plate or platter to anchor. Place first layer of cake over the frosting and center on the plate. Spoon 1/3 of the cookie butter/milk soak over top of layer; frost; cover with sliced bananas. Repeat with second and third layers of cake. Add the fourth (top) layer and frost liberally. Decorate the top layer: place 8 (or so) cookie halves upright around the edge of the cake; place ¾ of walnuts and remainder of bananas around the center of the cake. Crush remaining cookies and walnuts and sprinkle over the cake. If you're feeling bananas, drizzle with melted chocolate.Preheat oven to 350°F.Prepare 2 Cake Pans (8"x8"x2"): use bottom of cake pan to measure/trace 2 circles on parchment paper; cut out the circles and set aside. Spray the inside of the pans with canola oil. Place parchment circles in the bottom of each pan and spray over top with butter flavored oil. Set aside.Prepare Cakes: in a large mixing bowl, whisk together eggs, oil, and water. Refrigerate frosting until ready to use.Prepare Milk Soak, Bananas, & Cake Layers: once cake is cooled, prepare the milk soak. Place 1 cup cookie butter and ½ cup milk into a sauce pan over a low flame; stir until melted together. Add a little more milk if needed to make it slightly runny.Cut bananas into ¼ inch round slices.Remove cakes from pans to a wire rack. Use a serrated knife to cut off cake crowns and slice each cake into 2 layers. Set the crowns aside for another use (ideas: crumbled & toasted for ice cream topping; use to craft trifles, banana bread pudding, or cake pops; blend into a chocolate shake).Assemble Cake: place a dollop of cookie butter frosting on cake plate or platter to anchor. Place first layer of cake over the frosting and center on the plate. Spoon 1/3 of the cookie butter/milk soak over top of layer; frost; cover with sliced bananas. Repeat with second and third layers of cake. Add the fourth (top) layer and frost liberally. Decorate the top layer: place 8 (or so) cookie halves upright around the edge of the cake; place ¾ of walnuts and remainder of bananas around the center of the cake. Crush remaining cookies and walnuts and sprinkle over the cake. If you're feeling bananas, drizzle with melted chocolate.
title: Peeled Banana & Cookie Butter Cake
ingredients: 2 pkgs (16 oz.) TJ's Cookie Butter Cream Cheese, softened
2 tsp TJ's Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract
1 cup TJ's Speculoos Cookie Butter, divided
8 TJ's Cookie Butter Sandwich Cookies, cut in half
½ cup TJ's Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips (optional), melted

title: Ginger Molasses Ice Cream Sandwiches
ingredients: 1 package TJ's Ginger Molasses Cookie Dough (seasonal), baked according to directions
1 cup TJ's Vanilla Ice Cream or Your Favorite TJ's Ice Cream
directions: Fill each pair of cookies with about 2 tablespoons (or more!!!) of ice cream to make a total of six ice cream sandwiches. Eat right away, or wrap in aluminum foil and freeze until you're ready to indulge.

Add onion to a large bowl. Use your hands to break ground turkey into pieces and add to bowl. Sprinkle seasoning evenly over meat. Use your hands to gently mix until onion, turkey and seasoning are evenly combined. If using our pre-formed Ground Turkey Patties, season both sides of each patty generously and evenly. Cover and refrigerate 20 minutes.
Remove turkey from refrigerator. Use your hands to form the meat into 4 patties.
Pan-Fry: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and add oil to coat the bottom of the skillet. When oil is hot, use a spatula to carefully transfer patties to skillet. Cook 6-8 minutes, undisturbed, until bottom is well-browned and releases easily from the pan. Flip patties, adding more oil to the pan if necessary, and cook another 6-8 minutes, until internal temperature reaches 165°F. Transfer to paper towel lined plate, set aside.
If you're in a rush, you can skip ahead to assembly. But if you want warmed rolls with melty cheese, turn broiler to high. Place roll halves on a baking sheet. Top half of the rolls with a slice of cheese. Broil for 1-2 minutes to melt cheese (watch carefully to ensure rolls don't burn!). Remove pan from broiler and let cool slightly.
Place burger on the bottom half of the roll with melted cheese, followed by salad greens. Generously spread glaze and mustard on top half of the roll, and place on burger.
Grill: Preheat grill to medium high. Place seasoned patties on grill and cook, covered, for 6 minutes. Flip burgers and cook, covered, about 6 more minutes or until internal temperature of patties reaches 165°F. Place a slice of cheese on each patty during the last 1-2 minutes of cooking to melt. Remove sand let cool slightly before serving.Add onion to a large bowl. Use your hands to break ground turkey into pieces and add to bowl. Sprinkle seasoning evenly over meat. ingredients: 1 package (16 oz) TJ's All Natural Ground Turkey
¼ cup minced TJ's Yellow Onion
2 teaspoons TJ's Mushroom & Company Multipurpose Umami Seasoning Blend
4 TJ's Ciabatta Rolls (halved lengthwise) or 4 TJ's Brioche Buns
4 slices TJ's Sliced Aged Swiss Cheese
TJ's Balsamic Glaze and/or Organic Yellow Mustard, whichever you prefer
Your favorite crunchy TJ's Salad Greens or Microgreens
title: Umami Turkey Burgers

directions: Fill a copper mug or highball glass with ice. Add ginger brew and vodka and stir. Take a sip, adding more ginger brew or vodka to taste. Garnish with a sprinkle of pumpkin pie spice and ginger, and enjoy.Fill a copper mug or highball glass with ice. Add ginger brew and vodka and stir. Take a sip, adding more ginger brew or vodka to taste. Garnish with a sprinkle of pumpkin pie spice and ginger, and enjoy.
ingredients: 2 parts TJ's Pumpkin Pie Spiced Ginger Brew (seasonal)
1 part TJ's The Art of the Still Organic Vodka
TJ's Pumpkin Pie Spice (optional), for garnish
TJ's Fresh Ginger (optional), thinly sliced for garnish
title: Pumpkin Pie Spiced Mule
Shawarma Pizza
ingredients: 1/2 cup TJ's Shawarma Chicken Thighs, prepared according to package directions
2-3 tablespoons TJ's Julienned Sundried Tomatoes, drained
directions: Par-bake crust according to package directions. Remove crust from oven and top with cheese and chicken. Return to oven and cook 5 minutes. Turn broiler to high and broil 3-5 minutes until cheese is golden. Remove pizza from oven and top with sundried tomatoes. Let cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.Par-bake crust according to package directions. Remove crust from oven and top with cheese and chicken. Return to oven and cook 5 minutes. Turn broiler to high and broil 3-5 minutes until cheese is golden. Remove pizza from oven and top with sundried tomatoes. Let cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

Unwrap steak and season liberally with salt and pepper. Let rest for 30 minutes.
Coat steak with 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Heat a cast iron skillet over medium-high. Add steak to skillet and cook about 2 minutes per side, until the internal temperature reaches 120°F (this will take about 10 minutes, leaving you with a medium-rare steak after resting— if you prefer your steak medium, add a few more minutes of cook time and remove the steak when it reaches 130°F). Transfer steak to a plate to rest.
Add vegetables to skillet and sauté 4-5 minutes, until heated through. Use a slotted spoon to transfer vegetables to a serving platter. Slice steak and arrange atop vegetables. Serve with a generous drizzle of mustard sauce, garnish with parsley, and dig in!Unwrap steak and season liberally with salt and pepper. Let rest for 30 minutes.Coat steak with 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Heat a cast iron skillet over medium-high. Add steak to skillet and cook about 2 minutes per side, until the internal temperature reaches 120°F (this will take about 10 minutes, leaving you with a medium-rare steak after resting— if you prefer your steak medium, add a few more minutes of cook time and remove the steak when it reaches 130°F). Transfer steak to a plate to rest.Add vegetables to skillet and sauté 4-5 minutes, until heated through. Use a slotted spoon to transfer vegetables to a serving platter. Slice steak and arrange atop vegetables. Serve with a generous drizzle of mustard sauce, garnish with parsley, and dig in!
ingredients: 1 TJ's All-Natural USDA Choice Premium Angus Beef New York Strip Steak
1 bag TJ's Organic Green Vegetable Foursome
TJ's Aioli Garlic Mustard Sauce OR Dijon Mustard

directions:
Preheat oven to 425°F.
Lightly toast bread (light setting on toaster) or about 1 to 2 minutes each side in the oven).
Mix blue cheese, apricots and pecans together. Set aside.
Place arugula on toast, top with mozzarella, and then with the blue mixture. Place in oven and toast until all cheese is melted, apricots are warm and pecans are slightly toasted; about 6 to 8 minutes. Adorn with extra apricots and/or pecans. Serve right away.Preheat oven to 425°F.Lightly toast bread (light setting on toaster) or about 1 to 2 minutes each side in the oven).Mix blue cheese, apricots and pecans together. Set aside.Place arugula on toast, top with mozzarella, and then with the blue mixture. Place in oven and toast until all cheese is melted, apricots are warm and pecans are slightly toasted; about 6 to 8 minutes. Adorn with extra apricots and/or pecans. Serve right away.

3 Tbsp TJ's Caved Aged Blue Cheese, crumbled
2 Tbsp TJ's Sweet and Spicy Pecans, chopped

directions: Preheat oven to 350° and grease baking pan with your choice of oil or butter. Place bread pieces in pan and distribute evenly. Beat the eggs, milk and any spices you desire (salt, pepper, garlic powder...) and pour over the bread. Add the remaining ingredients and bake for 25 minutes or until top is golden brown and a knife put in the center comes out clean. Let sit for 5 minutes before serving (oh, you can wait). Enjoy.Preheat oven to 350° and grease baking pan with your choice of oil or butter. Place bread pieces in pan and distribute evenly. title: Breakfast Casserole
ingredients: 1 loaf TJ's Crusty French Bread, torn into pieces
1 cup TJ's Sweet Italian Style Chicken Sausage (pre-cooked), sliced (or TJ's Italian Sausage-less Sausage)
1 cup TJ's Monterey Jack Cheese, grated

title: Tortellini Salad
directions:
To make the vinaigrette: In a small bowl, whisk together cheese, vinegar, honey, 21 seasoning salute, salt, and pepper. Slowly whisk in oil until emulsified. Taste and adjust seasoning as desired. Makes about 1 cup of vinaigrette. Set aside.
To prepare salad: In a large, bowl combine cooked tortellini, diced onions, bell peppers, cucumbers and salame. Fold in 1/4 to 1/2 cup of prepared dressing. Taste and add additional salt and pepper as desired. Enjoy!To make the vinaigrette: In a small bowl, whisk together cheese, vinegar, honey, 21 seasoning salute, salt, and pepper. Slowly whisk in oil until emulsified. Taste and adjust seasoning as desired. Makes about 1 cup of vinaigrette. Set aside.To prepare salad: In a large, bowl combine cooked tortellini, diced onions, bell peppers, cucumbers and salame. Fold in 1/4 to 1/2 cup of prepared dressing. Taste and add additional salt and pepper as desired. Enjoy!
ingredients: 2 (10 oz) packages TJ's Cheese Tortellini, cooked & drained
2 TJ's Bell Peppers, cored and diced
1 (5 oz) package Columbus Calabrese Salame, diced
2 tablespoons grated TJ's Pecorino, Romano and Parmesan Cheese Blend
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste
1/3 cup TJ's Extra Virgin Olive Oil

title: Blueberry-Lemon Hand Pies
directions:
Remove both pie crust rolls from refrigerator and soften to room temperature. Pour bag of frozen blueberries in a strainer and rinse with water to defrost. Set aside.
Once dough is softened, working in two batches, unroll and smooth together any cracks with your hands over the top of the plastic film of the dough. Remove plastic film and place dough onto a floured surface. Cut out 7 circles from one roll and 7 circles from the other (it could be more or less depending on the size of your cookie cutter, just make sure you end up with an even number). Place all dough circles onto two baking trays lined with parchment paper and place back in refrigerator to chill.
In a medium bowl, combine strained blueberries, lemon zest, lemon curd and flour. Stir and set aside. Prepare egg wash by whisking egg with water in a small bowl. Set aside.
Remove dough from refrigerator and place a spoonful of the lemon-blueberry mix onto 7 of the dough circles, making sure not to overfill or touch the edges of the dough. Brush egg wash around the perimeter of each filled dough circle. Place the remaining 7 dough circles on top of the mounds, then crimp the edges of the dough with a fork to seal each pie. Place prepared pies back in refrigerator to chill another 10 minutes before baking.
Preheat oven to 375°F. Remove pies from refrigerator and brush tops generously with egg wash. With a sharp knife, cut a slit or a small design on the top of each pie to help steam release while baking. Sprinkle turbinado sugar over the top of each pie, if using. Bake pies on center rack of oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the blueberry juices start bubbling and the pastry is golden brown. For even baking, rotate sheet halfway though. Transfer to a cooling rack and serve warm.Remove both pie crust rolls from refrigerator and soften to room temperature. Pour bag of frozen blueberries in a strainer and rinse with water to defrost. Set aside.Once dough is softened, working in two batches, unroll and smooth together any cracks with your hands over the top of the plastic film of the dough. Remove plastic film and place dough onto a floured surface. Cut out 7 circles from one roll and 7 circles from the other (it could be more or less depending on the size of your cookie cutter, just make sure you end up with an even number). Place all dough circles onto two baking trays lined with parchment paper and place back in refrigerator to chill.In a medium bowl, combine strained blueberries, lemon zest, lemon curd and flour. Stir and set aside. Prepare egg wash by whisking egg with water in a small bowl. Set aside.Remove dough from refrigerator and place a spoonful of the lemon-blueberry mix onto 7 of the dough circles, making sure not to overfill or touch the edges of the dough. Brush egg wash around the perimeter of each filled dough circle. Place the remaining 7 dough circles on top of the mounds, then crimp the edges of the dough with a fork to seal each pie. Place prepared pies back in refrigerator to chill another 10 minutes before baking.Preheat oven to 375°F. Remove pies from refrigerator and brush tops generously with egg wash. With a sharp knife, cut a slit or a small design on the top of each pie to help steam release while baking. Sprinkle turbinado sugar over the top of each pie, if using. Bake pies on center rack of oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the blueberry juices start bubbling and the pastry is golden brown. For even baking, rotate sheet halfway though. Transfer to a cooling rack and serve warm.
ingredients: 2 rolls (1 box) TJ's Pie Crust, defrosted in fridge overnight
1 bag (1 1/2 cups) TJ's Frozen Wild Boreal Blueberries
1 tsp TJ's Unbleached All Purpose Flour, plus more for rolling dough
1 large TJ's Egg, beaten with 1 tsp Water
1/4 cup TJ's Turbinado Sugar (optional), for sanding tops
*You will also need a wide-mouthed jar or circular cookie cutter (3.5 in diameter = about 7 hand pies)

title: Sheet Pan Fajitas
directions:
Position oven racks in upper and lower thirds of oven. Preheat oven to 400°F.
Place onion, bell peppers, and olive oil in a medium bowl and toss to combine. Divide mixture among two large baking sheets; set aside.
Remove pollo asado from package and slice into 2x1-inch strips. Divide pollo asado between baking sheets. Place sheets on upper and lower racks of oven and bake 25-30 minutes, rotating halfway through, until chicken reaches 165°F. Remove from oven and let cool slightly.
While fajitas bake, slice limes into wedges. Rinse and dry cilantro and remove stems. Warm tortillas in a skillet over medium heat, or directly over flame, if desired.
To assemble, fill a warm tortilla with fajitas and top with pico de gallo, cilantro, and a squeeze of lime. Repeat until satisfied.Position oven racks in upper and lower thirds of oven. ingredients: 1 bag TJ's Frozen Mélange à Trois (Red, Yellow & Green Bell Pepper Strips)

title: Smoked Aioli
ingredients: 3 large TJ's Premium Peeled Garlic Cloves
1 tsp TJ's Lemon juice, more to taste
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste
directions: Add garlic to a small saucepan, cover by 1/2 inch with cold water, place over medium flame and poach until water comes to a boil. As soon as the water boils, remove from heat, steep for one minute, drain and rinse with cold water to stop the cooking. Let garlic cool completely. Add the garlic, mayonnaise, olive oil, smoked paprika, and lemon juice to a blender or food processor and process until smooth. Do not over mix. Taste and adjust lemon if desired and then add salt, and pepper to taste. Refrigerate to help marry flavors.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. While water boils, add 2 tablespoons oil and panko to a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir to coat panko with oil and sauté for 5 minutes, shaking pan occasionally to ensure even browning. Pour toasted panko into a small bowl and set aside.
Add remaining oil and onions to the pan and sauté over medium heat until lightly browned, about 7 minutes. Turn off heat. Add crème fraîche, lemon zest and juice and stir gently to combine.
While onions are cooking, add pasta to boiling water. Boil 4 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add peas and boil another 4-5 minutes. Drain pasta and add to crème fraîche mixture. Turn heat to high and stir until pasta is well coated and sauce thickens, about 2 minutes.
Turn off heat and add Parmesan to pan, stirring to coat pasta. Season with salt & pepper, to taste. Ladle pasta into bowls, top with toasted panko and serve immediately.Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. title: Fancy Lemon Farfalle
ingredients: 4 tablespoons TJ's Extra Virgin Olive Oil, divided
1/2 cup TJ's Japanese Style Panko Breadcrumbs
Zest and juice of 1 TJ's Lemon

directions:
Preheat the oven to 350°F. In a large bowl, whisk butter and eggs. Add brownie mix and stir gently, just until combined. Fold in cherries and walnuts; set aside.
Grease an 8-inch square baking pan with canola oil spray. Place softened cookie dough chunks haphazardly around the bottom of the pan (there may be a few pieces of cookie dough leftover; do with them what you must). Pour the brownie mix evenly over the cookie dough and smooth out the top with a spatula.
Place pan on center rack of oven and bake 30-35 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove pan from oven and let brownies cool slightly prior to slicing and serving. Enjoy as-is, or alongside a scoop of TJ's French Vanilla Ice Cream.Preheat the oven to 350°F. In a large bowl, whisk butter and eggs. Add brownie mix and stir gently, just until combined. title: Rumble Cakes
ingredients: 1 stick TJ's Unsalted Butter, softened to room temperature
1/4 cup TJ's Walnut Halves and Pieces

title: Vegetable Stir Fry
directions: Mix sesame oil, orange juice, soy sauce, honey and ginger. Add tofu and let marinate for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Cook stir fry veggies according to package directions. Add tofu to stir fry and cook for an additional 2 minutes. Add sauce to stir fry and heat through. Serve over rice noodles (or rice), if desired.Mix sesame oil, orange juice, soy sauce, honey and ginger. Add tofu and let marinate for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Cook stir fry veggies according to package directions. Add tofu to stir fry and cook for an additional 2 minutes. Add sauce to stir fry and heat through. Serve over rice noodles (or rice), if desired.
ingredients: 1 package TJ's Asian Stir Fry Veggies
1 package TJ's Firm Tofu, pressed and cubed
1 teaspoon TJ's Organic Toasted Sesame Oil

directions: Pour whipping cream into a large bowl. Using a hand mixer or whisk, whip until soft peaks form. Add Pumpkin Pie Spice and sugar and continue whipping to desired texture. Serve with scones, coffee, muffins, ice cream...Pour whipping cream into a large bowl. Using a hand mixer or whisk, whip until soft peaks form. title: Pumpkin Spice Whipped Cream
Pork Loin with Honey Mustard
ingredients: 1/3 cup TJ's Unbleached All Purpose Flour
3 tsp TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste
3 tsp TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste
1 TJ's All Natural Crate Free Pork Tenderloin
1 1/2 Tbsp TJ's Dijon Mustard with White Wine
directions:
Preheat the oven to 400°F. Grease a baking sheet with cooking spray or line with foil and set aside.
In a medium-sized bowl, add milk, eggs, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1 teaspoon black pepper. Whisk to combine; set aside. In a medium-sized baking dish, combine bread crumbs, flour, 2 teaspoons black pepper, 2 teaspoons salt, paprika, and garlic powder and mix with a fork until blended; set aside.
Dip pork loin in milk wash and roll to coat evenly on all sides. Dip pork loin in breading mixture and roll to coat on all sides. Place pork loin on baking sheet. Bake for about 30 minutes, or until it reaches an internal temperature of 145 degrees.
While pork loin cooks, assemble dipping sauce: in a medium sized bowl, combine mayonnaise, mustard, honey, vinegar and a pinch of salt. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.
Once pork reaches an internal temperature of 145 degrees, remove from oven and let cool 5 minutes. Slice and serve with dipping sauce.Preheat the oven to 400°F. title: Golden Milk Coconut Chia Pudding
directions:
In a small bowl, mix coconut beverage, chia seeds, vanilla, and syrup until combined. Let mixture sit 10 minutes, stirring every 2-3 minutes to break up any clumps. Cover bowl and refrigerate for a minimum of two hours, or overnight.
Remove pudding from fridge, divide between two small bowls or jars, and garnish as desired.In a small bowl, mix coconut beverage, chia seeds, vanilla, and syrup until combined. Let mixture sit 10 minutes, stirring every 2-3 minutes to break up any clumps. Cover bowl and refrigerate for a minimum of two hours, or overnight.Remove pudding from fridge, divide between two small bowls or jars, and garnish as desired.

title: Mango Melba Shortcake
directions:
In a small sauce pan, over low heat, heat the jam until syrupy. Fold in mango chunks and remove from heat.
Split biscuits in half, spread whipped cream on the bottom half and fill with mango mixture.
Top with a scoop of ice cream.In a small sauce pan, over low heat, heat the jam until syrupy. Fold in mango chunks and remove from heat.Split biscuits in half, spread whipped cream on the bottom half and fill with mango mixture.Top with a scoop of ice cream.

title: Edamame Energy Bowl
directions: In a large bowl, combine salad ingredients and set aside. In a separate bowl combine dressing ingredients. Drizzle dressing into salad and enjoy. If preferred chilled, refrigerate an extra 20 minutes before serving.In a large bowl, combine salad ingredients and set aside. In a separate bowl combine dressing ingredients. Drizzle dressing into salad and enjoy. If preferred chilled, refrigerate an extra 20 minutes before serving.

title: Delicata Squash Pasta Salad
directions:
Preheat oven to 400°F. Slice squash 3/4 inches thick and toss with olive oil, salt and pepper. Arrange on a large baking sheet and roast for 30-35 minutes until fork tender, tossing halfway through cooking.
While squash cooks, prepare pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta and rinse under cold water to halt the cooking process. Divide baby lettuce among four plates and top with pasta. Top each salad with crumbled feta and pomegranate seeds. Drizzle vinaigrette atop each salad and serve immediately, with more dressing on the side.Preheat oven to 400°F. Drizzle vinaigrette atop each salad and serve immediately, with more dressing on the side.
ingredients: 2 TJ's Delicata Squash, halved lenghtwise and de-seeded (or substitute 3 cups of your favorite peeled & cubed squash)
1 package TJ's Organic Brown Rice & Quinoa Fusilli Pasta

directions:
Heat grill to medium-high. Thread 4 or 5 chicken pieces onto each skewer.
Grill chicken until it begins to brown, flipping often, about 5-7 minutes. During the final stages of cooking, continually baste chicken with Sriracha BBQ sauce, about 3-5 minutes. Remove from grill when internal temperature of chicken reaches 165°F. Garnish with cilantro and serve.Heat grill to medium-high. During the final stages of cooking, continually baste chicken with Sriracha BBQ sauce, about 3-5 minutes. title: Yogurt Crunch Waffle
Roasted Squash Salad
directions:
Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a sheet pan with parchment paper and spray lightly with canola oil spray.
Using a sharp knife, remove top of pumpkin and cut pumpkin in half lengthwise. Then use a sharp spoon or ice cream scoop to scrape out all of the seeds and strings.
Brush the pumpkin flesh with melted butter and cover in brown sugar.
Place pumpkin flesh-side down on the lined baking pan and pierce a few times with a fork.
Bake for 30-35 minutes or until a fork easily pierces the skin. Remove from oven and let cool slightly.
Using your ice cream scoop or spoon, scoop pumpkin flesh from the skin and place it into a bowl. Lightly mash.
Place arugula in a medium bowl and place cooked pumpkin on top. Add cheese (hand-tear the log into smaller pieces as desired, add pumpkin seeds, and drizzle with olive oil. Enjoy immediately.Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a sheet pan with parchment paper and spray lightly with canola oil spray.Using a sharp knife, remove top of pumpkin and cut pumpkin in half lengthwise. Remove from oven and let cool slightly.Using your ice cream scoop or spoon, scoop pumpkin flesh from the skin and place it into a bowl. Lightly mash.Place arugula in a medium bowl and place cooked pumpkin on top. Add cheese (hand-tear the log into smaller pieces as desired, add pumpkin seeds, and drizzle with olive oil. Enjoy immediately.
ingredients: TJ's Pumpkin Pie Pumpkin (seasonal) or your favorite TJ's squash
1 whole TJ's Chevre Goat Cheese Log (5 oz.)

TJ's Canola Oil Spray (to grease sheet pan)

title: Corny Squash Soup
directions: Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add shallots and squash and sauté for 5-8 minutes. Add soup, corn and greens to pan and bring to a low boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until greens are wilted and squash is fork-tender. Add salt and pepper to soup and stir to combine. Spoon soup into bowls and serve with fresh, crusty bread for dipping.Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add shallots and squash and sauté for 5-8 minutes. Add soup, corn and greens to pan and bring to a low boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until greens are wilted and squash is fork-tender. Add salt and pepper to soup and stir to combine. Spoon soup into bowls and serve with fresh, crusty bread for dipping.

Preheat oven to 400°F. Prepare mashed potatoes according to package instructions, set aside.
In a skillet, sauté onions and ground turkey seasoned with garlic powder and salt in olive oil until turkey begins to brown. Layer the bottom of an 8-inch square casserole dish with cooked turkey, set aside.
Add corn to a food processor and pulse until somewhat creamy, with some chunks of corn remaining. Place pureed corn over turkey. Top with mashed potatoes.
Bake on center rack of oven for approximately 25 minutes, or until the potatoes begin to brown around the edges. Remove from oven and let cool slightly before serving.Preheat oven to 400°F. Layer the bottom of an 8-inch square casserole dish with cooked turkey, set aside.Add corn to a food processor and pulse until somewhat creamy, with some chunks of corn remaining. Place pureed corn over turkey. Top with mashed potatoes.Bake on center rack of oven for approximately 25 minutes, or until the potatoes begin to brown around the edges. Remove from oven and let cool slightly before serving.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon TJ's Extra Virgin Olive Oil
1/4 cup TJ's Organic Sweet Onion, diced
1/2 teaspoon TJ's Spices of the World, Garlic Powder
title: Shepherd's Pie
Strawberry Lemon Muffins
directions:
Preheat oven to 375°F. Line a muffin tin with 10 muffin liners, or grease slots with coconut oil and set aside.
In a medium bowl, mix together 1 cup almond meal, 2 tablespoons almond flour, 1 teaspoon baking powder and 1/8 teaspoon salt. Set aside.
In a separate medium bowl, combine lemon zest, lemon juice, ¼ cup melted coconut oil, 2 tablespoons maple syrup and 4 beaten eggs. Add the dry ingredients to wet ingredients and stir until just combined. Fold in 1 cup of diced strawberries. Do not over mix.
Add ¼ cup spoonfuls of the batter to 10 muffin slots. Bake 17 minutes or until an inserted toothpick comes out clean.
To make glaze: in a small saucepan, combine ½ cup water, ½ cup sugar and the zest and juice from 1 lemon. Heat to a rapid boil until glaze thickens and coats the back of a spoon, about 10-15 minutes.
Remove muffins from oven and let cool. Drizzle glaze atop muffins and enjoy!Preheat oven to 375°F. Heat to a rapid boil until glaze thickens and coats the back of a spoon, about 10-15 minutes.Remove muffins from oven and let cool. Drizzle glaze atop muffins and enjoy!
ingredients: Zest and juice from 2 large TJ's Lemons
1/4 cup TJ's Organic Virgin Coconut Oil, melted (microwave for 30 seconds)
Zest and juice from 1 large TJ's Lemon
1 package (17.6 oz.) Gnocchi, cooked and drained

title: Gnocchi with Bacon & Brussels Sprouts
directions: Heat olive oil in a large pan on medium heat, then sauté diced bacon, onions and Brussels Sprouts until onions turn translucent and Brussels Sprouts start to caramelize. Add garlic and stir occasionally for another two minutes. Meanwhile, add cheese, milk, butter, flour & nutmeg to the pot with the cooked gnocchi and heat on medium-low until the cheese melts. Then fold bacon-veggie sauté mixture into the pasta. Enjoy!Heat olive oil in a large pan on medium heat, then sauté diced bacon, onions and Brussels Sprouts until onions turn translucent and Brussels Sprouts start to caramelize. Add garlic and stir occasionally for another two minutes. Meanwhile, add cheese, milk, butter, flour & nutmeg to the pot with the cooked gnocchi and heat on medium-low until the cheese melts. Then fold bacon-veggie sauté mixture into the pasta. Enjoy!

ingredients: 3/4 cup TJ's Shredded Monterey Jack Cheese
1 cup TJ's Fancy Shredded Mexican Blend Cheese, divided
title: Kickin' Corn Dip
directions:
Preheat oven to 375°F. Grease a 2-quart baking dish with cooking spray, set aside.
Add cream cheese to a medium size, microwave safe bowl. Microwave on half power for 1 minute intervals, whipping with a fork in between, until warm and smooth. Add cowboy caviar, Monterey Jack cheese and 3/4 cup fancy shredded Mexican blend and stir to combine. Scrape mixture into prepared baking dish and top with remaining cheese and roasted corn.
Place dish on center rack of oven and bake 30 minutes, until well browned and bubbling. Cool slightly before digging in with your edible scoop of choice (chips, crudités Cornbread Crisps...).Preheat oven to 375°F. ingredients: 1 bag TJ's Organic White Corn Tortilla Chips

1 package TJ's Pulled Pork in Smokey BBQ Sauce
1 Tbsp. TJ's Extra Virgin Olive Oil (any variety will do)

TJ's Green Dragon Sauce to taste
directions:
Combine butter and oil in a frying pan and over medium heat. Once butter is melted, add diced onions and heat for approximately 10 minutes or until onions are golden brown, stirring occasionally. While onions are caramelizing, prepare pulled pork in microwave according to package instructions, then prepare mac n' cheese in microwave according to package instructions. Arrange about 3/4 bag of chips onto a large platter. Spoon the mac n' cheese onto chips, then pile the pulled pork atop the mac n' cheese. Top with your caramelized onions and as much or as little Green Dragon Sauce as your heart desires! Feel free to add the remainin1/4 bag of chips to the pile as nachos are consumed.

Coconut Caramel Sauce
directions: Pour the sugar and water into a large sauce pan or pot and heat to medium. Stir constantly until sugar bubbles and melts completely. Stir in coconut cream, milk, salt, and vanilla and heat to a rolling boil. Keep stirring constantly for about 10 to 15 minutes, until mixture reaches desired thickness and turns dark in color. Serve warm. Makes about 1/2 cup, serve 1 tablespoon per person.Pour the sugar and water into a large sauce pan or pot and heat to medium. Stir constantly until sugar bubbles and melts completely. Stir in coconut cream, milk, salt, and vanilla and heat to a rolling boil. Keep stirring constantly for about 10 to 15 minutes, until mixture reaches desired thickness and turns dark in color. Serve warm. Makes about 1/2 cup, serve 1 tablespoon per person.

title: Refreshing Raspberry Lemonade
directions: Pour lemonade into serving pitcher and add frozen raspberries. Stir occasionally, allowing raspberries to defrost in lemonade for about 5 minutes. Pour into glasses and garnish with a lemon slice.Pour lemonade into serving pitcher and add frozen raspberries. Stir occasionally, allowing raspberries to defrost in lemonade for about 5 minutes. Pour into glasses and garnish with a lemon slice.

ingredients: 1/2 cup (1 stick) TJ's Unsalted Butter, melted
3 Tablespoons TJ's Aioli Garlic Mustard Sauce
2 Tablespoons coarsely chopped fresh TJ's Rosemary
1/4 cup TJ's Japanese Style Panko Breadcrumbs
1/4 cup finely chopped TJ's Sweet and Spicy Pecans
4 teaspoons chopped TJ's Parsley, plus more for garnish
TJ's Fresh Salmon Boneless Skinless Fillets (2 large fillets)
directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.
2. In a small bowl, stir together melted butter, mustard, and honey.
3. Cut potatoes into eighths and coat with ½ cup of the honey mustard mixture, set the rest of the mixture aside. Sprinkle rosemary over potatoes.
4. Grease a baking sheet with canola oil spray then spread coated potatoes in an even layer, leaving room to add the salmon filets later. Begin baking potatoes for 20 minutes.
5. Meanwhile, in another small bowl, mix together panko crumbs, pecans, and parsley, then set aside.
6. Place salmon filets skin-side down on a plate. Season with salt and pepper then brush generously with reserved honey mustard mixture. Sprinkle the tops of the fillets with the panko crumb mixture.
7. After 20 minutes, remove tray of potatoes from oven then add salmon filets, skin side down on the tray next to the potatoes. Bake salmon and potatoes for an additional 10 to 15 minutes, or until salmon flakes easily with a fork. Serve with a wedge of lemon and garnish with extra parsley.1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F.2. title: Sweet & Spicy Pecan-Crusted Salmon

ingredients: 2 packages TJ's Ground Buffalo Burgers, thawed according to package directions
title: Buffalo Fig Burger
directions:
Preheat a grill to medium-high. Season burgers with salt and pepper. Grill burgers according to package directions; remove from heat and let rest 5 minutes.
To assemble, place a burger on the bottom half of a bun. Top with goat cheese crumbles, tomato, arugula and onion. Generously slather fig butter on top half of bun and place on burger. Repeat with remaining ingredients and serve immediately.Preheat a grill to medium-high. Season burgers with salt and pepper. title: Seriously Stuffed Twice-Baked Potatoes
directions: Position rack in top third of oven and preheat to 425ºF. Pierce each potato several times with a knife. Pre-cook potatoes in the microwave on high for about 7 minutes or until they give when pressed. Remove from microwave, place into oven and bake directly on rack until tender, about 30 minutes. When cool enough to handle, transfer potatoes to a work surface and cut off the top (about 1/4-inch lengthwise) of each potato. Scoop center of potato from skins into large bowl, leaving about 1/4-inch of potato lining the skin. Mash with milk; season with salt and pepper, to taste. Mix in corn salsa, chips, half of the cheese, half of the cilantro and half of the onions. Fill each of the skins with the potato mixture, mounding it in the center. Top with remainder of cheese. Return to oven and bake until heated through, about 20 minutes. Garnish finished potatoes with sour cream, remainder of green onions and cilantro.Position rack in top third of oven and preheat to 425ºF. Pierce each potato several times with a knife. Pre-cook potatoes in the microwave on high for about 7 minutes or until they give when pressed. Remove from microwave, place into oven and bake directly on rack until tender, about 30 minutes. When cool enough to handle, transfer potatoes to a work surface and cut off the top (about 1/4-inch lengthwise) of each potato. Scoop center of potato from skins into large bowl, leaving about 1/4-inch of potato lining the skin. Mash with milk; season with salt and pepper, to taste. Mix in corn salsa, chips, half of the cheese, half of the cilantro and half of the onions. Fill each of the skins with the potato mixture, mounding it in the center. Top with remainder of cheese. Return to oven and bake until heated through, about 20 minutes. Garnish finished potatoes with sour cream, remainder of green onions and cilantro.

1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste
1 jar TJ's Corn and Chile Tomato-Less Salsa

1 cup TJ's Nacho Cheese Tortilla Chips, crushed

directions: In a medium bowl, mix mac n' cheese and salsa. Top with a sprinkle of cheese and sour cream for added flair (optional, but delicious).In a medium bowl, mix mac n' cheese and salsa. Top with a sprinkle of cheese and sour cream for added flair (optional, but delicious).
ingredients: 1 package TJ's Joe's Diner Mac n' Cheese or TJ's Gluten Free Mac & Cheese, cooked according to package instructions
3 pinches TJ's Mexican Shredded Cheese Blend (optional)
title: Queso Sonrisas, Ole'! Ole'! (Cheese Smiles, Hooray! Hooray!)

directions:
Remove lid from fig butter. Microwave on half power for 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until warm. Set aside.
Toast bagels per your preference. Top each half with cream cheese, spreading to cover bagel. Drizzle with warm fig butter. Top with diced apricot and walnuts, followed by a generous drizzle of honey. Enjoy immediately.Remove lid from fig butter. Microwave on half power for 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until warm. Set aside.Toast bagels per your preference. Top each half with cream cheese, spreading to cover bagel. Drizzle with warm fig butter. Top with diced apricot and walnuts, followed by a generous drizzle of honey. Enjoy immediately.
ingredients: 2 TJ's Plain Bagels, sliced in half
1 package TJ's Cream Cheese, quartered and softened
title: Fig Butter Cream Cheese Bagel

directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8X8-inch baking pan with canola oil spray, set aside. Using a pair of clean kitchen scissors, cut marshmallows into quarters, set aside.
In a large mixing bowl, slowly whisk melted butter into egg. Gently fold in blondie bar mix just until combined, followed by marshmallows and chocolate. Spread blondie mixture evenly into greased pan.
Place pan on center rack of oven and bake until blondies are deep golden brown, about 30-33 minutes. (Marshmallows will puff up—don't fret! They'll sink back down as they cool.) Remove pan from oven and let cool completely on a wire rack prior to slicing and serving.Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8X8-inch baking pan with canola oil spray, set aside. title: Marshmallow Blondies
ingredients: 1 box TJ's Blondie Bar Baking Mix
2-1.75 oz bars TJ's Milk Chocolate, roughly chopped

title: Blueberry Corn Cake
directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8-inch square baking pan, set aside.
In a large bowl, whisk sour cream, oil, milk and egg until smooth. Add cornbread mix and stir gently to combine; do not overmix.
Add 1/2 cup frozen blueberries to prepared baking pan. Scrape cornbread batter atop blueberries, spreading batter evenly to sides of pan. Cover surface of batter with remaining blueberries.
Place baking pan on center rack of oven and bake 40-45 minutes, until cake is golden and edges pull away from sides of pan. Remove from oven and let cool 15 minutes before slicing.Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease an 8-inch square baking pan, set aside.In a large bowl, whisk sour cream, oil, milk and egg until smooth. Add cornbread mix and stir gently to combine; do not overmix.Add 1/2 cup frozen blueberries to prepared baking pan. Scrape cornbread batter atop blueberries, spreading batter evenly to sides of pan. Cover surface of batter with remaining blueberries.Place baking pan on center rack of oven and bake 40-45 minutes, until cake is golden and edges pull away from sides of pan. Remove from oven and let cool 15 minutes before slicing.
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups TJ's Frozen Wild Boreal Blueberries, divided
4 TJ's Ciabatta Rolls, sliced, OR 8 slices of your favorite TJ's Bread
TJ's Triple Cream Brie OR Fromage Pavé, thinly sliced
TJ's No Sugar Dry Rubbed Uncured Bacon, cooked according to package directions
title: BABP (Bacon, Apple & Brie Panini)
directions:
Heat grill pan or Panini press to medium-high. Butter one side of each slice of bread or the outsides of two panini roll pieces. If including, spread mustard on the unbuttered side of one slice of bread or roll.
Place brie slices in a single layer on the un-buttered side of both pieces of bread or roll. Place thinly sliced apple on one piece of bread atop brie. Top with as much bacon as you deem necessary. Put the two sides of the roll together and place into a panini press or in a grill pan and press down. Grill until lightly browned on both sides. Serve at once.Heat grill pan or Panini press to medium-high. Butter one side of each slice of bread or the outsides of two panini roll pieces. If including, spread mustard on the unbuttered side of one slice of bread or roll.Place brie slices in a single layer on the un-buttered side of both pieces of bread or roll. Place thinly sliced apple on one piece of bread atop brie. Top with as much bacon as you deem necessary. Put the two sides of the roll together and place into a panini press or in a grill pan and press down. Grill until lightly browned on both sides. Serve at once.

ingredients: 1/2 cup TJ's Limeade (or TJ's Organic Jalapeño Limeade, if you enjoy a kick!)
3/4 cup (4 shots) TJ's Reposado Distinqt Tequila (optional)
2 cups TJ's Organic Frozen Mango Chunks
title: Mango Limeadita
directions: Begin by rimming the glasses: Add salt to a small plate, then squeeze the juice of 1 lime onto a separate plate. Dip the rim of the drinking glasses into the lime juice, then dip into the salt. Set aside. Then, in a blender, add the juice from 4 Limes with the Orange Juice, Mango Chunks, Limeade and the Agave Sweetener. Pulse several times until liquefied, then add the Ice and pulse again. Pour into salt-rimmed glasses and garnish with lime slices.Begin by rimming the glasses: Add salt to a small plate, then squeeze the juice of 1 lime onto a separate plate. Dip the rim of the drinking glasses into the lime juice, then dip into the salt. Set aside. Then, in a blender, add the juice from 4 Limes with the Orange Juice, Mango Chunks, Limeade and the Agave Sweetener. Pulse several times until liquefied, then add the Ice and pulse again. Pour into salt-rimmed glasses and garnish with lime slices.

Bring a large pot of water to boil, adding salt, if desired. Add 2 cups of pasta and cook uncovered, stirring occasionally for about 7-10 minutes or until al dente. Do not overcook. Remove pasta and drain thoroughly. Set aside.
Heat a large pan over medium heat. Add 1 1/2 tablespoons of clarified butter and heat another minute or so until it starts to shimmer. Add  1 1/2 cups of sliced asparagus, stirring until all sides are coated with clarified butter. Let cook without stirring for 2-3 more minutes until asparagus edges begin to turn golden. Add 1 1/2 cups of grape tomatoes and continue stirring until tomatoes are heated through, about 2-3 minutes. Add as much cooked pasta as desired to the pan, then mix in 1/2 cup fresh sliced basil, the juice of 1/2 a lemon and 1/2 cup of pine nuts. Keep stirring until ingredients are well incorporated, about 1-2 minutes. At this point, add up to 1 tablespoon more clarified butter if desired. Stir. Divide the pasta among two plates and top with shaved cheese blend. Enjoy!Bring a large pot of water to boil, adding salt, if desired. Divide the pasta among two plates and top with shaved cheese blend. Enjoy!
title: Fusilli Garden Pasta
ingredients: 2 cups TJ's Gluten Free Organic Brown Rice & Quinoa Fusilli Pasta
1 1/2 Tablespoons of TJ's Clarified Butter (Ghee), or more
1 1/2 cups trimmed and cut TJ's Asparagus (sliced into thirds)
1 1/2 cups TJ's Mini Pearl Grape Tomatoes
1/2 cup fresh sliced TJ's Basil (sliced into thin strips)
1/2 cup TJ's Dry Toasted Pignolias (Pine Nuts)
1 package TJ's Pork Carnitas, heated to package directions (substitute: cooked ground beef)
6 TJ's Green Onions, sliced, green tops preserved for garnish
1 package TJ's Corn Tortillas, cut into strips
1 package TJ's Mexican Shredded Cheese Blend
title: W.O.W. Enchilada Casserole
directions: Pre-heat the oven to 450°. Swab bottom of a baking dish (appx. 8" x8") with olive oil & a small amount of enchilada sauce; set aside. In a bowl, mix carnitas, green onions, jalapeños and 3 tbsp of sliced olives together with a small amount of enchilada sauce. Cover bottom of dish with a layer of tortilla strips. Top with half of carnitas mixture, followed by a small amount of sauce and about one-fourth of the cheese. Repeat second layer in the same order. Top second layer with strips of tortillas, remainder of sauce and remainder of cheese. Garnish with remainder of olives and green onion tops. Place in oven and bake until cheese is melted, the edges are browned and sauce is bubbly; about 20-30 minutes. Remove from oven and sit for 10 minutes before cutting. Top with slices of Avocado. WOW! Enjoy.

ingredients: 1 can TJ's Tuna in Olive Oil, drained
title: Tuna Salad Pita
directions: In a medium bowl, combine tuna, onion, cornichons and mayonnaise. Cut each pita in half lengthwise creating a total of four pita pockets.  Stuff pita pockets with lettuce and tuna salad.

In a bowl, with attitude, combine ground beef with 21 Seasoning Salute.
Separate beef into 8 portions, like you mean business, then form each into a patty.
With enthusiasm, mix cheddar, bacon and sriracha BBQ sauce together in a separate bowl to form the stuffing.
Spoon the stuffing evenly in the center of 4 of the patties. Top each patty with another patty and press down on the edges with your fingertips.
Grill burgers over medium-high heat, flipping once until desired doneness is reached, approximately 4 minutes each side for medium. Or in a medium skillet over medium-high heat, sear burgers 4 minutes on each side.
To make the sauce, combine mayo, garlic and mustard. Serve burgers with "sauce." ENJOY! You Sassy Thing, YOU!

ingredients: 1 pound TJ's Organic Ground Beef or Grass Fed Angus Ground Beef
1/3 cup finely shredded TJ's Cheddar with Caramelized Onions
4 slices TJ's Fully Cooked Uncured Bacon, chopped
1 Tablespoon TJ's Sriracha & Roasted Garlic BBQ Sauce
1 teaspoon TJ's Dijon Mustard with White Wine
title: Sassy Stuffed Sliders

ingredients: 1 package TJ's Globe Artichokes (4 count - Seasonal)
1 package TJ's Premium Peeled Garlic Cloves
2 Tbsp TJ's Extra Virgin California Estate Olive Oil
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste
1 batch TJ's Smoked Aioli (optional), for dipping
directions:
Preheat oven to 425°F. Trim half an inch off the top of each artichoke, and cut in half lengthwise, being mindful of the spines. Using a sharp pairing knife, cut out the non-edible purple leaves and the hairy fibers in the center, forming a pocket.
Working in batches, place artichokes, leaf-side down, in a shallow bowl and squeeze half a lemon over the outside and inside of each artichoke, then place one or two garlic cloves in the center pocket. Drizzle the inside of each with half a tablespoon of olive oil and sprinkle liberally with salt and pepper. Tightly wrap each artichoke half in large, individual foil pieces.
Arrange foil-wrapped artichokes in a large baking dish. Bake for 45 minutes until tender. Once cool enough to handle, being mindful of the steam, remove artichokes from foil. Serve immediately with smoked aioli for dipping.Preheat oven to 425°F. Trim half an inch off the top of each artichoke, and cut in half lengthwise, being mindful of the spines. title: Roasted Lemon-Garlic Artichokes

directions: Divide turkey cranberry apple salad among three slices of bread. Top each with romaine and another slice of bread. Enjoy!Divide turkey cranberry apple salad among three slices of bread. Top each with romaine and another slice of bread. Enjoy!

6 slices of your favorite TJ's Multigrain Bread (toasted or untoasted, your call)

title: Turkey Salad Sandwich
Blarney Toast
directions:
Using a large serrated knife, gently slice the scone into 6 thick slices; set aside. Pour enough sunflower oil to create a thin layer in the bottom of a skillet and heat over medium-high.
When oil is hot, add two scone slices to the pan and fry 30-40 seconds per side, until browned. Transfer to a plate and repeat with remaining slices, adding more oil as necessary to coat the bottom of the pan.
Generously slather scone slices with butter and marmalade, and enjoy immediately.Using a large serrated knife, gently slice the scone into 6 thick slices; set aside. ingredients: 1 package (1 pound) TJ's All Natural No Antibiotics Ever Ground Pork
TJ's Organic Extra Virgin Olive Oil Spray, to grease pan
directions:
In a large skillet over medium-high heat, brown the ground pork, breaking it up into pieces with a spoon as it cooks, about 8-10 minutes. When the pork has reached 145ºF and is no longer pink, reduce heat to medium. Sprinkle half of the flour over pork and stir to combine. Add remaining flour and stir to combine. Add one cup of milk to the pan and stir. Continue to add milk one cup at a time as gravy thickens. Cook for another 5-8 minutes to further thicken the gravy.
Preheat oven to 350ºF. Grease a 9x13 pan with olive oil spray and set aside. In a large bowl, add eggs and 21 Seasoning Salute and whisk to combine; set aside. Open the biscuits and tear each biscuit into four pieces. Line the bottom of the greased pan with half of the biscuit dough. Pour egg mixture on top of biscuit dough. Sprinkle cheese evenly atop egg mixture. Pour sausage gravy over egg mixture and top with remaining biscuit dough pieces.
Insert pan in oven and bake for 20 minutes. Cover pan with foil and bake for another 12-15 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool slightly before serving.In a large skillet over medium-high heat, brown the ground pork, breaking it up into pieces with a spoon as it cooks, about 8-10 minutes. When the pork has reached 145ºF and is no longer pink, reduce heat to medium. Sprinkle half of the flour over pork and stir to combine. Add remaining flour and stir to combine. Pour sausage gravy over egg mixture and top with remaining biscuit dough pieces.Insert pan in oven and bake for 20 minutes. Cover pan with foil and bake for another 12-15 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool slightly before serving.
title: Biscuits & Gravy Casserole

directions:
Add oil to a grill pan or skillet and turn heat to medium-high. Cook turkey burgers according to package directions; remove from heat.
In a medium bowl, toss salad with included toppings and dressing. To assemble, place turkey burger on bottom half of bun. Top with slaw and top half of bun, and serve with sweet potato chips.Add oil to a grill pan or skillet and turn heat to medium-high. ingredients: 1 package TJ's Broccoli Kale Slaw Complete Salad Kit
TJ's Ridge Cut Sweet Potato Chips (optional)

directions: Place one tea bag in a mug and set aside. Pour the juice blend in a small saucepan. Place saucepan on stove and heat over medium-high, just until boiling. Pour into mug and allow tea bag to steep for 3-5 minutes. Remove tea bag, allow to cool slightly and serve.Place one tea bag in a mug and set aside. Pour the juice blend in a small saucepan. Place saucepan on stove and heat over medium-high, just until boiling. Pour into mug and allow tea bag to steep for 3-5 minutes. Remove tea bag, allow to cool slightly and serve.
title: Spiced Harvest Tea
ingredients: 8 ounces TJ's Lemon Ginger Echinacea Juice Blend
1 bag TJ's Harvest Blend Herbal Tea (seasonal)
TJ's Roasted Red Peppers, drained and chopped
directions:
In a large bowl, combine falafel mix and water. Cover and let sit 1 hour. Stir in 1 tablespoon sunflower oil.
Preheat waffle iron. Scoop 1/3 of the batter onto the center of the waffle iron and spread evenly with a spatula toward the edges. Close waffle iron and cook 12 minutes, until golden brown. Remove waffle from iron and repeat process two more times (you'll end up with three large waffles).
To serve, garnish waffles with chopped peppers and parsley, a drizzle of tahini and a squeeze of lemon.In a large bowl, combine falafel mix and water. Cover and let sit 1 hour. Stir in 1 tablespoon sunflower oil.Preheat waffle iron. Scoop 1/3 of the batter onto the center of the waffle iron and spread evenly with a spatula toward the edges. Quick Colcannon
ingredients: 6 slices TJ's Uncured Apple Smoked Bacon
directions: In a large frying pan on medium heat, cook 6 slices of bacon. Set cooked bacon aside on a paper towel-lined plate. Discard all but 1 tablespoon of oil from the pan. Add bag of frozen mashed potato medallions and 1/3 cup of water. Cook over moderate heat, stirring frequently. After about 5 minutes, once potatoes begin to soften, add 1/2 bag cruciferous crunch and 2 additional tablespoons of water. Stir then cover to trap steam. Cook for another 2-3 minutes or so, stirring every so often, until greens soften a bit. Chop cooled bacon into small pieces then add to pan of potatoes. Serve right away with a pat of butter on top.In a large frying pan on medium heat, cook 6 slices of bacon. Set cooked bacon aside on a paper towel-lined plate. After about 5 minutes, once potatoes begin to soften, add 1/2 bag cruciferous crunch and 2 additional tablespoons of water. Stir then cover to trap steam. Cook for another 2-3 minutes or so, stirring every so often, until greens soften a bit. Chop cooled bacon into small pieces then add to pan of potatoes. Serve right away with a pat of butter on top.

ingredients: 1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste
directions:
Pour 1 tablespoon olive oil in a heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Add the peppers and sauté about 3-5 minutes, turning occasionally until they blister on all sides. Remove peppers from heat and slice off the stems and discard. Combine shishito peppers, 2 tablespoons olive oil, 2 tablespoons lime juice, 2 tablespoons greek yogurt, 2 garlic cloves and salt and pepper in a blender. Pulse until desired consistency. Taste and adjust seasoning as desired. Makes about 1/2 cup of sauce.
Serving ideas: Dress a Southwestern salad (butter lettuce, corn, beans, tomatoes, red onion and tortilla chips), drizzle over shrimp tacos, or spread on a BLT sandwichPour 1 tablespoon olive oil in a heavy skillet over medium-high heat. directions:
Rinse quinoa thoroughly in cold water & drain. Place rinsed quinoa in a medium pot with 2 cups of water and bring to a boil. Reduce to a simmer, cover, and cook for about 15 minutes, or until all water is absorbed. Remove from heat and set aside.
Heat olive oil in a large pot, add onions, and sauté for about 5 minutes, or until they began to soften. Add quinoa, tomato sauce, tomatoes, beans, chili seasoning and salt and mix until well combined.
Let simmer uncovered for about 25 minutes. Remove from heat and let rest for 5 minutes.
Serve warm and enjoy!Rinse quinoa thoroughly in cold water & drain. Place rinsed quinoa in a medium pot with 2 cups of water and bring to a boil. ingredients: 1 can TJ's Organic Diced & Fire Roasted Tomatoes with Organic Green Chiles
1 can TJ's Organic Kidney Beans, drained
2 tablespoons TJ's Organic Chili Seasoning Blend

directions:
Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper or spray with cooking spray; set aside. Combine yogurt and harissa in a small bowl, cover and refrigerate.
In a large bowl, combine falafel mix, flour, sugar, and baking powder in a large bowl. Cut the butter into the dry ingredients until crumbly, leaving pea sized chunks of butter. Set aside.
In a medium bowl, lightly beat the eggs and heavy cream. Make a well in the center of dry mixture and add egg mixture. Fold gently with a spatula, until just combined. Gently stir in sundried tomatoes, if using.
Divide dough in half. Stretch dough into a circle, about 6 inches in diameter and 1/2 inch thick, and place it on the prepared baking sheet. Repeat with remaining dough. Cut each circle into six triangles, and top with sliced red bell pepper, if using.
Place baking sheet on center rack of oven and bake 15-17 minutes until golden. Remove from oven and transfer scones to a wire rack to cool. Wait 5 minutes, then serve with harissa yogurt for drizzling.Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a large baking sheet with parchment paper or spray with cooking spray; set aside.
