Remove from oven and transfer scones to a wire rack to cool. Wait 5 minutes, then serve with harissa yogurt for drizzling.
ingredients: 1 cup TJ's Plain Whole Milk Greek Yogurt
2 heaping teaspoons TJ's Traditional Tunisian Harissa (or more to taste)
1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon TJ's Baking Powder
1/2 cup (1 stick) TJ's Unsalted Butter, cold, cut into small chunks
1/2 cup TJ's Sundried Tomatoes in Olive Oil, roughly chopped OR 1/2 TJ's Roasted Red Bell Pepper, drained and thinly sliced
title: Falafel Scones with Harissa Yogurt

ingredients: ½ TJ's Jumbo Yellow Onion, diced
2 medium TJ's Sweet Potatoes, peeled and cubed
½ bag TJ's Organic Tuscan Kale
6 cups TJ's Low Sodium Vegetable Broth
directions:
In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion and sweet potato and sauté 5 minutes. Add couscous and sauté 5 minutes to toast. Add 2 tablespoons water to pot, cover and cook 3 minutes.
Remove lid and add vegetable broth and taco seasoning. Reduce heat and simmer until sweet potatoes are fork-tender, 25-30 minutes. Add kale and simmer 5 minutes more until wilted. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Ladle soup into large bowls and serve with crusty bread for dipping.In a large pot, heat oil over medium heat. Add onion and sweet potato and sauté 5 minutes. Add couscous and sauté 5 minutes to toast. Add 2 tablespoons water to pot, cover and cook 3 minutes.Remove lid and add vegetable broth and taco seasoning. Reduce heat and simmer until sweet potatoes are fork-tender, 25-30 minutes. Add kale and simmer 5 minutes more until wilted. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Ladle soup into large bowls and serve with crusty bread for dipping.
title: Sam's Sweet Potato Soup

ingredients: 1 tub (16 ounces) TJ's Organic Sour Cream
1/2 jar TJ's Everything but the Bagel Sesame Seasoning Blend
directions: Spoon sour cream into a serving bowl. Fold in seasoning and stir until well mixed. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Garnish with chopped chives, if desired. Serve with potato chips, carrot sticks, pita chips, celery sticks, bell peppers, pretzel slims, cucumbers...Spoon sour cream into a serving bowl. Fold in seasoning and stir until well mixed. Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Garnish with chopped chives, if desired. Serve with potato chips, carrot sticks, pita chips, celery sticks, bell peppers, pretzel slims, cucumbers...
title: Everything but the Bagel Dip
Quinoa Veggie Burgers with Avocado Tzatziki
directions:
Preheat oven to 450°F. Remove burgers from packaging and place on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake 5 minutes or until browned. Carefully flip and continue to bake an additional 5 minutes, or until heated through and well browned. Remove from oven and let cool slightly.
Place burger patty on bottom of hamburger bun. Top with a generous swipe of Avocado Tzatziki dip, followed by sliced red onion and cilantro. Top with hamburger bun and serve immediately.Preheat oven to 450°F. Remove burgers from packaging and place on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake 5 minutes or until browned. Carefully flip and continue to bake an additional 5 minutes, or until heated through and well browned. Remove from oven and let cool slightly.Place burger patty on bottom of hamburger bun. Top with a generous swipe of Avocado Tzatziki dip, followed by sliced red onion and cilantro. Top with hamburger bun and serve immediately.
ingredients: 1 package TJ's Quinoa Cowboy Veggie Burgers
½ TJ”s Red Onion, very thinly sliced

title: Tahini Salad Dressing
directions: Add all ingredients to a small bowl and whisk vigorously until well incorporated. Taste and adjust seasoning as necessary. Drizzle with abandon and enjoy!Add all ingredients to a small bowl and whisk vigorously until well incorporated. Taste and adjust seasoning as necessary. Drizzle with abandon and enjoy!
ingredients: 1/4 cup water; 2 teaspoons TJ's Minced Garlic
1/8 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste

directions: Place a parchment-lined baking sheet in the freezer. To assemble sandwiches, place a scoop of ice cream atop the flat side of one cookie. Top with another cookie and press down very gently (cookies are fragile!) to create a sandwich. If desired, smooth sandwich “edges” with a butter knife. Place sandwich on baking sheet inside freezer. Repeat with remaining ingredients. Let sandwiches set in freezer 30 minutes prior to serving.Place a parchment-lined baking sheet in the freezer. title: Fudge Chip Ice Cream Sandwiches
ingredients: 1 package TJ's Gluten Free Crispy Crunchy Chocolate Chip Cookies (14 cookies)
1 quart TJ's Organic Vanilla Fudge Chip Ice Cream

title: Grandmommy's Gravy
ingredients: 1 Turkey Neck, from TJ's Fresh Whole Turkey of your choice (if you choose to omit turkey neck, increase measurement of TJ's Turkey Stock to 3 Cups, and increase simmering time to thicken the gravy)
½ cup (one stick) TJ's Unsalted Butter
½ cup Baker Josef's All-Purpose Flour
2 tablespoons pan drippings from cooked turkey (optional)
directions:
Place the turkey neck in a medium pot with 2 1/2 Cups of water. Cover and bring to a boil. Remove lid, reduce heat to low and simmer for 20-25 minutes, until meat can be pulled from turkey neck with forks. Turn off heat, set shredded turkey meat and stock aside, and discard turkey neck.
While turkey neck stock simmers, heat olive oil in a large sauté pan over medium heat. Add Mirepoix to pan and sauté for 20 minutes or until browned, stirring occasionally. Turn off heat and set aside.
For the roux: In a wide sauce pan, melt the unsalted butter over medium heat. Add flour and whisk vigorously until flour is fully incorporated with butter, being careful not to burn the mixture. Roux will darken slightly to a light caramel color.
Measure 2 cups of the turkey neck stock from pot and slowly incorporate into the roux, whisking constantly. Repeat the process with 1 cup TJ's Turkey Stock, incorporate slowly and whisk constantly. Add sautéed Mirepoix, salt, pepper and pan drippings (if desired) to the gravy and stir until combined. Reduce heat to low and simmer until desired consistency is reached. Serve immediately*.
*If dinner is not quite ready, keep gravy covered on the stove over low heat, stirring occasionally. Just before serving, add stock to thin gravy to desired consistency.Place the turkey neck in a medium pot with 2 1/2 Cups of water. Cover and bring to a boil. Remove lid, reduce heat to low and simmer for 20-25 minutes, until meat can be pulled from turkey neck with forks. Reduce heat to low and simmer until desired consistency is reached. Serve immediately*.*If dinner is not quite ready, keep gravy covered on the stove over low heat, stirring occasionally. Just before serving, add stock to thin gravy to desired consistency.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spray cups with canola oil. Arrange two prosciutto halves in each cup so that they cover the bottom, sides and are coming out the top of the cup. Add two to three pieces of polenta in a flat layer over the prosciutto, then add a slice of tomato. Gently press the layers down to ensure enough room for the eggs. Crack an egg over each cup being careful not to break the yolk. If the egg overflows out of the cup, scoop out some of the egg whites (otherwise the egg will create an air seal over the cup and the prosciutto will not crisp properly).
Bake on the center rack for about 13-15 minutes or until the egg whites are firm. Remove from oven and let cool a few minutes. Run a knife around the edges of each cup, carefully remove the egg nests and place on a serving platter. Sprinkle with half a teaspoon of pesto each and garnish with basil. Serve immediately.Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spray cups with canola oil. Arrange two prosciutto halves in each cup so that they cover the bottom, sides and are coming out the top of the cup. title: Egg & Pesto Prosciutto Nests
ingredients: 2 packages TJ's Prosciutto, sliced in half
1 package TJ's Polenta, sliced into thin disks then cut into eighths
12 leaves TJ's Fresh Basil, chopped (optional), for garnish
Standard 12-slot muffin tin (or 12 ceramic ramekin or 12 short mason jars placed on a baking tray)

directions:
Spread a thin layer of chile lime seasoning on a shallow dish or clean cutting board. Rub a slice of lemon around the rim of a glass. Place rim of glass in seasoning and twist and turn to coat.
Fill the chile-rimmed glass with ice. Add bloody mary mixer, vodka, and olive brine, if using. Stir and add more mixer or vodka to taste. Garnish with a celery stalk, a few stuffed olives, and sliced lemon. Cheers!Spread a thin layer of chile lime seasoning on a shallow dish or clean cutting board. Rub a slice of lemon around the rim of a glass. Place rim of glass in seasoning and twist and turn to coat.Fill the chile-rimmed glass with ice. Add bloody mary mixer, vodka, and olive brine, if using. Stir and add more mixer or vodka to taste. Garnish with a celery stalk, a few stuffed olives, and sliced lemon. Cheers!
ingredients: 1 1/4 ounce TJ's Vodka Of The Gods
1 TJ's Celery Stalk, rinsed and trimmed
TJ's Colossal Olives Hand Stuffed With Garlic Cloves, plus one tablespoon brine from jar (optional)
title: Joe's Bloody Mary
Citrusy Baked Oatmeal
directions:
In a medium bowl, add oats, 1 cup almond milk and the juice of 2 Cara Cara oranges and stir. Let sit for 20 minutes, allowing oats to soak in liquid.
Preheat oven to 375°F. Grease a 9-inch pie dish with 1 tablespoon ghee and set aside. In a large bowl, combine egg, honey, remaining ghee, and almond milk. Add soaked oats, Trek Mix, baking powder, salt and cinnamon and stir gently until combined.
Pour the oat mixture into the greased pie dish. Thinly slice the remaining Cara Cara orange and layer slices atop mixture. Sprinkle with sugar, if desired, and bake for 30 minutes, until the center is set. Turn the oven to broil (low) and cook until orange slices are caramelized, about 3 minutes. Let cool 10 minutes prior to serving.In a medium bowl, add oats, 1 cup almond milk and the juice of 2 Cara Cara oranges and stir. Let sit for 20 minutes, allowing oats to soak in liquid.Preheat oven to 375°F. Grease a 9-inch pie dish with 1 tablespoon ghee and set aside. Turn the oven to broil (low) and cook until orange slices are caramelized, about 3 minutes. Let cool 10 minutes prior to serving.
ingredients: 3 TJ's Cara Cara Oranges (if unavailable, Navels or Valencias will work just fine)
1 ½ cups TJ's Unsweetened Vanilla Almond Milk
¼ cup of your favorite TJ's Honey
1 cup TJ's Go Raw Trek Mix (or Oh My! Omega Trek Mix)

title: Scone Pinwheels with Honey Goat Cheese
directions:
Preheat oven to 375°F. Lightly grease a large baking sheet or line with parchment paper, set aside.
Add scone mix to a large bowl. Add water and stir with a fork, just until water is absorbed and a sticky dough forms. Do not overmix. Cover and refrigerate 1 hour.
Lightly dust a large cutting board with flour. Roll scone dough into a rectangle, roughly 10 inches by 12 inches. Spread softened goat cheese to cover dough completely. Starting from the short side, use your fingertips to gently roll dough inward, creating a pinwheel (use a lightly floured spatula to lift dough from board if it gets stuck). Cover pinwheel log in cling wrap and freeze 1 hour*.
Remove pinwheel log from freezer. Remove plastic wrap and slice log crosswise into 8 pieces. Place slices pinwheel side-up on prepared baking sheet and lightly brush with whisked egg.
Place sheet on center rack of oven and bake 15-17 minutes, until scones are golden brown. Remove sheet from oven and let cool 5 minutes, then transfer scones to a wire rack. Drizzle with honey, garnish with mint and serve immediately.
*Scone pinwheel log can be prepared 1 day ahead. Remove from freezer and let sit at room temperature for 30 minutes prior to slicing and baking.Preheat oven to 375°F. ingredients: 1 box TJ's Mixed Berry Scone Mix
TJ's All Purpose Flour, for work surface
2 packages TJ's Honey Goat Cheese, softened to room temperature
TJ's Honey and Fresh Mint, for garnish
1/4 cup TJ's Nonfat Greek Yogurt (any kind)
1/2 cup TJ's Almond Beverage (Vanilla or Plain)
title: Overnight Y'oats
directions: In a resealable jar, add oats, greek yogurt, almond beverage and chia seeds. Stir, then seal the jar with a lid. Place in refrigerator 6 hours or overnight. The oats will soften and the mixture will become very thick. When ready to eat, if desired, add a splash of extra almond beverage to thin out the consistency. Garnish with toppings such as almonds, granola and raspberries. Serve cold.In a resealable jar, add oats, greek yogurt, almond beverage and chia seeds. Stir, then seal the jar with a lid. Place in refrigerator 6 hours or overnight. The oats will soften and the mixture will become very thick. When ready to eat, if desired, add a splash of extra almond beverage to thin out the consistency. Garnish with toppings such as almonds, granola and raspberries. Serve cold.

ingredients: 1 jar TJ's Thai Red Curry Sauce
1 cup TJ's Honey Sesame Cashews, chopped
directions:
Marinate drumsticks in curry sauce 20 minutes to overnight. About 15 minutes before you're ready to cook, remove drumsticks from refrigerator and preheat oven to 375°F.
Arrange drumsticks on a large, lightly greased baking sheet. Lightly spray drumsticks with canola oil. Place sheet on center rack of oven and bake 20 minutes, or until the sauce begins to thicken. Remove sheet from oven and lightly sprinkle drumsticks with cashew pieces. Return sheet to oven and bake another 5 minutes or until the cashew pieces begin to brown and chicken reaches internal temperature of 165°F. Remove drumsticks from oven and let cool slightly. Serve over rice.Marinate drumsticks in curry sauce 20 minutes to overnight. Serve over rice.
title: Red Curry Chicken Drumsticks
Everything Ham & Cheese Roll-Ups
ingredients: TJ's Everything But The Bagel Sesame Seasoning Blend
4 slices TJ's Sliced Alpine Semisoft Cheese, sliced in half
4 slices TJ's Organic Black Forest Ham, sliced in half
directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F. Pour a few tablespoons of seasoning onto a shallow plate, set aside.
Remove crescent roll dough from package and gently separate into 8 triangles. Top a dough triangle with a piece of cheese and a piece of ham. Roll into a crescent shape, then gently roll outside of dough in everything seasoning and place on an ungreased baking sheet. Repeat with remaining ingredients.
Bake rolls on center rack of oven for 12-14 minutes, until rolls are golden brown and cheese is melted. Remove from oven and let cool slightly before serving.Preheat oven to 350°F. Pour a few tablespoons of seasoning onto a shallow plate, set aside.Remove crescent roll dough from package and gently separate into 8 triangles. Top a dough triangle with a piece of cheese and a piece of ham. Roll into a crescent shape, then gently roll outside of dough in everything seasoning and place on an ungreased baking sheet. Repeat with remaining ingredients.Bake rolls on center rack of oven for 12-14 minutes, until rolls are golden brown and cheese is melted. Remove from oven and let cool slightly before serving.

ingredients: 2 TJ's Russet Potatoes, rinsed and dried
1 TJ's Yellow Onion, rinsed and dried
3 TJ's Whole Organic Carrots, rinsed and dried
1 bag TJ's Tricolor Peppers, rinsed and dried
1 bag TJ's Organic Broccoli Florets, rinsed and dried
1 package TJ's Spicy Italian Chicken Sausages (or your favorite TJ's fully cooked chicken sausage)
3 tablespoons TJ's Extra Virgin Olive Oil, divided
title: Sausage & Veggies
directions:
You will need 5 microwave-safe food storage containers for daily meal prep.
Adjust oven racks to upper and lower level of oven. Preheat oven to 400°F and line two large baking sheets with parchment paper; set aside.
Cube potatoes, onion and carrots. In a large bowl, gently toss cubed veggies with 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 teaspoon seasoning and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Spread veggie mixture evenly on baking sheet. Bake on upper rack of oven for 10 minutes.
While potatoes, onion and carrots are baking, roughly chop peppers and broccoli. Slice sausages. In a large bowl, gently toss peppers, broccoli and sausages with 2 tablespoons olive oil, 1 teaspoon seasoning and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Spread mixture evenly on second baking sheet and set aside.
After 10 minutes, move the baking sheet with veggie mixture to the bottom rack of oven. Place the sheet with the sausage mixture on the upper rack of oven. Bake 20-25 minutes, until veggies are fork-tender. Remove both sheets from oven and set aside to cool.

ingredients: 1 cup TJ's Apple Juice or TJ's Dixie Peach Juice
directions: To peel the peaches, blanch in boiling water for about 2 minutes then immediately transfer with a slotted spoon to a bowl of ice water. Once peaches have cooled a minute or two, gently slide the skins off with your fingertips. Cut peaches in half, remove pits then cut into quarters. To make the pickling brine, combine fruit juice, vinegar, honey, ginger and cinnamon in a medium sized nonreactive pot (any pot EXCEPT that made of aluminum, cast iron or copper). Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 3-5 minutes. To pickle the peaches, add peach segments and cook just until tender, about 3-5 minutes. Carefully remove peaches with a slotted spoon and transfer to a glass jar with a resealable lid. Let pickling mixture cool slightly and then pour over peaches. Seal with lid and store in the refrigerator. Ready to eat immediately, but will develop more flavor overnight. Each batch should keep for an additional week or two in the refrigerator. If any off flavors or smells develop, or if you notice fermentation, please discard. Pairing & Serving Suggestions: Perfect served alongside roasted chicken or ham, warmed and spooned over vanilla ice cream, or even pureed and mixed into a cocktail (try it with sparkling grape juice, prosecco or bourbon)...To peel the peaches, blanch in boiling water for about 2 minutes then immediately transfer with a slotted spoon to a bowl of ice water. title: Ginger Honey Pickled Peaches

ingredients: 2 small TJ's Acorn Squash (seasonal), sliced lengthwise and cleaned of seeds and string
TJ's Sea Salt and Black Pepper, to taste
1 cup TJ's Frozen Kale, defrosted and squeezed of water
2 packages TJ's Polenta, sliced into 24 1” rounds
1/2 cup TJ's Grated Parmigiano Reggiano Cheese
directions:
Preheat oven to 375°F. Slice squash halves into 1/2" half-moon-shaped slices. Spray a large baking sheet with a light dusting of oil and sprinkle with a little sea salt and pepper. Place the slices on the sheet in a single layer. Lightly spray the tops and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake until the slices are tender, about 35 minutes. Remove from oven and set aside to cool; lower oven temperature to 350°F.
Place ricotta, kale, garlic and 1/4 teaspoon salt into a bowl and combine. Set aside.
Assemble the stacks: Coat the bottom of a 9" x 13" baking dish with a light layer of sauce. Lay 12 Polenta rounds side by side and season with a little salt and pepper; cover with sauce. Next, top each round with squash slices facing each other, trim to fit neatly. Top each set of squash with the ricotta-kale mixture and smooth out. Top with more sauce, followed by a layer of polenta and the last layer of squash. Pour over the remainder of sauce and top each stack with Mozzarella cheese, followed by Parmesan cheese.
Cover with foil and bake for about 40 minutes. Uncover for the last 10 minutes or until cheese is golden and bubbly. Remove from oven and rest 15 minutes before serving.Preheat oven to 375°F. Uncover for the last 10 minutes or until cheese is golden and bubbly. Remove from oven and rest 15 minutes before serving.
title: Acorn Squash Polenta Stacks

ingredients: 1 large tub (32 oz) TJ's Honey Greek Yogurt (or four 8 oz tubs)
1 (12 oz) package TJ's Frozen Organic Blueberries
You will also need 10 wooden craft sticks and 10 small paper cups to use as molds
title: Berry Yogurt Pops
directions: Slice the tops off 15-20 strawberries and toss into a blender with 1/2 cup of yogurt and 6 mint leaves. Blend. Distribute the "red" strawberry mixture into 10 paper cups about 1/3 of the way high. Place cups on a tray and pop in the freezer. If you want clean and distinct layers, it's best to wait another hour or so until you add the next layer. For faster prep, just leave the cups in the freezer to firm up a bit while you prepare the remaining ingredients. Rinse your blender, then add half the bag of blueberries with 1/2 cup of yogurt. Blend. For more texture, stir in the other half of the bag of blueberries without blending. Remove pops from the freezer and carefully spoon in the "white" second layer, the honey yogurt until each cup is about 2/3 full. Lastly, pour the third "blue" layer, the blueberry mixture over the top of the plain honey yogurt, filling each cup almost to the top. Cover each cup with foil and puncture with a popsicle stick down the center. Stick the pops in the freezer for about six hours. Peel the paper away and enjoy!Slice the tops off 15-20 strawberries and toss into a blender with 1/2 cup of yogurt and 6 mint leaves. Blend. Cover each cup with foil and puncture with a popsicle stick down the center. Stick the pops in the freezer for about six hours. Peel the paper away and enjoy!

Heat olive oil and butter in a large heavy skillet over medium heat; crowd in the cubed corned beef and potatoes.
Spread evenly in the pan and increase heat to high or medium high. Do not stir the potatoes and corned beef; let them brown until sizzling. Use a spatula to peek underneath to check browning. If there is too much sticking, add a little more oil to the pan. Continue to cook in this manner until the potatoes and the corned beef are browned and crispy on the bottom, about 8 minutes.
Once browned, add water, then cover with a lid and steam until water evaporates (about 2 to 3 minutes). Remove from heat and serve topped with fried or poached eggs.Heat olive oil and butter in a large heavy skillet over medium heat; crowd in the cubed corned beef and potatoes.Spread evenly in the pan and increase heat to high or medium high. Do not stir the potatoes and corned beef; let them brown until sizzling. Use a spatula to peek underneath to check browning. If there is too much sticking, add a little more oil to the pan. Continue to cook in this manner until the potatoes and the corned beef are browned and crispy on the bottom, about 8 minutes.Once browned, add water, then cover with a lid and steam until water evaporates (about 2 to 3 minutes). Remove from heat and serve topped with fried or poached eggs.
title: Easy As Crispy Corned Beef Hash
ingredients: 1 bag TJ's Roasted Potatoes with Peppers & Onions
1 pound leftover cooked Corned Beef, cubed to potato size (seasonal)
2 Tbsp TJ's Pure Imported Olive Oil

directions: Place broth in a 4 quart stock pot over medium heat; add kale and boil until just wilted, 10 to 15 minutes or until desired tenderness. Stir until all greens are wet. Add pork belly to a large skillet over medium heat and brown on all sides until golden and crisp. Remove from pan to a paper towel. Pour off all but 2 tablespoons of fat. Lower heat; add garlic to skillet, and sauté until garlic begins to sizzle. Add a pinch of red pepper flakes and sauté until the garlic is tender and lightly golden, 1 to 2 minutes longer. Pour kale, broth and pork belly into skillet and deglaze pan while sautéing kale until heated through, about 3 to 4 minutes. Serve with a side of cornbread.
title: Kale & Crispy Pork Belly
ingredients: 2 cups TJ's Low Sodium Chicken Broth
6 oz TJ's Fully Cooked Pork Belly, 3/4 inch dice
TJ's Red Pepper Flakes, to taste

title: Curry Chicken Pot Pie
ingredients: 1 package TJ's Gourmet Pie Crusts, defrosted in the refrigerator
1 bottle TJ's Thai Yellow Curry Sauce
directions:
Preheat oven to 400ºF. Unroll crusts, leaving plastic sleeves in place, and smooth together any cracks in the dough. Using a small cereal bowl and juice glass as your guides, cut out 5 small circles and 5 medium circles from the dough. Cut a small vent hole in each of the small circles and place them in refrigerator.
Line each ramekin with with a medium-sized dough circle and place on rimmed baking sheet. Poke holes in the crusts with a sharp knife. Place sheet on center rack of oven and par-bake crusts 10-15 minutes. Remove from oven and set aside.
Remove small pie crust circles from refrigerator. Add organic foursome and onions to a microwave-safe bowl and microwave 1 minute on high. Add chicken and curry sauce to bowl and gently stir to combine. Divide mixture among ramekins and top each with a small pie crust circle.
Return baking sheet to oven and bake 20-30 minutes, or until crusts are golden and filling is bubbling. Remove from oven and let cool 5 minutes prior to serving.

title: Savory Butternut Squash Soup
ingredients: 1 package TJ's Sweet Italian Sausage, casing removed
directions:
In a medium saucepan, heat soup over medium heat, about 5 minutes. Stir occasionally until simmering; reduce heat to low.
While soup cooks, heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add sausage to pan and spread evenly. Break sausage pieces into smaller bits with a wooden spoon and brown until heated to 165°F, about 5-7 minutes. Remove from heat.
To serve, ladle the soup into individual bowls, then garnish with sausage, cheese and chives. Enjoy!In a medium saucepan, heat soup over medium heat, about 5 minutes. In a medium bowl, mash the anchovies and garlic with a fork to form a paste. Add the lemon juice and mustard and stir until well incorporated. Slowly whisk in oil until it starts to emulsify. Taste and add salt and pepper as desired. Makes about 1 cup of dressing.

directions: Melt butter in a large frying pan. Saute diced onion for 2-3 minutes until it softens. Add frozen corn and heat 6-7 minutes, until warm. Chop half of the package of feta into small crumbles, it should be about 1 cup. Add feta, cilantro, cayenne pepper and the juice of two limes, to the corn and stir. Add pepper to taste. directions:
To make the chimichurri sauce: Combine 2 tablespoons vinegar, 8 grinds South African seasoning, 2 teaspoons oregano, 6 garlic cloves and 4 tablespoons of EVOO in a blender or food processor. Pulse until garlic minces to desired consistency. Add cilantro and parsley and pulse a few more times until desired consistency. Pour mixture into a bowl and stir in reserved 6 tablespoons of EVOO. Taste and adjust seasoning as desired. Makes about 1 cup of sauce. Set aside.
To prepare toasts: Brush olive oil on one side of each bread slice then grill face down until golden grill marks appear. Alternatively you can place them on a baking sheet and bake at 400 degrees for 15-20 minutes until they are crisp and browned. Place mozzarella slices on top each toast then spoon chimichurri sauce over the cheese. Serve. Makes about 20 toasts.To make the chimichurri sauce: Combine 2 tablespoons vinegar, 8 grinds South African seasoning, 2 teaspoons oregano, 6 garlic cloves and 4 tablespoons of EVOO in a blender or food processor. Pulse until garlic minces to desired consistency. Add cilantro and parsley and pulse a few more times until desired consistency. Pour mixture into a bowl and stir in reserved 6 tablespoons of EVOO. Taste and adjust seasoning as desired. Makes about 1 cup of sauce. Set aside.To prepare toasts: Brush olive oil on one side of each bread slice then grill face down until golden grill marks appear. Alternatively you can place them on a baking sheet and bake at 400 degrees for 15-20 minutes until they are crisp and browned. Place mozzarella slices on top each toast then spoon chimichurri sauce over the cheese. Serve. Makes about 20 toasts.
title: Chimichurri Toasts

1 package TJ's Fully Cooked Uncured Bacon, microwaved according to package instructions

2 of your favorite TJ's Apples, sliced
directions:
Cut bacon into small pieces, set aside.
In a serving bowl, toss salad with dressing, included toppings, apple, and bacon pieces. Divide among plates of bowls and enjoy!Cut bacon into small pieces, set aside.In a serving bowl, toss salad with dressing, included toppings, apple, and bacon pieces. Divide among plates of bowls and enjoy!
title: Bacon, Apple, and Butternut Squash Salad

ingredients: ½ bar TJ's Pound Plus Dark Chocolate
2 packets TJ's Instant Coffee Packets All Dressed Up with Creamer & Sugar
½ bag TJ's Dry Roasted & Salted Pistachio Nutmeats
directions:
Chop the chocolate finely with a sharp, serrated knife. Place in a small, heatproof mixing bowl.
Heat the cream in a small saucepan, just until it starts to boil. Remove from heat immediately and pour over the chopped chocolate. Let the mixture sit for 30 seconds, then add vanilla extract and carefully whisk together until the chocolate is completely melted. *
Set aside in the fridge for one hour, or until chocolate mixture is solid but still easy to scoop.
One at a time, crush dried strawberries, pistachios, and Joe-Joe's in a food processor (separately, not together) until each topping reaches a finely ground, powdered consistency. Place the three different powders in separate piles on a flat surface, with some space between them. Open the instant coffee packets and pour powdered contents into a pile on the same flat surface.
With a melon baller, scoop round balls of the chilled chocolate mixture onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Roll each dollop of chocolate in hands to make a smooth, round ball.
Roll each ball of chocolate in the finely ground topping of your choice; depending on the size of your truffles, you will have enough for either four, five, or six of each flavor.
Serve at room temperature and enjoy.
 *Note: If chocolate does not completely melt, place bowl in the microwave in 15-second increments, stirring in between, until chocolate is fully melted.Chop the chocolate finely with a sharp, serrated knife. ingredients: 1 bag TJ's Gluten Free Breaded Chicken Breast Nuggets
1 box TJ's Gluten Free Toaster Waffles
title: Spicy Chicken & Waffle Bites
directions:
Preheat oven to 425° F. Spread frozen nuggets in a single layer on a baking sheet. Place on center rack of oven and begin baking for 10 minutes.
Meanwhile, for extra color, heat and crunch, trim the top off of 2 jalapenos. Using a sharp paring knife, core the inside of the pepper to remove seeds. Dispose the seeds. Slice the peppers in half lengthwise then slice into long thin strips. Slice across the strips for a small dice. Set aside.
Remove nugget tray from oven, flip nuggets and return to oven to cook an additional 10 minutes or to an internal temperature of 175°F to 180°F.
In a small saucepan, add entire bottle of chili sauce. Heat on low, stirring occasionally about 2-3 minutes or until warmed. Remove pan from heat and set aside.
While the chicken nuggets are finishing up cooking, place waffles directly onto the oven rack and heat for 2-3 minutes or until hot, crispy and golden brown.
Remove chicken and waffles from oven and let stand 1 minute. Slice the waffles into quarters, and begin assembling. Place one nugget on top of one waffle wedge, then spoon warmed chili sauce over the top of the chicken. Sprinkle with diced jalapeno then top with another waffle wedge. Secure with toothpicks if desired. Place finished sandwich bites onto a platter and serve!Preheat oven to 425° F. Spread frozen nuggets in a single layer on a baking sheet. Place on center rack of oven and begin baking for 10 minutes.Meanwhile, for extra color, heat and crunch, trim the top off of 2 jalapenos. Using a sharp paring knife, core the inside of the pepper to remove seeds. Dispose the seeds. Slice the peppers in half lengthwise then slice into long thin strips. Slice across the strips for a small dice. Set aside.Remove nugget tray from oven, flip nuggets and return to oven to cook an additional 10 minutes or to an internal temperature of 175°F to 180°F.In a small saucepan, add entire bottle of chili sauce. Heat on low, stirring occasionally about 2-3 minutes or until warmed. Remove pan from heat and set aside.While the chicken nuggets are finishing up cooking, place waffles directly onto the oven rack and heat for 2-3 minutes or until hot, crispy and golden brown.Remove chicken and waffles from oven and let stand 1 minute. Slice the waffles into quarters, and begin assembling. Place one nugget on top of one waffle wedge, then spoon warmed chili sauce over the top of the chicken. Sprinkle with diced jalapeno then top with another waffle wedge. Secure with toothpicks if desired. Place finished sandwich bites onto a platter and serve!

ingredients: ½ package TJ's Portobello Mushrooms, diced
½ cup plus 2 tablespoons TJ's Organic Spicy Taco Sauce

directions:
Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add diced mushrooms to skillet and let cook undisturbed for 5 minutes, until most of the moisture has evaporated. Add beef-less beef and taco sauce to skillet and sauté another 5-7 minutes, until heated through.
To serve, scoop filling into a warm tortilla and top with lettuce, tomato and cheese. Fold as you like and serve with more taco sauce for drizzling.Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Fold as you like and serve with more taco sauce for drizzling.

directions: Cut the peaches in half and pit them. Cut the halves into wide wedges, and then toss the peaches with olive oil. Place the peaches directly on the grill (or cast iron griddle on stovetop) and cook over a medium heat (on all sides) until grill marks form and peaches are tender but not falling apart; about five minutes. Remove peaches from heat and set aside. In a large serving bowl, layer spinach, chicken, blueberries, goat cheese and almonds. Add peaches and drizzle with balsamic vinaigrette. Enjoy!Cut the peaches in half and pit them. Cut the halves into wide wedges, and then toss the peaches with olive oil. title: Chili Cornbread Casserole
ingredients: 4 cans of TJ's Organic Vegetarian Chili
1 box of TJ's Cornbread Baking Mix
1 cup of TJ's Mexican Blend Cheese
1/2 stick TJ's Unsalted Butter (optional), sliced for garnish
2 TJ's Jalapenos (optional), deseeded and diced for garnish
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Empty 4 cans of chili on the bottom of a greased 8 x 10 inch baking dish, then set aside. In a large mixing bowl, beat egg, oil and milk. Add cornbread mix and cheese and stir until moistened. Pour the batter into the prepared baking dish over the vegetarian chili. Spread the batter with a spatula in an even layer. Bake for approximately 35 to 40 minutes until the cornbread is golden brown and an inserted toothpick comes out clean. Let cool for 5-10 minutes. Slice into squares and garnish with butter and diced jalapenos. Enjoy!Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Empty 4 cans of chili on the bottom of a greased 8 x 10 inch baking dish, then set aside. In a large mixing bowl, beat egg, oil and milk. Add cornbread mix and cheese and stir until moistened. Pour the batter into the prepared baking dish over the vegetarian chili. Spread the batter with a spatula in an even layer. Bake for approximately 35 to 40 minutes until the cornbread is golden brown and an inserted toothpick comes out clean. Let cool for 5-10 minutes. Slice into squares and garnish with butter and diced jalapenos. Enjoy!

Preheat oven to 400°F. Lightly spray a sheet pan with canola oil spray, set aside.
In a small bowl, mix together olive oil and seasoning. Set aside.
Rinse cauliflower and remove leaves. Trim bottom of the cauliflower stem, but make sure to keep the core intact. Cut into thick (1” or so) slices.
Arrange cauliflower slices on sheet pan. Brush half of the oil mixture on cauliflower. Carefully turn cauliflower slices over and brush on the remaining mixture.
Place on middle rack in oven and bake for 15 minutes or until cauliflower is easily pierced with a fork.
Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Serve warm and enjoy!Preheat oven to 400°F. Lightly spray a sheet pan with canola oil spray, set aside.In a small bowl, mix together olive oil and seasoning. Drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice, and season with red pepper flakes, salt and pepper. Place sheet on center rack of oven and roast 20-23 minutes, tossing halfway through cooking. Prepare four serving bowls. Spread a large spoonful of hummus inside each bowl with the back of a spoon. directions:
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper, set aside. Add chocolate to a microwave-safe dish. Microwave on high for 1-minute intervals, stirring in between, until melted and smooth.
Remove pie from freezer. Gently remove pie tin and place pie on a clean work surface. Use a sharp knife to slice pie into 1-inch cubes.
Using a fork, dip a pie bite into melted chocolate. Allow excess chocolate to drip back into dish, and place bite on prepared parchment. Sprinkle with crunchy toppings before chocolate hardens. Repeat process with remaining bites. Enjoy immediately, or refrigerate up to 3 hours before serving.Line a baking sheet with parchment paper, set aside. Add chocolate to a microwave-safe dish. directions: Place cut potatoes into a pot. Add enough water to cover the potatoes. Bring water to a boil. Cook potatoes until they start to become tender. Drain and place in large mixing bowl. Add chives, olive oil, garlic oil, salt and paprika. Gently toss and serve.Place cut potatoes into a pot. Add enough water to cover the potatoes. Bring water to a boil. title: Grilled Romaine Hearts
ingredients: 1 pack TJ's Romaine Hearts, sliced in half lengthwise, rinsed and dried
6 oz TJ's Fully Cooked Pork Belly, diced
1/4 cup TJ's Crumbled Blue Cheese, or to taste
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste
directions:
Add pork belly to a 12" non stick skillet over medium heat and brown until crisp on all sides and fat is rendered, about 5 or 6 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel and set aside to cool. 

Heat grill or grill pan to medium-high. Working in batches, place romaine halves cut-side down on grill, and cook until charred, turn once and continue to grill until slightly wilted, about 4 minutes.

Transfer lettuce cut-side up to plates, and season with pepper; drizzle with dressing, and sprinkle with blue cheese and pork belly “croutons.” Serve right away.

Mix all ingredients together. Serve as a dipping sauce or use as a marinade for chicken, shrimp or veggies.Mix all ingredients together. Serve as a dipping sauce or use as a marinade for chicken, shrimp or veggies.

directions:
Preheat oven to 425ºF.
In a 6" cast iron skillet, pour in the chocolate chips, followed by the coconut milk. Give the mixture a quick stir. Arrange the halved marshmallows in a single layer covering the chocolate mixture.
Place the skillet in the oven, on the center rack; let heat for about 8-10 minutes. Keep an eye to make sure the marshmallows aren't burning (every oven is calibrated slightly differently).
When the marshmallows are golden and toasted, carefully remove the skillet from the oven. title: Pop Goes the Elote!
ingredients: ½ cup TJ's Organic Popping Corn

directions:
In a 3-quart pan, pour in oil to cover the bottom.  Add 2-3 kernels of corn to pan, cover and heat. When these kernels pop, add the remaining popping corn, then cover and shake pan over medium heat until popping stops. 
Remove from heat. Pour melted butter and sprinkle seasoning over popcorn. Mix until thoroughly covered.
Let popcorn cool slightly and enjoy!In a 3-quart pan, pour in oil to cover the bottom.  Add 2-3 kernels of corn to pan, cover and heat. title: Sweet & Spicy Glazed Carrots
ingredients: 1 bottle (12 oz.) TJ's Brewed Ginger Beer
2 tablespoons TJ's Cultured Butter or Salted Butter
TJ's Unsalted Dry Toasted Sliced Almonds and Fresh Chopped Parsley, for garnish
directions:
Peel carrots and trim ends. Slice on a diagonal, about ¼-inch thick. Add carrots, ginger beer and butter to a large sauté pan. Cover and bring to a simmer. Remove lid and stir. Reduce heat to low, replace lid and simmer 5 minutes more.
Remove lid and stir in cayenne pepper and honey. Continue to cook, stirring occasionally until liquid is reduced to a thick glaze, about 15 minutes. Remove pan from heat and let cool 5 minutes. Garnish with almonds and parsley before serving.Peel carrots and trim ends. Slice on a diagonal, about ¼-inch thick. Add carrots, ginger beer and butter to a large sauté pan. Cover and bring to a simmer. Remove lid and stir. Reduce heat to low, replace lid and simmer 5 minutes more.Remove lid and stir in cayenne pepper and honey. Continue to cook, stirring occasionally until liquid is reduced to a thick glaze, about 15 minutes. Remove pan from heat and let cool 5 minutes. Garnish with almonds and parsley before serving.

title: Frank's Blueberry Muffins
ingredients: 1 cup TJ's Organic Sugar, plus more for sprinkling
1 teaspoon TJ's Pure Bourbon Vanilla Extract
2 cups TJ's Frozen Blueberries (do not thaw)
directions:
Preheat oven to 425°F. Grease muffin tin with cooking spray; set aside. In a large bowl, mix flour, baking powder, salt and sugar; set aside.
In a large bowl, combine eggs, milk, butter and vanilla. Add one-third of dry mixture to wet ingredients and stir to combine. Repeat addition of dry ingredients until fully incorporated. Gently fold in blueberries.
Scoop muffin batter into greased muffin pan (cups will be very full—almost overflowing—this is ok!). Lightly sprinkle muffin batter with sugar. Place pan on center rack of oven and bake 22-25 minutes, until muffins are golden. Let cool 10 minutes, then gently remove muffins from tin. Enjoy warm, with a generous smear of TJ's Cultured Butter.Preheat oven to 425°F. Grease muffin tin with cooking spray; set aside. In a large bowl, mix flour, baking powder, salt and sugar; set aside.In a large bowl, combine eggs, milk, butter and vanilla. Add one-third of dry mixture to wet ingredients and stir to combine. Repeat addition of dry ingredients until fully incorporated. Gently fold in blueberries.Scoop muffin batter into greased muffin pan (cups will be very full—almost overflowing—this is ok!). Lightly sprinkle muffin batter with sugar. Place pan on center rack of oven and bake 22-25 minutes, until muffins are golden. Let cool 10 minutes, then gently remove muffins from tin. Enjoy warm, with a generous smear of TJ's Cultured Butter.

Add oil to a grill pan or skillet and turn heat to medium-high. Cook turkey burgers according to package directions; remove from heat.
In a medium bowl, toss salad with included toppings and dressing. To assemble, place turkey burger on bottom half of bun. Top with slaw and top half of bun, and serve with sweet potato chips.
ingredients: 1 package TJ's Broccoli Kale Slaw Complete Salad Kit
TJ's Ridge Cut Sweet Potato Chips (optional)
title: Sweet Kale Slaw Turkey Burger

ingredients: 1 package TJ's Organic Baked Teriyaki Tofu
1 cup TJ's Organic Brown Sugar BBQ Sauce & Marinade, plus more to finish, if desired
2 bags TJ's Organic Power to the Greens
directions:
Remove tofu from package and pat dry with paper towels; place in a shallow dish and cover with barbecue sauce. Set aside for 30 minutes.
Place soycutash in a microwave safe dish, add water and cover with damp paper towels; heat on high for 2 minutes or until heated through. Set aside.
Heat grill to high, add tofu and sear on both sides; lower heat and continue to cook until warmed through; about 5 minutes.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet; add greens and sauté until wilted, about 3 to 5 minutes; season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat and divide between 2 plates. Divide soycutash and layer atop greens. Slice tofu lengthwise, arrange atop soycutash and drizzle with warmed barbecue sauce, if desired.Remove tofu from package and pat dry with paper towels; place in a shallow dish and cover with barbecue sauce. Set aside.Heat grill to high, add tofu and sear on both sides; lower heat and continue to cook until warmed through; about 5 minutes.Heat olive oil in a large skillet; add greens and sauté until wilted, about 3 to 5 minutes; season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat and divide between 2 plates. Divide soycutash and layer atop greens. Slice tofu lengthwise, arrange atop soycutash and drizzle with warmed barbecue sauce, if desired.
title: Teriyaki BBQ Tofu with Soycutash Greens

ingredients: 1 TJ's Baguette, cut into fours and sliced down the middle
1 package TJ's Frozen Turkey Meatballs or Meatless Meatballs, heated according to package directions
1 TJ's Onion, thinly sliced and sautéed in olive oil
1 TJ's Green Bell Pepper, thinly sliced and sautéed in olive oil
title: Classic Meatball Subs
directions: Toast bread in oven at 300 degrees for about 5-8 minutes or until slightly golden and warm. Remove from oven and add meatballs, onions, peppers sauce and cheese to bread. Return to oven another 3-5 minutes, until cheese is melted.

ingredients: 1 bag TJ's Organic Power To The Greens
4 TJ's Mini Heirloom Tomatoes On The Vine, cut into quarters
1/4 cup TJ's Jarred & Pitted Kalamata Olives, sliced in half
4 Tbsp TJ's Greek Style Feta Dressing
title: Greek Green Salad
directions: In a large salad bowl, toss greens with dressing until the greens are evenly coated. Place greens on individual plates and top with cucumbers, tomatoes, onions, and olives. Sprinkle a small handful of crumbled feta in the center of the salad. Enjoy!

title: Pineapple Quinoa
directions: Prepare quinoa according to package instructions replacing water with pineapple juice. Coat skillet with grapeseed oil. Add frozen pineapple and pepper. Sauté until the pineapple and pepper soften. Add green onion, salt and red chile pepper. Sauté for an additional two minutes. Combine pineapple mixture with quinoa and serve.Prepare quinoa according to package instructions replacing water with pineapple juice. Coat skillet with grapeseed oil. Add frozen pineapple and pepper. Sauté until the pineapple and pepper soften. Add green onion, salt and red chile pepper. Sauté for an additional two minutes. Combine pineapple mixture with quinoa and serve.
ingredients: 16 oz. TJ's Pineapple Juice (refrigerated) or 2 cans TJ's 100% Pineapple Juice (shelf-stable)
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Crushed Red Chile Pepper

title: Scallops with Apples
directions: Cook pasta according to package directions & set aside. Sauté bacon in pan until fat is rendered, about 1-2 minutes. Add apple, leek and thyme. Add salt and pepper; cook until tender, about five minutes. Add scallops and cook over high heat until just cooked, one to three minutes. Serve atop Trader Joe's Whole Wheat Pasta.
ingredients: 2 slices TJ's Applewood Smoked Bacon, chopped
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Sea Salt, or to taste
1/4 teaspoon TJ's Ground Black Pepper, or to taste

directions:
Coat the inside of two tall glasses with a few drizzles of chocolate syrup. Place in the freezer to chill.
Place cereal and milk in a bowl; refrigerate for 15 minutes to infuse. Add cereal and milk to a blender pitcher, along with 4 heaping scoops of ice cream. Blend until ingredients are fully incorporated.
Remove glasses from freezer and divide milkshake evenly among glasses. Garnish with chipped cream, chocolate syrup and cereal. Enjoy immediately.Coat the inside of two tall glasses with a few drizzles of chocolate syrup. Place in the freezer to chill.Place cereal and milk in a bowl; refrigerate for 15 minutes to infuse. Blend until ingredients are fully incorporated.Remove glasses from freezer and divide milkshake evenly among glasses. Garnish with chipped cream, chocolate syrup and cereal. Enjoy immediately.
ingredients: TJ's Midnight Moo Chocolate Flavored Syrup
1 cup TJ's Gluten Free Cocoa Crunch Cereal, plus more for garnish
1 cup TJ's Whole Milk or TJ's Chocolate Whole Milk made with Fair Trade Cocoa
title: Cocoa Crunch Milkshake

ingredients: 1 container TJ's Mexican Corn & Quinoa Salad
title: Grilled Tempeh with Mexican Style Corn & Quinoa Salad
directions:
Fill a pot with a few inches of water and bring to a boil. Slice tempeh crosswise, about 1/2 inch thick. Place tempeh in steamer basket in pot, cover and steam 15 minutes. Remove from heat and allow tempeh to cool slightly.
Heat a grill pan or grill to medium high heat. Brush tempeh slices with sunflower oil. Grill tempeh 2-3 minutes per side and remove from heat.
Add salad and dressing to a large bowl, toss to combine. Divide salad between two plates and top with grilled tempeh. Serve immediately.Fill a pot with a few inches of water and bring to a boil. Toast multigrain bread to desired level of doneness. Top each piece of toast with a goat cheese disk and spread to cover evenly. Top with peach slices and basil. Drizzle with oil & herbs from cheese container, if desired. Enjoy!Toast multigrain bread to desired level of doneness. Top each piece of toast with a goat cheese disk and spread to cover evenly. Top with peach slices and basil. Drizzle with oil & herbs from cheese container, if desired. Enjoy!
title: G.O.A.T. (Greatest Of All Toast)
ingredients: 1 container TJ's Goat's Milk Cheese Marinated With Herbs, softened to room temperature
4 TJ's Cling Peach Halves, thinly sliced
TJ's Fresh Basil, chopped for garnish
1 Can TJ's Whole Kernel Corn, drained
1 Can TJ's Organic Black Beans, drained
½ Can TJ's Hatch Chopped Green Chiles
1 ½ Cups TJ's Enchilada Sauce, divided
2 Cups TJ's Shredded Fancy Mexican Style Cheese Blend, divided
3 TJ's Green Onions diced for garnish
1 ripe TJ's Avocado, diced for garnish
directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a 10-inch pie pan or casserole dish and set aside.
Cut the corner of the bag of squash and microwave, 3 minutes until softened. Let cool slightly and dice.
Combine corn, beans, chile, squash, taco seasoning, a pinch of salt and ½ cup enchilada sauce in a bowl and mix until evenly coated.
Pour remaining enchilada sauce on a large plate. Coat both sides of the tortillas in sauce. Place a layer of tortillas on the bottom of the prepared pan, tearing tortillas as needed to fill the gaps. Top with ½ of the vegetable mix and ½ cup of cheese. Cover with another layer of dipped tortillas, top with the remaining vegetable mix and another ½ cup of cheese. Add the final layer of dipped tortillas and the remaining 1 cup of cheese on top.
Place pie on center rack of oven and bake for 30-40 minutes, or until cheese is melted and golden brown, and pie is slightly bubbling. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Garnish with green onion and avocado and enjoy.Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a 10-inch pie pan or casserole dish and set aside.Cut the corner of the bag of squash and microwave, 3 minutes until softened. Let cool slightly and dice.Combine corn, beans, chile, squash, taco seasoning, a pinch of salt and ½ cup enchilada sauce in a bowl and mix until evenly coated.Pour remaining enchilada sauce on a large plate. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Garnish with green onion and avocado and enjoy.
title: Enchilada Pie

ingredients: 1 bag Organic Elote Corn Chip Dippers
¼ cup TJ's Unbleached Enriched All-Purpose Flour
¼ cup TJ's Everything But The Elote Seasoning Blend
2 package TJ's Organic Boneless & Skinless Chicken Tenders
TJ's Organic Sriracha Ranch Dressing, for dipping
The zest of 1 TJ's Lime (optional), for dip garnish
title: Double Elote Crispy Chicken Tenders
directions:
Preheat oven to 400°F. Coat baking sheet with cooking spray. Set aside. 
In a food processor, crush corn dippers and place in a shallow bowl. Set aside. In a second shallow bowl, add flour and elote seasoning and whisk together until evenly mixed. Set aside. In a third shallow bowl, whisk the eggs together. Set aside.
Remove chicken from packaging. One by one, dredge each tender in flour mixture making sure chicken is thoroughly covered. Then dredge in eggs, allowing excess egg to drain. Then dredge in crushed corn dippers, lightly pressing so that chips adhere.
Arrange chicken on baking sheet, making sure to leave some space between pieces.
Place on center rack in oven and bake for 10 minutes. Use tongs to flip chicken tenders and bake for 5-8 more minutes, until internal temperature of chicken reaches 165°F and exterior is a light golden brown.
Remove from oven and transfer tenders to a wire rack to cool slightly before serving.
Serve with a side of Sriracha Ranch topped with lime zest.
Enjoy!Preheat oven to 400°F. Coat baking sheet with cooking spray. Set aside.In a food processor, crush corn dippers and place in a shallow bowl. Set aside. In a second shallow bowl, add flour and elote seasoning and whisk together until evenly mixed. Set aside. In a third shallow bowl, whisk the eggs together. Set aside.Remove chicken from packaging. ingredients: 1 package TJ's Dry Rubbed Bacon OR Uncured Fully Cooked Bacon
Your favorite TJ's Hot Sauce, Salsa, or Sriracha
directions:
Preheat oven to 400°F. Arrange oven racks in upper and lower thirds of oven. Place a wire rack on a large rimmed baking sheet. Arrange hash browns on rack and bake on upper rack of oven for 10 minutes.
If using dry dubbed bacon: While hash browns are baking, line a second baking sheet with parchment paper and place a wire rack on the baking sheet. Arrange bacon evenly on wire rack. Place sheet on lower rack of oven. Bake hash browns and bacon 20 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool slightly.
If using fully cooked bacon: microwave bacon according to package directions; set aside.
In a large bowl, thoroughly whisk eggs and milk, set aside. Melt butter in a large nonstick skillet over high heat. Pour egg mixture into center of pan and stir slowly. When curds start to form, reduce heat to low and gently fold eggs over. Cook 2-3 minutes more, then transfer eggs to a plate and let rest 1 minute to finish cooking.
Assemble burritos: Lay tortilla on a flat work surface. Place 1/6th of scrambled eggs in the center of the tortilla. Layer a hash brown and 2 slices of bacon atop eggs. Top with 1/4 cup shredded cheese, sliced avocado, and a drizzle of hot sauce. Pull half of the tortilla closest to you up to meet the top half, then pull the tortilla and fillings back toward you. Fold in the left and right sides of the tortilla, then roll tightly until closed. Repeat burrito assembly with remaining ingredients. Enjoy!Preheat oven to 400°F. Arrange oven racks in upper and lower thirds of oven. Place a wire rack on a large rimmed baking sheet. Arrange hash browns on rack and bake on upper rack of oven for 10 minutes.If using dry dubbed bacon: While hash browns are baking, line a second baking sheet with parchment paper and place a wire rack on the baking sheet. Arrange bacon evenly on wire rack. Place sheet on lower rack of oven. Bake hash browns and bacon 20 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool slightly.If using fully cooked bacon: microwave bacon according to package directions; set aside.In a large bowl, thoroughly whisk eggs and milk, set aside. Melt butter in a large nonstick skillet over high heat. Pour egg mixture into center of pan and stir slowly. When curds start to form, reduce heat to low and gently fold eggs over. Cook 2-3 minutes more, then transfer eggs to a plate and let rest 1 minute to finish cooking.Assemble burritos: Lay tortilla on a flat work surface. Place 1/6th of scrambled eggs in the center of the tortilla. Layer a hash brown and 2 slices of bacon atop eggs. Top with 1/4 cup shredded cheese, sliced avocado, and a drizzle of hot sauce. Pull half of the tortilla closest to you up to meet the top half, then pull the tortilla and fillings back toward you. Fold in the left and right sides of the tortilla, then roll tightly until closed. Repeat burrito assembly with remaining ingredients. Enjoy!
title: Brunchfast Burritos

ingredients: 12 cloves TJ's Premium Peeled Garlic, minced
2 TJ's Jalapeños, deseeded and diced (use gloves!)
title: Slow Cooker Chicken Chile Verde
directions:
Add onion, garlic, jalapeño, chicken thighs, salsa verde and cumin to slow cooker and stir to combine.
Cook on LOW for 6-8 hours or HIGH for 2-4 hours, until chicken reaches an internal temperature of 165 degrees.
Shred chicken with a fork and serve with rice and beans.
Garnish with lime wedges and chopped cilantro.Add onion, garlic, jalapeño, chicken thighs, salsa verde and cumin to slow cooker and stir to combine.Cook on LOW for 6-8 hours or HIGH for 2-4 hours, until chicken reaches an internal temperature of 165 degrees.Shred chicken with a fork and serve with rice and beans.Garnish with lime wedges and chopped cilantro.

Preheat oven to 400 ºF.
Toss sweet potatoes with olive oil and sea salt. Place in roasting pan and bake for 20 minutes.
In a large oven-safe skillet, cook bacon over medium heat. Add onions once the bacon has cooked for five minutes and has begun to render fat. Cook until bacon begins to become crisp and onions appear translucent.
Add apples and cook for an additional two minutes. Add roasted sweet potatoes to the mixture and cook for approximately five minutes or until potatoes begin to soften. Mix in kale and cook for another two minutes.
Create four spaces in the hash mixture where you want to place the eggs and carefully crack one egg in each space.
Place skillet in oven and cook for 7 - 10 minutes, or until eggs are fully cooked.
Remove from oven, toss with maple syrup and serve.Preheat oven to 400 ºF.Toss sweet potatoes with olive oil and sea salt. Place in roasting pan and bake for 20 minutes.In a large oven-safe skillet, cook bacon over medium heat. Add onions once the bacon has cooked for five minutes and has begun to render fat. ingredients: 4 TJ's Organic Sweet Potatoes, peeled and diced
1/4 cup TJ's Extra Virgin Olive Oil
1 package TJ's Bacon Ends & Pieces (or your favorite TJ's Bacon)
2 TJ's Gala Apples or TJ's Granny Smith Apples, diced
title: Bacon Apple Sweet Potato Hash

ingredients: 1 package TJ's Jumbo Cinnamon Rolls with Vanilla Icing
TJ's Organic Reduced Sugar Strawberry Preserves
directions:
Preheat oven to 350°F. Remove cinnamon rolls from package and transfer to a large cutting board or workspace, reserve icing.
Gently separate and unravel cinnamon rolls until you have long strips of dough. Spread a thin layer of jelly atop each strip of dough, followed by a thin layer of peanut butter. Gently roll the dough strips back into their cinnamon roll shape and place on an ungreased baking sheet, about 2 inches apart.
Bake on center rack of oven for 18-20 minutes until golden brown. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Drizzle rolls with reserved icing and enjoy.Preheat oven to 350°F. Remove cinnamon rolls from package and transfer to a large cutting board or workspace, reserve icing.Gently separate and unravel cinnamon rolls until you have long strips of dough. Gently roll the dough strips back into their cinnamon roll shape and place on an ungreased baking sheet, about 2 inches apart.Bake on center rack of oven for 18-20 minutes until golden brown. Remove from oven and let cool slightly. Drizzle rolls with reserved icing and enjoy.
title: Peanut Butter & Jelly Cinnamon Rolls

ingredients: 1 TJ's Six Piece Organic Chicken Family Pack
2 tablespoons TJ's Spanish Extra Virgin Olive Oil
2 large TJ's Sweet White Onions, roughly sliced (about 4 cups)
1 jar TJ's Spanish Manzanilla Olives with Pemento Paste
2 tablespoons, Baker Joseph's All Purpose White Flour
1/2 bag TJ's Jasmine White Rice, cooked
directions: Rinse and thoroughly pat dry the chicken parts. Sprinkle them liberally with salt and fresh ground pepper. In a large sauté pan, over medium-high flame, combine butter and olive oil and heat until butter has melted. Brown the chicken in two separate batches. Remove chicken from the pan. Lower flame to medium and add sliced onion and ginger. Saute for 8 minutes, stirring frequently. Chop 20 olives and add to the onion and ginger mixture. Saute for 1 minute. Add flour, cumin, cayenne pepper and cinnamon and cook for another minute, stirring constantly. Add the chicken broth, lemon juice and dates, scraping the pan to loosen browned bits. Bring to a slow boil and return the browned chicken to the pan. Cover and reduce heat to a simmer. Continue cooking for another 45 minutes and serve over prepared rice.Rinse and thoroughly pat dry the chicken parts. Sprinkle them liberally with salt and fresh ground pepper. In a large sauté pan, over medium-high flame, combine butter and olive oil and heat until butter has melted. Brown the chicken in two separate batches. Remove chicken from the pan. Add flour, cumin, cayenne pepper and cinnamon and cook for another minute, stirring constantly. Add the chicken broth, lemon juice and dates, scraping the pan to loosen browned bits. Bring to a slow boil and return the browned chicken to the pan. Cover and reduce heat to a simmer. Continue cooking for another 45 minutes and serve over prepared rice.
title: Braised Chicken

ingredients: 1 cup TJ's Organic Raw Blue Agave Syrup
1 cup TJ's Organic Creamy Peanut Butter (salted style suggested)
7 cups TJ's Organic Crisp Rice Cereal
directions:
Combine brown sugar and blue agave syrup in saucepan and bring to a near boil, stirring often. Continue stirring until brown sugar dissolves. Remove from heat. 
Add peanut butter to mixture. Mix well. Add Organic Crisp Rice Cereal. Mix well. If desired, add chocolate chips, then mix well again.
Press the mixture into 13 x 9 x 2-inch greased baking pan. Refrigerate for several hours to cool and harden. To harden more quickly, place in freezer for about an hour.
Remove from pan and cut into squares. Enjoy!Combine brown sugar and blue agave syrup in saucepan and bring to a near boil, stirring often. Continue stirring until brown sugar dissolves. Remove from heat.Add peanut butter to mixture. Mix well. Add Organic Crisp Rice Cereal. Mix well. If desired, add chocolate chips, then mix well again.Press the mixture into 13 x 9 x 2-inch greased baking pan. Refrigerate for several hours to cool and harden. To harden more quickly, place in freezer for about an hour.Remove from pan and cut into squares. Enjoy!
title: No-Bake Peanut Butter Chocolate Crisp Rice Cereal Treats

directions:
Place meatballs in a large microwave-safe container with lid. Microwave 4 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, heat barbeque sauce on low, stirring occasionally.
Remove bowl of meatballs from microwave. Add meatballs to saucepan and stir to coat with sauce. Continue to heat on low, about 3 minutes, until sauce is bubbly.
Transfer meatballs and sauce to a serving bowl. Garnish with chives and chili flakes to taste, and dig in!Place meatballs in a large microwave-safe container with lid. ingredients: 1 bag TJ's Party Size Mini Meatballs
1 bottle TJ's Carolina Gold Barbeque Sauce
title: Good As Gold Mini Meatballs

ingredients: 3 tbsp TJ's Champagne Pear Vinaigrette with Gorgonzola
4 TJ's Multi-Grain or Honey Wheat Hamburger Buns
title: Crunchy Chicken Sandwich
directions: Mix broccoli slaw, cilantro and vinaigrette. Heat chicken burgers according to package directions. Place one burger on each bun bottom. Top burger with slaw mixture and close bun. Enjoy!Mix broccoli slaw, cilantro and vinaigrette. Heat chicken burgers according to package directions. Place one burger on each bun bottom. Top burger with slaw mixture and close bun. Enjoy!

title: Mango, Mango Frozen Cheesecake
directions:
Grind coconut cashews, soft and juicy mango, coconut oil, and salt in a blender or a food processor for about a minute, or until the mixture coarsely comes together. Flatten the mixture out on the bottom of an 8-inch non-stick spring form pan.
Chill crust in fridge while the filling is made. Blend mango, lemon juice and honey. Add mascarpone and mango Greek yogurt; blend until uniform color. Pour filling over chilled crust and freeze for at least two hours.
Remove from freezer ten minutes before serving. Top cheesecake with fresh mango and strawberries, garnish with coconut flakes and mint sprigs. Serve immediately.Grind coconut cashews, soft and juicy mango, coconut oil, and salt in a blender or a food processor for about a minute, or until the mixture coarsely comes together. Top cheesecake with fresh mango and strawberries, garnish with coconut flakes and mint sprigs. Serve immediately.
ingredients: ¾ cup TJ's Soft & Juicy Dried Mango
2 tbsp TJ's Organic Virgin Coconut Oil
a pinch of TJ's Sea Salt, to taste
2 cups (roughly 3 Mangoes) TJ's Mango, peeled, pitted & coarsely chopped
1 container TJ's Mango Greek Nonfat Yogurt
a few sprigs of TJ's Organic Mint, to garnish
a sprinkling of TJ's Organic Flaked Coconut, to garnish
2 Packages TJ's Peruvian Style Chimichurri Rice with Vegetables
title: Chimichurri Stir-Fry
directions:
Slice sausage into coins. Add a small amount of oil to a large skillet over medium heat and pan fry sausage for 7 to 9 minutes flipping halfway through, until browned on both sides. Remove sausage from pan and let cool slightly.
Add broccoli and 3 tablespoons of water to the same pan, cover and cook over medium heat for 5 minutes. Remove cover, add Chimichurri rice and two additional tablespoons of water and stir. Cook over medium heat for 5 additional minutes, or until rice is hot, stirring occasionally.
Add sausage back to pan and cook a minute more to warm through. Spoon into serving bowls and enjoy.Slice sausage into coins. Add a small amount of oil to a large skillet over medium heat and pan fry sausage for 7 to 9 minutes flipping halfway through, until browned on both sides. Remove sausage from pan and let cool slightly.Add broccoli and 3 tablespoons of water to the same pan, cover and cook over medium heat for 5 minutes. Remove cover, add Chimichurri rice and two additional tablespoons of water and stir. Cook over medium heat for 5 additional minutes, or until rice is hot, stirring occasionally.Add sausage back to pan and cook a minute more to warm through. Spoon into serving bowls and enjoy.

title: Falafel Waffles
directions:
In a large bowl, combine falafel mix and water. Cover and let sit 1 hour. Stir in 1 tablespoon sunflower oil.
Preheat waffle iron. Scoop 1/3 of the batter onto the center of the waffle iron and spread evenly with a spatula toward the edges. Close waffle iron and cook 12 minutes, until golden brown. Remove waffle from iron and repeat process two more times (you'll end up with three large waffles).
To serve, garnish waffles with chopped peppers and parsley, a drizzle of tahini and a squeeze of lemon.In a large bowl, combine falafel mix and water. Cover and let sit 1 hour. Stir in 1 tablespoon sunflower oil.Preheat waffle iron. Scoop 1/3 of the batter onto the center of the waffle iron and spread evenly with a spatula toward the edges. Close waffle iron and cook 12 minutes, until golden brown. Remove waffle from iron and repeat process two more times (you'll end up with three large waffles).To serve, garnish waffles with chopped peppers and parsley, a drizzle of tahini and a squeeze of lemon.
ingredients: TJ's Roasted Red Peppers, drained and chopped
1 wedge TJ's 12-Month Aged Manchego Añejo, cubed
6 slices TJ's Prosciutto, sliced in half lengthwise
TJ's Whole Grain Dijon Mustard and TJ's Honey (optional), to serve
directions:
Fold a slice of prosciutto back and forth on itself to create a ruffled look. Gently skewer the folded prosciutto with a toothpick, followed by a fig half and a cube of cheese. Repeat assembly process with remaining ingredients.
Serve alone or with TJ's Whole Grain Dijon Mustard and your favorite TJs Honey for dipping.Fold a slice of prosciutto back and forth on itself to create a ruffled look. Gently skewer the folded prosciutto with a toothpick, followed by a fig half and a cube of cheese. Repeat assembly process with remaining ingredients.Serve alone or with TJ's Whole Grain Dijon Mustard and your favorite TJs Honey for dipping.
title: Manchego Fig Bites

ingredients: 2 Tbsp TJ's Extra Virgin Olive Oil
directions: Combine all ingredients in a resealable bag. Place in refrigerator to marinate for at least 4 hours (preferably overnight). Remove chicken and excess marinade and let drumsticks come to room temperature. Grill drumsticks on medium-high heat for about 30 minutes, flipping every 5 minutes until juices run clear or until internal temperature reaches 165. Let rest 10 minutes before serving. Enjoy! Serving suggestion: Serve with TJ's Green Beans and Buttermilk Biscuits.
title: Buttermilk Drumsticks
Grilled Caprese on Cauliflower Crust
directions:
Cauliflower Crust
Preheat oven to 425º.
Pour cauliflower into a pyrex pie dish; microwave on high for 5 minutes; take out and stir—repeat 3 times (total time in microwave = 20 minutes). Spread the heated cauliflower over a large piece of parchment paper or clean dish towel and let cool completely.
Add eggs, salt and pepper to a large mixing bowl and whip. Pour in cauliflower and cheese; mix well.
Line a quarter-sized sheet pan (about 9 1/2” x 13” x 1”) with parchment paper and spread the cauliflower mixture evenly across the pan. Place in oven for 25 minutes; remove when the cauliflower is baked to a golden brown on top. Allow to cool completely in the pan.
Cut into sandwich slices. Use right away or refrigerate or freeze until ready to use. (Once refrigerated or frozen, place in a 350ºF oven for 6 to 10 minutes to bring to room temperature before serving or using in recipes.)
Grilled Caprese
Taking two slices of the prepared Cauliflower Crust, spray one side of each slice of crust with canola oil, and place the slices (sprayed-side down) on a clean working surface.
On each crust, layer on two slices of mozzarella. On one crust, atop the cheese, layer the tomato, and the basil. Carefully sandwich the crusts.
Heat a large fry pan or griddle over medium heat until hot. Place the sandwich on the pan and reduce the heat to medium-low. After about a minute, cover the pan with a large lid, and let it cook for about 2-3 minutes more, until the bottom is golden brown. Flip the sandwich and let it cook for 3-4 more minutes (covering again after 1 minute to encourage the melt), until cheese is melting.
Transfer the sandwiches to a cutting board and cut in half. Serve immediately.Cauliflower Crust

ingredients: 1 ¼ cup TJ's Lite Shredded Mozzarella
½ cup TJ's Fresh Basil Leaves
